loans.name: Antonio Vicente

texts.es:
Antonio Vicente C. M. is 60 years old. He is married and has a 20 year old son. They live in San Miguel canton, in the province of Bolivar.

Antonio is a member of the rural loan group called “Hope of the sower”, which is located 2 hours away from San Miguel. There are 14 group members, who are dedicated to agriculture: corn, beans, potatoes and blackberries mostly.

Antonio works in agriculture. He cultivates blackberries, corn, beans and peas. He purchases and sells his products in the town of San Pablo (an hour away from where he lives). Blackberries sell weekly, and other crops once a year (after harvest)

Antonio is asking for this loan to purchase fertilizers to fight crop diseases. His dream is to enable his child to study. He faces major challenges with crop diseases, such as “lanchas” in corn and beans, that endanger the harvest

He likes to work.
texts.en:
Antonio Vicente C. M. is 60 years old. He is married and has a 20 year old son. They live in San Miguel canton, in the province of Bolivar. Antonio is a member of the rural loan group called “Hope of the sower”, which is located 2 hours away from San Miguel. There are 14 group members, who are dedicated to agriculture: corn, beans, potatoes and blackberries mostly. Antonio works in agriculture. He cultivates blackberries, corn, beans and peas. He purchases and sells his products in the town of San Pablo (an hour away from where he lives). Blackberries sell weekly, and other crops once a year (after harvest) Antonio is asking for this loan to purchase fertilizers to fight crop diseases. His dream is to enable his child to study. He faces major challenges with crop diseases, such as “lanchas” in corn and beans, that endanger the harvest He likes to work.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Mujeres Latinas Group

texts.es:
LILIANA TIENE 27 AÑOS, TIENE UN NIÑO DE TRES AÑITOS. ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO "MUJERES LATINAS" FORMADO POR 8 INTEGRANTES, QUIENES VIVEN EN EL DISTRITO DE CARABAYLLO.
HACE UN AÑO LILIANA TRABNAJA DE FORMA INDEPENDIENTE, MANEJANDO SU PROPIO NEGOCIO, INICIÓ VENDIENDO SOLO MAZAMORRA, POCO A POCO LA GENTE LE PREGUNTABA POR ALGO DE COMER POR LO QUE DECIDIÓ INCURSIONAR EN LA VENTA DE ANTICUCHOS. DESDE UN COMIENZO SE UBICÓ EN LA PUERTA DE SU DOMICILIO, ESE ES SU LUGAR DE VENTA. SU NEGOCIO HA CRECIDO Y HA AUMENTADO SU CLIENTELA.
GRACIAS A ÉSTE NEGOCIO ELLA PUEDE MANTENER A SU PEQUEÑO HIJO YA QUE ELLA ES PADRE Y MADRE PARA SU HIJO.
SU PROXIMA META A LOGRAR ES PONER UN RESTAURANTE.
CON EL PRÉSTAMO RECIBIDO INVERTIRÁ EN LA COMPRA DE INSUMOS PARA INCREMENTAR A SU NEGOCIO LA VENTA DE SANGUCHES Y POLLOS BROASTER.
texts.en:
Liliana is 27 years old and has a three year old son. She is part of the group, “Mujeres Latinas” (Latin American Women), made up of 8 members who all live in the Carabayllo district. Liliana has been running her own business for the past year. She began by selling Mazamorra (a typical dessert in Latin America), but little by little people began requesting food, so she decided to start selling kabobs as well. Her business is set up outside her front door, where she makes her sales; it has grown and her customers have increased. Thanks to this business, she is able to support her young son, as she is both mother and father to him. He next goal is to open a restaurant. She will use the money from this loan to buy ingredients so that she can expand her business and begin selling sandwiches and broasted chicken.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Maria Tomasa Amalia

texts.es:
Señora María Tomasa Amalia S. B. es socia del banco comunal Zhidmad, que se encuentra ubicada al sur occidente del cantón Gualaceo, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y  ganadería,  lo que producen es para su consumo. La población femenina se dedica al tejido  de sombreros de paja toquilla, a la elaboración de chompas de lana y al bordado de polleras (faldas) y blusas.

Nuestra socia tiene 51 años de edad,vive en unión libre y tiene 3 hijos, su primera hija es casada, la segunda es soltera y trabaja, las dos viven independientemente, vive con su pequeña hija de 8 años y su esposo se dedica a la construcción, con el trabajo de los dos  han  logrado construir su casa propia.

Nuestra socia se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar, a la cría de  animalitos como: pollos, cuyes, chanchos y ganado, con la leche que obtiene de sus vaquitas hace quesillos (queso tierno) para la venta,  también se dedica a la agricultura y los productos los vende  en su propia comunidad.

Es una de las socias fundadoras del banco comunal Zhidmad y los créditos le han servido para adquirir sus animales, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más ganado.

Su meta es crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria Tomasa Amalia S. is a member of the Zhidmad Communal Bank. Zhidmad is located in the southwestern area of the Gualaceo canton. Its people engage in agriculture and stockbreeding, and what they produce is for their own consumption. Women also weave Panama hats made from the fibers of the “toquilla” plant, produce woolen sweaters and embroider “polleras” (a type of skirt) and blouses. Tomasa is 51 years old, she lives in a common law marriage and has three children. Her eldest daughter is married, the second is single and has a job of her own, and they both independently; Tomasa lives with her youngest daughter, aged 8, and her husband, who engages in constructions. Thanks to hers and her husband’s joint efforts, they have succeeded in building a house of their own. She engages in housework and in the breeding of small animals such as chickens, “cuyes” (“cuy” is Quechua for Guinea pig), pigs and cows. With the milk she gets from her cows she prepares fresh cheese that she then sells; she also engages in agriculture and sells her products to her own community. She is one of the charter members of the Zhidmad Communal Bank, and she has used the loans to buy her animals; the new loan she is requesting will be used to buy more cattle. Her goal is making her activity grow.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Ariosto Alcivar

texts.en:
Ariosto Alcivar V. P. is 35 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and 3 children, aged 5, 12 and 14, in San Miguel canton, in the province of Bolivar.

Ariosto is a member of the rural loan group called “Hope of the sower”, which is located 2 hours away from San Miguel. There are 14 group members, who are dedicated to agriculture: corn, beans, potatoes and blackberries mostly.

Ariosto works in agriculture. He cultivates blackberries, corn, wheat, potatoes, tomatoes, beans and peas. He purchases and sells his products in the town of San Pablo (an hour away from where he lives). Blackberries and tomatoes sell weekly, and other crops once a year.

Ariosto is asking for this loan to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizers for his crops. He hopes this credit will help him produce more to be able to repay . He also would like to be able to work in the business of selling animals.  His dream is to enable his children to study and provide them with a better life. He faces major challenges with crop diseases, such as “lanchas” in corn and beans, that endanger the harvest.

He likes to play indoor soccer and volleyball.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, compost and fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Qhantati Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal QHANTATI es una asociación que está renovando crédito por segunda vez, está compuesta por doce mujeres, tiene como presidenta a la señora Toribia A. de Cusi.

La mencionada asociación comunal pertenece al Centro Focal de Los Andes.  La señora Toribia tiene como negocio la venta de “Tostado”, de acuerdo a las costumbres es muy común tostar: maíz, arbeja, maní, haba, soya, como otro tipo de golosina muy apreciado por niños y adultos. 

Su primer crédito fue de Bs.2000.- y en este segundo ciclo la asociación le ha aprobado Bs.3000.-, ella indica que servirá para la compra de insumos.
 
Las  integrantes de la asociación comunal tienen negocios como el de Tejido de Mantas, artesanía, venta de chicharrón, tejido de mantas, tienda surtida, venta de tostado, elaboración de Disfraces y tienda de barrio
texts.en:
The Qhantati Communal Bank is an association that is renewing a loan for the second time. It is comprised of 12 women, and Toribia A. de Cusi is the president. This communal bank belongs to the Los Andes central office. Toribia has a business selling “Tostado”. According to custom it is very common to toast corn, peas, peanuts, beans, and soy as a type of sweet that is much enjoyed by children and adults. Her first loan was for 2,000 BOB. In this second cycle the Asociación has approved 3,000 BOB. She indicates that she will use it to buy supplies. The members of the communal bank have businesses like weaving blankets, handicrafts, selling “chicarrones” (fried pork rinds), a fully-stocked store, selling tostado, making costumes, and a neighborhood store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy grains wholesale

loans.name: Simon Bolivar

texts.en:
Simon Bolivar V. R. is 64 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and 2 children, aged 20 and 22, in San Miguel canton, in the province of Bolivar. He is also the grandfather of 2 boys and a girl

Simon is a member of the rural loan group called “Hope of the sower”, which is located 2 hours away from San Miguel. There are 14 group members, who are dedicated to agriculture: corn, beans, potatoes and blackberries mostly.

Simon works in agriculture. He cultivates blackberries, corn, beans and peas. He purchases on Fridays and sells his products on Sundays in the town of San Pablo (an hour away from where he lives). Blackberries sell weekly, and other crops once a year.

Simon is asking for this loan to purchase compost and fertilizers for his blackberries and to buy land. He hopes this credit will help him to buy what he needs and pay for his children's studies. His dream is to enable his grandchildren to study and to purchase land to cultivate. He faces major challenges with crop diseases, such as “lanchas” in corn and beans, that endanger the harvest

He likes to dance and sing in his free time.

loans.use: To purchase compost and fertilizers for his blackberries and to buy land

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana C. G. is 23 years old. She lives in a common-law relationship, with her 3-year-old kid named Fernando, in San Miguel canton, in the province of Bolivar.

Diana is a member of the rural loan group called “Hope of the sower”, which is located 2 hours away from San Miguel. There are 14 group members, who are dedicated to agriculture: corn, beans, potatoes and blackberries mostly.

Diana is a farmer who grows blackberries, corn, and beans. She purchases and sells her products in the town of San Pablo (an hour away from where she lives). Blackberries sell weekly, and other crops once a year.

Diana is requesting this loan to invest in agriculture: to buy compost and fertilizers. She thinks the credit will help her invest more. Her dream is to purchase a house. She faces major challenges with crop diseases, such as “lanchas” in corn and beans, that endanger the harvest. She lacks money for her family

She likes to sew and take care of her animals in her free time.

loans.use: To buy compost and fertilizers

loans.name: Simon Bolivar

texts.en:
Simon Bolivar V. P. is 22 years old. He is single and lives with his parents in San Miguel canton, in the province of Bolivar.

Simon is a member of the rural loan group called “Hope of the sower”, which is located 2 hours away from San Miguel. There are 14 group members, who are dedicated to agriculture: corn, beans, potatoes and blackberries mostly.

Simon works in agriculture. He cultivates blackberries, corn, beans and peas. He purchases and sells his products in the town of San Pablo (an hour away from where he lives). Blackberries sell weekly, and other crops once a year.

Simon is asking for this loan to purchase seeds and compost for his blackberries. He hopes this credit will help him to buy what he needs to move forward. His dream is to purchase land and help with his nephew's studies. He faces major challenges with crop diseases, such as “lanchas” in corn and beans, that endanger the harvest

He likes to play volleyball and indoor soccer.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and compost for his blackberries

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura es casada y tiene 4 hijos D. los cuales 2 estudian, Maura venD. alfalfa D. casa en casa y tiendas, su producto lo adquiere D. los productores a donD. viaja por las tardes y por las mañanas venD.. Maura necesita un préstamo D. 1600 soles para la compra D. alfalfa.
Maura es socia del Banco Comunal Sarita.
El sueño D. Maura es que sus hijos sean profesionales y comprar un carro para que su hijo trabaje.
texts.en:
Maura is married and has 4 children, 2 of whom are in school. Maura sells home-grown alfalfa from her house and in stores. She acquires the product from the farmers that she visits in the afternoons. In the mornings, she sells. Maura needs a loan of 1600 Nuevos soles in order to buy alfalfa. Maura is a member of the Sarita Communal Bank. Maura’s dream is for her children to have professions and to buy a car in order for her son to be able to work.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy alfalfa.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La Señora María Elena L. es socia del banco comunal Zhidmad, que se encuentra ubicada al sur occidente del cantón Gualaceo, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y  ganadería, lo que producen es para su consumo. La población femenina se dedica al tejido de sombreros de paja toquilla, a la elaboración de chompas de lana y al bordado de polleras (faldas) y blusas.

Nuestra socia se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y  a la cría de animales especialmente de ganado, con la leche que obtiene elabora quesillos(queso tierno) que los que vende en la ciudad de Cuenca, también trabaja en el agricultura labrando la tierra.

Nuestra tiene 33 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 11, 8, 5 y 3 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos estudian en una escuela de la localidad, su esposo trabaja como albañil y gracias al trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Es una socia fundadora y los créditos le han ayudado para los gastos de su hogar y para la compra de animales.

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en  la compra de ganado y su meta es superarse y crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Elena L. is a member of the Zhidmad communal bank which is located in the south of the Gualaceo territory. The people are farmers and raise cattle. What they produce is for their own consumption. The women make straw hats, woolen sweaters and embroider skirts and blouses. Our member is works around the house and raises animals, especially cattle. She uses the milk to make fresh cheeses that she sells in the city of Cuenca. She also works in farming and cultivates the land. Our member is 33 years old, married with 4 children ages 11, 8, 5 and 3. Her first three children study at the local school. Her husband is a bricklayer. Thanks to their joint efforts, they have been able to build their own house. She is a founding member and the loans have been put towards her household expenses and buying animals. This new loan will be used to buy cattle. Her dream is to improve and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma pertenece al Banco Comunal Sarita.
Vilma es casada y tiene 4 hijos, Vilma junto a su pareja tienen una tienda en un local alquilado en donde vende loceria, plastiqueria, utensilios de cocina, para lo cual cuenta con 2 personas para la venta, además reparte por mayor a las tiendas, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima. Vilma solicita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ollas.
El sueño de Vilma es tener local propio y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Vilma belongs to the Sarita Communal Bank. Vilma is married and has four children. Vilma and her life partner have a store in a rented location where they sell china, plastic goods, and kitchen utensils. They have two people helping with sales. Also, she deals wholesale with the stores. She gets their products in the city of Lima. Vilma is requesting a loan for 2,000 soles to buy pots. Vilma’s dream is to have her own place and that her children finish their education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pots

loans.name: David Mauricio

texts.en:
David Mauricio C. G. is 28 years old. He is in a common-law relationship, and lives with his 2 children, aged 5 and 7, in the province of Bolivar.

David is a member of the rural loan group called “Hope of the sower”, which is located 2 hours away from San Miguel. There are 14 group members, who are dedicated to agriculture: corn, beans, potatoes and blackberries mostly.

David works in agriculture. He cultivates blackberries, corn and beans. He also raises cattle for milk consumption of the family (he has 8 cows). He purchases and sells his products in the town of San Pablo (an hour away from where he lives). Blackberries sell weekly, and other crops once a year.

David is asking for this loan to invest in fishes (trout) to diversify his source of income, and to buy compost and fertilizers for his crops. He hopes the credit will help him get a good production. 

His dream is to have a house and enable his children to study. He faces major challenges with crop diseases, such as “lanchas” in corn and beans, that endanger the harvest

He likes playing sports, particularly volleyball and soccer.

loans.use: To invest in fishes (trout) to diversify his source of income and to buy compost and fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.es:
Maria es casada y tiene 3 hijos que estudian en la universidad, Maria junto a su familia se dedican a la elaboración de precocidos de menestras, carnes, actividad que realiza en la madrugada, además Maria elabora gelatina de pata, que es preparado con pata de ganado vacuno que es sancochado por horas para que suelte su gelatina, sus ventas los realiza caminando por las calles y también a pedido.
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Sarita y solicita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña y azúcar.
Maria sueña con ampliar su negocio y terminar de pagar la casa que compro en la ciudad de Lima.
texts.en:
María is married and has three children who are studying in the university. Together with her family María sells prepared meals and meats. She does her work at daybreak. She also prepares “gelatina de pata” which is prepared with cow’s hooves that are boiled for hours so that the collagen is released. She sells it in an itinerant fashion but also based on prior orders. María is a member of the Sarita communal bank and is asking for a 2000 sol loan to buy sugar and firewood. María dreams with expanding her business and with paying off her house that she bought in the city of Lima.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar and firewood.

loans.name: Fabiola Lidubina

texts.en:
Fabiola Lidubina T. T., 46 years old, is married and lives with her husband and 3 children, 12, 17 and 21, in San Miguel canton, in the province of Bolivar.

Fabiola is a member of the rural loan group called “Hope of the sower”, which is located 2 hours away from San Miguel. The 14 group members are dedicated to agriculture: corn, beans, potatoes and blackberries mostly.

Fabiola cultivates blackberries, potatoes, corn, beans, peas and vegetables, only for family consumption. She purchases and sells her products in the town of San Pablo (an hour away from where she lives). Blackberries sell weekly, and other crops once a year.

Fabiola is asking for a loan to purchase fertilizers and sprays to fight crop diseases. She also wants to diversify and start a business of purchasing and selling pigs. She thinks the credit will help her purchase what she needs to grow her products: seeds, fertilizers, and also to diversify, since she is losing her crops with diseases. She faces major challenges with crop diseases, such as “lanchas,” in corn and beans, that endanger the harvest. She fears she may lose most of her harvest.

Fabiola's dream is to move forward and enable her children to study (send them to University). She likes to knit and watch television in her spare time.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and sprays to fight crop disease.

loans.name: Gabe Abelina

texts.es:
Gabe es conviviente tiene 2 hijos que estudian, Gabe vende ropa interior en un puesto del mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, negocio que inicio hace 3 años, antes se dedicaba a la venta de especerías en las ferias actividad que dejo de realizar para estar cerca de sus hijos, la venta de ropa inicio como ambulante y ahora tiene un local estable.
Gabe es socia del Banco comunal Sarita hace 12 años y ahora solicita un préstamo de 2200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de medias.
Los sueños de Gabe son tener una tienda y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Gabe is in a common-law marriage. She has two children who go to school. Gabe sells underwear in a stand at the suppliers’ market in city in Ayacucho. She started the business three years ago. Before that she sold spices at the fairs. She left that work to be able to be close to her children. She started selling clothes in an itinerant manner, and now she has a stable location. Gabe has been a member of the Sarita Communal Bank for 12 years. She is now requesting a loan for 2,200 soles to buy hosiery. Gabe’s dreams are to have a store and for her children to complete their education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hosiery

loans.name: Jose Vinicio

texts.en:
Jose Vinicio A. R., 40 years old, is in a common law relationship and has 2 children, aged 7 and 8. He lives in the province of Bolivar.

Jose is a member of a rural loan group called “Hope of the sower”, which is located 2 hours away from San Miguel. The 14 group members are dedicated to agriculture: corn, beans, potatoes and blackberries mostly.

Jose cultivates blackberries, corn and beans. He purchases and sells his products in the town of San Pablo (an hour away from where he lives). Blackberries sell weekly, and other crops once a year. He faces major challenges with crop diseases, such as “lanchas,” in corn, that endanger the harvest.

Jose is asking for a loan to invest in agriculture: seeds, compost and fertilizers and for his house. He thinks the loan will impact his work, his family, and his whole life positively.

Jose's dream is to enable his children to study. He likes to play sports: volleyball and soccer.

loans.use: To invest in agriculture: seeds, compost and fertilizers.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Maria pertenece al Banco comunal Sarita y durante el tiempo que esta en su Banco aprendió a ahorrar además que los prestamos le ayudan en su negocio.
Maria es viuda y tiene 4 hijos que estudian, Maria vende loceria de manera ambulante en el mercado Nery García, también viaja a las ferias y reparte de casa en casa, su mayor sueño es tener un puesto estable como un kiosco para vender sus productos. Además Maria por campañas vende otros productos como mochilas en época escolar. Maria necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de ollas, platos, tazas.
Maria tiene proyectado comprar una mototaxi para que su hijo trabaje.
texts.en:
María is a member of Sarita communal bank. While a member she has learned how to save and that loans are a help to her business. María is a widow and has four children who are students. She sells kitchenware ambling though Nery García market. She also goes to the various other markets and also sells door-to-door. Her greatest wish is to have a stable stand, like a kiosk, to sell her products. During certain sales periods, like back-to-school, she also sells appropriate articles like backpacks, for example. She needs a 1000 sol loan to buy pots, dishes and cups. María plans to buy a mototaxi (three wheel vehicle used to provide passenger and cargo transportation services) so that her son can work.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pots, dishes and cups.

loans.name: Julio Alfredo

texts.es:
Julio tiene 35 años de edad, reside en el Municipio de Delicias de Concepción, departamento de Morazán, está acompañado, vive con la esposa y dos hijos de las edades de 10y 5 años, se dedica al cultivo de la tierra (siembra de maíz y frijoles).
Hace 5 años se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijoles lo cual lo realiza con su familia, trabaja para solventar las necesidades básicas de la familia, solicita un préstamo para compra de insumos agrícolas que le permita obtener una buena cosecha.
Los sueños son mejorar la vivienda donde reside con la familia, apoyar a los hijos con la educación, mejorar las condiciones de vida de la familia.
texts.en:
Julio, 35, lives in Delicias de Concepción, Morazán department, with his wife and two children who are 10 and 5 years of age. He is a bean and corn farmer. He has grown beans and corn for the last five years, a task he does together with his family. He works to meet the family’s basic needs and is asking for funds to buy farming supplies that will make a good harvest possible. His dreams are to improve the dwelling he shares with his family, to provide his children with an education, and to improve the family’s living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina pertenece al Banco comunal Sarita y lo que mas le agrada son las reuniones con sus consocias con quienes comparten sus vivencias y alegrías.
Delfina es casada y tiene 5 hijos el mayor de 26 años y el menor de 9 años, todos estudiantes. Delfina vende ropa a pedido que reparte de casa en casa, negocios y familiares, sus productos los adquiere de la ciudad de Lima. Además Delfina viaja a la selva ayacuchana en donde vende quesos que adquiere en la comunidad de Sachabamba. Delfina solicita un préstamo de 1200 soles para la compra de chompas.
Delfina sueña con tener una tienda estable y vender por mayor.
texts.en:
Delfina is a member of the Sarita communal bank. What she enjoys the most is the get togethers with her fellow members to share anecdotes and joys. Delfina is married and has five children. The oldest is 26 years old and the youngest is 9. All are students. Delfina sells clothing that her customers have ordered from her. She delivers the items door-to-door both to family homes and to businesses. She gets her products in the city of Lima. In addition, Delfina goes to the Ayacucho backcountry to sell cheeses she gets in Sachabamba. She is asking for a 1200 sol loan to buy sweaters. Delfina dreams with having a stable store and to be a wholesaler.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sweaters.

loans.name: Raul Napoleon

texts.en:
Raul Napoleon V. M. is 40 years old. He is married and lives with his 6 children, aged from 2 to 19, in the province of Bolivar.

Raul is a member of the rural loan group called “Hope of the sower”, which is located 2 hours away from San Miguel. There are 14 group members, who are dedicated to agriculture: corn, beans, potatoes and blackberries mostly.

Raul works in agriculture. He cultivates blackberries, corn, potatoes and beans. He purchases and sells his products in cities of Guaranda and Montalvo (more than 2 hours away from where he lives). Blackberries sell weekly, and other crops every 8 months

Raul is asking for this loan to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizers. He thinks the loan is a great help to his work. His dream is to have enough to eat and more credit. He faces major challenges with crop diseases, such as “lanchas” in corn, that endanger the harvest. He also has health problems in the family.

He likes sports such as playing volleyball and soccer.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, compost and fertilizers

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.es:
Dionisia es soltera y tiene un hijo de 13 años, Dionisia vende ropa de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Nery García, actividad que realiza desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 12 del mediodía y por las tardes se dedica a la atención de sus hijos, además viaja a las diferentes ferias. Solicita un crédito de 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de chompas, buzos, polos.
Dionisia es socia del Banco comunal Sarita y lo que mas le agrada son los talleres Gals y los incentivos para ahorrar.
Dionisia vive en casa de su abuelita y su mayor sueño es tener una casa propia además de que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Dionisia is single and has a 13-year-old son. She peddles clothing in the Nery García market from 6am until noon. Afternoons are dedicated to child care. She also goes to various markets. She is asking for a 2500 sol loan to buy sweaters, t-shirts and polo-type shirts. Dionisia is a member of the Sarita communal bank. What she enjoys most are the GALS (gender equality) workshops and savings incentives. Dionisia lives in her grandmother’s house and her greatest wish is to own her own home and that her children complete their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sweaters, t-shirts, polo-type shirts.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana pertenece al Banco comunal Sarita y lo que mas le agrada son las capacitaciones y los ahorros voluntarios además que la distraen mucho las reuniones.
Ana es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo de 2 años, Ana tiene un puesto en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad en donde vende verduras, actividad que realiza desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 12 del mediodía. Además Ana junto a su esposo tienen una mototaxi con la cual trabaja su esposo. Ana solicita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de zapallo y limón.
Ana vive en casa alquilada y desea tener casa propia, tener un carro para que trabaje su esposo.
texts.en:
Ana belongs to the Sarita community bank and what she likes best are the the skills she has picked up and saving. She also enjoys the meetings. Ana is partnered and has a 2-year old son. She operates a stand in the city's Abasto market where she sells vegetables, work that she does from 5 in the morning until noon. She and her husband also operate a moto-taxi business. Ana is applying for a 1600-soles loan that she use to buy pumpkins and lemons for resale. Ana lives in a rented house and she would like to have a house of her own. She also has a "carro" (car or cart?) for her husband's work.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 43 años, vive con su hijo y sus padres ya ancianos en casa de ellos. Hace más de 2 años  se dedica en la atención de su propia tienda que se encuentra instalada en su misma casa. Desde entonces sus padres la ayudan en la atención hacia sus clientes, puesto que a veces tiene que ir a sus campos agrícolas a sembrar. La decisión de tener una tienda, fue porque necesitaba un ingreso más y poder superar con mayor facilidad los atrasos que pueda tener en la agricultura. Su tienda se mantiene abierta todo el día a disponibilidad del cliente, procurando además de proveerse de varios productos para cumplir con la demanda de sus compradores. Hasta el momento considera que su tienda es medianamente rentable pero con la constancia y dedicación que tiene proyecta su tienda como una de las más abarrotadas y llenas en productos de primera necesidad. Es su octavo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo  comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de más productos como leche, azúcar, arroz y algunas menestras para abastecer su tienda.
texts.en:
Luz is 43 años and lives with her son and her elderly parents in their house. For more than 2 years, she has worked running her own store, which is installed in the same house. During this time, her parents have also helped her serve customers, since she sometimes has to go out to her agricultural fields to plant. The decision to operate a store came because she needed another source of income, so that she could more easily overcome the setbacks that tend to occur in agriculture. Her store is open all day for the customers' convenience, and it offers a wide range of products to satisfy buyers' needs. At present, Luz considers that her store is moderately profitable, but with her dedication and perseverance, she believes that it will become one of the best-stocked stores for basic necessities. This is her eighth loan with MFP, and she is very happy to know that she has a source of financial support, since she has always shown herself to be responsible with her payments. She is also happy to be part of her communal bank, because all of its members are responsible people with a strong sense of solidarity. She is grateful to all of the people who will make this loan possible; it will be very useful to her in the progress of her business. With the loan she is requesting, she will invest in buying more products, such as milk, sugar, rice, and some varieties of beans, to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying milk, rice, sugar and beans to stock her store

loans.name: Quisirmitas Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal “Quisirmitas” (hormiguitas en Aymara) es una asociación que solicita crédito por primera vez, está compuesta por ocho mujeres y un varón, tienen como presidenta a la señora Bertha M.. La mencionada asociación comunal pertenece al Centro Focal de Los Andes.  

La señora Bertha tiene como negocio la venta de medias, desde hace 10 años.  Su puesto está ubicado en la Zona 16 de Julio, sobre la avenida Panorámica. 

Este primer crédito es por Bs.2000.- ella indica que servirá para la compra de mercadería, cuanto más surtido está el puesto mejor sería la venta.
 
Las  integrantes de la asociación comunal tienen negocios como el de Tejido de polainas y gorros, tienda de conservas, tienda surtida, producción de lana de alpaca, venta de ropa, venta de pescado y tienda de barrio.
texts.en:
The Quisirmitas (the Aymara word for "ants") community association is soliciting a loan for the first time. The association has nine members, eight women and one man. Its president is Sra. Bertha M.. The association is attached to the Centro Focal de Los Andes. Sra. Bertha has operated a business selling socks for 10 years. Her stand is on Avenida Panoramica in the 16 de Julio neighborhood. Sra. Bertha is borrowing Bs.2000 and she says that she will use the money to buy merchandise for resale. The better stocked her business, the more she is likely to sell. The members of the association operate various business: making and selling knitted sweaters and hats, operating food stores, producting alpaca wool, selling clothing and fish, and operating corner shops.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Benjamín

texts.es:
Benjamín es un padre de familia de 36 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a su hijo de nueve años de edad en el caserío Macuaco del distrito de Oyotún, una zona agrícola situada aproximadamente a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores relacionadas con la agricultura desde hace mas de diez años, actualmente cuenta con un terreno de tres cuartos de hectárea en donde suele sembrar arroz, paralelamente se dedica al negocio de crianza y venta de animales, el cría animales en su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que visitan la zona y también en una feria que se instala una vez por semana en el distrito de Cayaltí (a media hora del lugar donde vive).

Benjamín desea empezar labores de siembra de arroz en su campo de cultivo, para ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el logro de su objetivo.

Benjamín es una persona trabajadora y bastante entregada a su familia, su mayor anhelo es brindarles la oportunidad te tener una mejor calidad de vida. En la zona donde vive el es una persona muy conocida y estimada por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Benjamin, 36, lives with his wife and nine year old son in the district of Oyotun, an agricultural region about two hours from the city of Chilayo. Benjamin has made a living from farming jobs for more than ten years and he now operates his own farm, where he grows rice, on three-quarters of a hectare (or about 1.9 acres). He also raises and sells animals. He raises the animals on his farm and, when they're mature enough, sells them to one of the commercial buyers who travel through the region or at a market that is held once a week in Cayalti (a half-hour from where he lives). Benjamin wants to start planting rice on his farm and he is applying for his first Edpyme Alternativa loan of 1000 nuevos soles for that purpose. Benjamín works hard to support his family. The thing he most wants in the world is to give them a chance for a better life. Benjamin is well known in the neighborhood and well-regarded by his neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plant rice for farming business.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
Faustina es casada y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales 2 estudian, Faustina viaja 2 veces a la semana a las ferias de la región en donde compra cereales variados y luego los transporta a la ciudad de Ayacucho con carro alquilado. Además Faustina hace papa seca en su casa y lo vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad. Faustina solicita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo y cebada.
Faustina es socia del Banco Comunal Retoño hace 15 años aproximadamente y lo que mas le gusta es el incentivo al ahorro además que aprendió a ser responsable.
Los sueños de Faustina son que sus hijos salgan adelante con su profesión y tener una tienda en su casa, porque los viajes son cansados.
texts.en:
Faustina is married and has 3 children, two of whom are in school. She goes to area markets twice a week to buy various cereal grains that she transports to the city of Ayacucho in a rented cart. She also dries potatoes at home that she then sells in the city's Abasto market. Faustina is applying for a 3000-soles loan that she will use to buy wheat and barley. Faustina has been a member of the Retono community bank for about 15 years and what she most likes are the incentives for saving and learning to be responsible with money. Faustina's greatest hopes are that her children find steady work and that she have a shop in her house so that she no longer has to take exhausting trips back and forth.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es socia del Banco Comunal Retoño hace un año y los prestamos son D. mucha ayuda para su negocio.
Yolanda es casada y tiene 3 hijas que estudian, Yolanda viaja a dos ferias D. la región en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, además Yolanda tiene un puesto en el mercado Magdalena en donD. venD. abarrotes los demás días. Solicita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar y fideo.
Yolanda sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales titulados y tener una tienda en local estable.
texts.en:
Yolanda has been a member of the Retono community bank for a year and loans have greatly helped her business. She is married and has 3 children, all in school. She goes to markets in the region to buy basic foodstuffs and spends the rest of her days at the Magdalena market, selling what she bought. Yolanda is applying for a 2000-soles loan that she will use to buy rice, sugar and pasta. Yolanda's greatest hopes are that her children find steady work and that she have a stable business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
Maria pertenece al Banco Comunal Retoño hace 4 años y lo que mas le gusta es el incentivo al ahorro.
Maria es casada y tiene 3 hijos, vive en el distrito de Acocro a 4 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Maria tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo. Además Maria compra papa y lleva a la selva ayacuchana actividad que inicio hace algunos meses.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa y arroz.
Maria sueña con aumentar su negocio, comprar un carro para transportar sus productos.
texts.en:
María has been a member of the Retoño (Flower Bud) communal bank for 4 years. What she likes best is the savings incentives. She is married and has 3 children. She lives in Acocro which is four hours from the city of Ayacucho. María has a grocery store in her home where she sells groceries, vegetables and meats with her husband’s help. In addition, María buys potatoes to sell in the Ayacucho backcountry; she started this new sales activity a few months ago. María needs a 3000 sol loan to buy potatoes and rice. She dreams with expanding her business and with buying a car to transport her products.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potatoes and rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy rices, sugar, bread, soft-drinks, beans, soap, cooking oil.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza tiene 40 años, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos de los cuales 1 estudia, Esperanza viaja a las ferias de la región en donde vende frutas y de las ferias compra cereales que luego vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho y en algunas oportunidades procesa los cereales. Además Esperanza teje chompas a mano de acuerdo al pedido de sus clientes.
Esperanza necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo y cebada.
Los sueños de Esperanza es mejorar su negocio y que su hijo culmine sus estudios.
texts.en:
Esperanza, 40, lives with her significant other and has two children one of whom is a student. She travels to the various regional markets to sell fruit and she buys grains there that she then sells in the city of Ayacucho's markets. Sometimes she processes the grains. She also hand knits sweaters based on prior orders from customers. Esperanza needs a 1600 sol loan to buy wheat and barley. Her dreams are to improve her business and that her son continues with his schooling.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wheat and barley.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela es socia del Banco Comunal Retoño.
Gabriela es casada y tiene 4 hijos que estudian, Gabriela tiene 3 carros, con uno de ellos trabaja su esposo haciendo taxi y los otros 2 los alquila diariamente. Gabriela y su familia realizan artesanía en telar como carteras, correas, sus productos los vende a intermediarios. También Gabriela vende comida en el paradero final de una empresa de transportes.
Gabriela necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles para la compra de neumáticos.
Los sueños de Gabriela son que sus hijos sean profesionales, mejorar su casa y tener una buena vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Gabriela is a member of the Retoño (Flower Bud) communal bank. She is married and has 4 children who are students. Gabriela owns three vehicles. One of them is used by her husband to provide taxi services, the other two she leases out daily. Gabriela and her family also weave crafts like purses and sashes. She sells these items to middlemen. In addition, Gabriela sells prepared food at a transportation company’s terminal. Gabriela needs a 1600 sol loan to buy tires. Her dreams are that her children become professionals, to make some improvements to her home, and to have a good life with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires.

loans.name: Somos Impacto 2006 Group

texts.es:
Margarita tiene 51 años y 5 hijos que son su razón D. vivir, desD. sus años escolares le gustaba tejer bolsos D. diferentes colores a sus compañeras les gustaba asi que pensó en venderlos. En ese tiempo obtuvo buenas ganancias. Pero, para mejorar sus tejidos se compro catálogos que le permitían hacer diferentes modelos. Ahora tiene una tienda D. bolsos a macramé en casa. Flor tiene una tienda D. abarrotes, bebidas y golosinas en su casa hace 5 años. El objetivo D. Flor es establecerse en un local y vender como mayorista y así obtener mayores ganancias, para L. manutención D. su familia.
Rosalinda es una mujer muy trabajadora venD. comidas al paso, además tiene una pequeña bodega en casa donD. venD. diferentes productos, a elL. le gustaría ampliar su negocio, para poder invertir en otros productos. Los socios son responsables y puntuales en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Margarita is 51 and has 5 children who are her reason for living. Since her school years, she has enjoyed weaving different-coloured purses for her friends, and since they liked them she decided to sell them. At that time she maD. good earnings; however, in order to improve her products she bought catalogs which allowed her to make different designs. She now has a macrame purse store in her home. Flor has a store where she has sold groceries, drinks and candies in her home for 5 years. Her goal is to establish herself in a store and sell wholesale, thus obtaining better income for the maintenance of her family. Rosalind is a very hard-working woman who sells food. She also has a small store in her home where she sells different products. She would like to expand her business, in order to invest in other products. The members are responsible and punctual in their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of products

loans.name: Amar Azul Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal “Amar Azul” es una asociación que solicita crédito por séptima vez, es parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho mujeres, tienen como presidenta a la señora Miriam Mejía. 

La señora Miriam desde hace ocho años que tiene el negocio de elaboración de chamarras y deportivos, los mismos que se distinguen por los bordados, que son su especialidad.

La venta es realizada en su tienda de la avenida Kollasuyo en la ciudad de La Paz.

Este crédito es por Bs.2000.-, el que servirá para la compra de materia prima, debido al invierno, la demanda de chamarras es mayor.
 
En el caso de las  integrantes de la asociación comunal, tienen negocios como venta de ropa, tienda de barrio, venta de comida, producción de buzos de lana, venta de Batidos, pensión y confección de ropa.
texts.en:
The Amar Azul Community Association is seeking its seventh loan. It is part of the central office of Los Andes, and is made up of eight women. The president is Sra. Miriam Mejía. Miriam has been making jackets and sportswear for eight years. Her products are distinguished by their embroidery which is Miriam’s specialty. She sells the clothing from her store in Kollasuyo Avenue in La Paz. The loan of Bs.2000 will be used to buy supplies. Because it is winter, the demand for jackets is higher. The members of the Association have businesses such as a clothes stall, neighbourhood store, food sales, making woolen sweaters, milk shake stall, guesthouse, and making clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fabric, fasteners, and thread

loans.name: Praxedes

texts.es:
Praxedes es un padre de familia de 55 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en e caserio Macuaco del distrito de Oyotún, una zona agrícola situada a mas de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en su domicilio desde hace siete años, este negocio es de mucha ayuda para su familia ya que les provee de ingresos estables y también lo es para su comunidad, ya que les provee de artículos de uso diario con los que no cuentan al alcance de la mano.

Praxedes ha trabajado durante este tiempo para poder ampliar su negocio, el desea implementarlo comprando abarrotes para  poder ofrecerles mas oportunidades de satisfacer sus necesidades, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su meta.

El es una persona bastante trabajadora y empeñosa, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Práxedes is a 55-year-old father who lives with his wife and children in Macuaco, Oyotún district, an agricultural area located more than two hours away from the city of Chiclayo. He has a store in his home where he sells groceries and basic needs items; he has had this business for 7 years. It is of great help to his family in that it provides stable income. It’s also of great use to the community in that it provides articles that are of daily use which otherwise they would not have readily available. Práxedes has worked during this time in order to expand his business. He wants to stock it with groceries in order to have more variety available. This is why he’s asking Edpyme Alternativa for the first time for a 1000 new sol loan that will help him reach this goal. He is quite a hard working and enterprising person. His greatest wish is to continue to grow as a businessman in order to provide his family with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a disassembled tractor.

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en: Mrs. Oeun C. is a marry woman who is 47 years old and she lives in Char village in Takeo province. She is a weaver at her home where she can able to earn some money to support her family while her husband, Mr. Mao Sluon, is a farmer who owns more two-hectare plot of land where he can grow rice to sell to support his family. Now she has some problem because her field is time to do farming, but they did not have enough money to support. So to improve production, Mrs. Oeun C. is requesting for a loan to purchase gasoline, pesticide, rice seed, and rest of the loan she rents plow machine to plow her husband’s field. She is a mother of a child who is too young to work or study. Her husband is taken the photo with her.

loans.use: To purchase gasoline, pesticide, rice seed

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en: Mrs. Pheap K. is a villager in Damnak village in Takeo province and she was born in 1964. She is a farmer who owns three-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family and she is also Khmer cake maker at her home. In her field now has some problem because it is time to do farming, but she did not have enough money. So to improve production, Mrs. Pheap K. is seeking for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and rest of the loan she hires farming laborers,  plow machine to plow her field, buy piglets and pig food for breeding to start a new business. Her husband, Mr. Van Uom, is a security guard who gets low salary to support his family. She is a mother of four children whom all are attending school. Her husband is taken the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide

loans.name: Nhorn

texts.en: In Phnum Lonteah village in Takeo province has a person, Mrs. Nhorn O. was born in 1954. She is a farmer who owns two point five-hectare of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. In her field has some problem because is infertile soil and it has a lot of insect. So to improve production, Mrs. Nhorn O. is seeking for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and rest of the loan she rents plow machine to plow her field. Her husband is a battery charger who can earn some money to support his family. She is a mother of four children, three of whom are seamstresses in garment factory, while the other is attending in local public school. Her husband is taken the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide

loans.name: Sris' Group

texts.en: This group loan has four members who live in Pou Khvet village in Takeo province. Mrs. Sris T. was born in 1980 who is a group leader, selected by the other members who will use their loan for different purposes. She is a farmer who owns three-hectare plot of land where she can grow rice to sell to support her family moreover she is also a Khmer cake seller. Now she has some problem because her field is far away from irrigation system. So to improve production, Mrs. Sris T. is seeking for a loan to buy a pump machine and rest of the loan she buys more Khmer cake to resale. Her husband, Mr. Ky Sok, is a policeman who gets low salary to support his family, too. She is a mother of three children, two of whom are attending in local public school, while the other is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy a pump machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy piñata making supplies.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita Z. is from the village of Baluarte, Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 42 years old. Lolita is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Lolita operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling electronic cell phone load credits and from selling home-made longganiza (sausage) and thirst-quenching refreshments like ice candies and halo-halo (shaved ice and milk dessert) in the local community. Lolita has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Lolita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This will be the third loan taken out by Lolita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Mrs. Sam Ath Ny Village Bank Group

texts.en: Eighteen people who live in Sdok Prei village in Takeo province are made up a village bank loan. Mrs. Sam Ath N. is a village bank president who is 47-year-old, selected by the other members who will use portion of their loan for varied ways. She is a congee and palm sugar seller who can earn some money to support her family and a side this she is a farmer who owns a very small piece of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Since her business is going well she wants to expand. So to improve her face business, Mrs. Sam Ath N. is seeking for a loan to buy more palm sugar to resale. She is widow with four children, one of whom is a seamstress in garment factory, while the other two are chauffeurs, and the other is attending in local school to help all her businesses.

loans.use: To buy more palm sugar to resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fencing material, and fertilizer etc for his sugarcane

loans.name: Bonie

texts.en: Bonie P. is from the village of Pagatpat, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 45 years old. Bonie is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Bonie plants and harvests vegetables. The main source of income for the business comes from selling plant seedlings and young crops, especially vegetables, to local farmers. Bonie has been engaged in his business for more than 15 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Bonie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bonie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase general agricultural supplies. Bonie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the vegetable farm. This will be the third loan taken out by Bonie from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. loans.name: 03.01.33-Dien Bien Group

texts.en: Thanh T. T. (168) is a 61-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoa. Thanh is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 33-Dien Bien (03.01.33 -Dien Bien). Thanh is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Thanh runs a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of food products in the local community. Thanh has been engaged in this business for more than five years and earns approximately 2.400.000 Vietnamese dong (VND) a month from it. In 2010, Thanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Thanh is requesting for the first time a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is requesting 4.248.000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. Thanh plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. L. T. Lan (167) is a 26-year-old female who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her business of making and selling food. 2. N. T. N. Giau (169) is a 35-year-old female who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her food stall business. About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. Thanh T. T. (168) là 61 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa. Thanh là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 33-Dien Bien (03.01.33 -Dien Bien). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán các loại thực phẩm khác nhau trong cộng đồng địa phương. Thanh thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Thanh kiếm được khoảng 2.400.000 VND. Vào 2010, Thanh đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Thanh đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.248.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. L. T. Lan (167) là 26 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn. 2. N. T. N. Giau (169) là 35 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.name: Mrs. Ren Sam Village Bank Group

texts.en: In Rovieng village in Takeo province consists of ten people who all are made up a village bank loan. Each member will use portion of their loan for different purposes in which it can improve to increase their income. Mrs. Ren S. was born in 46-year-old who is a village bank president, selected by the other members. She and her husband, Mr. Seab Ken, are farmers who own one-hectare plot of land where they grow rice to sell to support their family moreover she is also a pig breeder. Their problem is that their field is infertile soil, but they did not have enough money to support. So to improve production, Mrs. Ren S. is asking for a loan to bU. fertilizer and rest of the loan she hires plow machine to plow her field. She is a mother of two children whom all are students and they also help her to do farming. The day of the loan disbursement Mrs. Ren S. was busy working in the field. Instead, her husband, Mr. Seab Ken, received the loan for her. The photo above is of Mrs. Ren S.'s husband.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

Her husband, Mr. Leav Tes, is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he is able to grow rice to sell to support his family. This couple supports two children, one of whom is a motorbike repair, while the other is studying at school.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is persistent in reaching her vision of growing her “sari-sari” (variety) store into a full-fledged mini-grocery store that has a huge quantity of inventories. Despite having difficulty maintaining her business (because she cannot re-invest her profits since it is also the main source of her family's daily expenses), Nenita is optimistic that one day her dream will land on the palm of her hand. For that reason, Nenita wants to request a much larger loan to support the needs of her business and at the time same to continue its operation. With Nenita’s passion of giving her children a brighter tomorrow, she will be eager to work hard and help her husband meet the needs of her family.

Now, Nenita’s business has been very helpful in achieving her family dreams. Her greatest hope is that her family will be able to have a decent way of life. Her long term goals are to help support her children's education, invest, build a better house for the family and have a full-fledged mini-grocery store.

loans.use: To support the needs of her sari-sari store and continue its operation.

Before raising chickens and ducks, the couple grew rice and vegetables to raise their standard of living, but this work allowed them to earn very little money.

Five of their children are in school, and they need more money to support their studies. Chen P. gives her children 1,000 to 1,500 Riel (approximately USD 0.24 to USD 0.36) a day. Now, Chen P. would like to take out a loan of US$1,200 to raise more ducks and chickens.

loans.name: Cherelyn

texts.en:
Cherelyn L. is a married woman who lives in Barangay St.Martin, Carmen, Cebu. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: a general store, an auto shop and a computer games business. Her husband, William L., who is 47 years old, works in an auto shop to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have five children who are between the ages of 10 mos. and 23 years old. 

Cherelyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she wanted for something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Cherelyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. 

Her previous loan of 9,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of $420, raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 4th cycle loan, she is borrowing 14,000 PHP, which she intends to use as additional working capital for improving and expanding her general store (sari-sari shop) and her computer gaming business so that she can continue to save up for a brighter future and for the education of her children. Cherelyn L. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

To help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines, join our team by clicking on the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: Additional working capital for her businesses

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes R. is an example of a strong woman who can thrive and make a living for her family.  A 55-year-old mother of one son, Arnold, she lives in the town of Binangonan, Rizal Province, in the Philippines. Lourdes’ main goal is to build a sustainable business to meet the needs of her family. 

In 2006, she was encouraged to join ASHI, the first KIVA partner in the Philippines. The previous loans she received from ASHI were carefully invested in her sari-sari (variety) store. Since then, her business has been performing well and earning her sufficient profit. 

Now, Lourdes needs working capital to help boost her business for increased profit making, so she is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP for her variety store, to be used to pay for groceries to sell. 

Lourdes is optimistic that she can achieve her dreams of providing a good life for her family and being able to bring them into a decent way of life. She hopes that these dreams will come true and that ASHI will in fact give the best direction and opportunity to her family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.name: Zikran's Group

texts.en:
Zikran is 49 years of age but she looks ten years older than her age. Her financial problems grew her old before her time.  

She is a citizen of a city called Borewala in Pakistan, where she lives with her family. Her husband sells timbers and her two sons also help their father in his business. Zikran is a seamstress. She takes orders from her nearby customers and fulfills them to earn an income. However, her family is barely able to fulfill their basic living needs, even though everyone in the family puts forth their best effort to improve their businesses.  

Zikran has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy timbers in bulk and improves his sales.  She is hopeful that by investing this loan in her husband’s business, she will be able to make positive changes in her family’s standard of living and she will be able to marry her daughter, who is now of marriage age.

loans.use: Purchase timbers to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Tom Khorn Village Bank Group

texts.en: Fourteen members who are made up a village bank loan live in Chuos village in Takeo province. Mrs. Tom K. is a village bank president who was born in 1973, selected by the other members who will use portion of their loan for different purposes. She is a farmer who owns two-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family and she is also a Khmer cake seller while her husband, Mr. Khoeurn Phen, is a pig middleman who is also earned some money to support his family. Since her husband’s business is going well she wants to expand. So to improve this business, Mrs. Tom K. is asking for a loan to buy a mother pig. She is a mother of four children whom all are studying in local public school and they are helping their parents’ businesses.

loans.use: To buy a mother pig

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella B. is from the village of Brgy.Vista Alegre,Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 53 years old. Bella is widowed and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Bella owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Bella has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 25,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Bella joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bella has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Bella is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Bella from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Barot

texts.en:
Barot is 47 years old and married with 4 children. His business is a convenience store, which he has run for the past 12 years and which he started with his own money and with some loans. His two sons are independent and have their own business. This is his first loan and with this loan, Barot wants to buy foodstuff and a cooler so he can buy more meat and dairy products and offer fresh foods to his customers, and to be able to sell more and have better earnings. His future plans are to make improvements to the store and to improve his living conditions. 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.name: Azimkan

texts.en:
Azimkan D. is a 50-year-old farmer. She lives in Bakai-Ata village and has six children: one daughter, who is married, and lives with her husband; and five sons, four of which help her in the farm. Azimkan’s husband and one son work in a car repair shop in Bishkek (the capital of Kyrgyzstan), where their overtime work enables them to support their family. 

Azimkan works as an acupressure nurse in the regional hospital and helps her patients to overcome their problems. Azimkan is described as a benevolent, responsible and very hardworking woman.

In 1993, after the breakdown of the Soviet Union, Azimkan didn’t lose courage and began to develop her business of stock- and horse-breeding and cultivation of kidney beans and perennial herbs. It allowed her to earn 55,000 Kyrgyz Soms to lease a plot of land for 49 years outside of Bakai-Ata. There Azimkan and her family built a small barn to house the milk cows and horses and to cultivate perennials. Azimkan is applying for a loan to buy more cows and to purchase mineral fertilizers to lead to an increased harvest and top-quality products.

With future revenues, Azimkan plans to buy a truck to transport milk and meat products to customers and consumers in different regions. 

Azimkan is a very positive person so she believes that her strong efforts will help improve the living standards of her family and of the region in general.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Kulsada

texts.en:
Kulsada C. is 46 years old and lives in Amanbaevo village in the north-west of Kyrgyzstan. She has three children – two sons, one of whom is a student, and a school-aged daughter. Kulsada has a higher pedagogical education, and during the last 20 years she has been working as a teacher of Kyrgyz language and literature in a local school. She is known as a purposeful, positive and sociable person. She likes to work with children and help them to be educated people, which is crucial in the formation of their personalities. Kulsada’s husband is engaged in farming.
Unfortunately, a teacher's salary in rural areas is very low. That is why in 1995, Kulsada began to engage in stock-breeding using the 10,000 Kyrgyz Soms that she had put aside for a rainy day. At that time, she had only two calves. Gaining experience in cattle breeding, Kulsada broadened her business and today owns three milk cows, three horses and 27 sheep. She also began to cultivate a plot of land. 
Kulsada is a really hardworking woman. Her striving to provide her children with a better life motivated her to apply for a loan of 50,000 Kyrgyz Soms for cattle breeding last year. Using the revenues from this loan, Kulsada was able to buy a car for the family. Now, she has decided to apply for a second loan of 80,000 Kyrgyz Soms. She will use it to buy 28 sheep.
In the future, Kulsada plans to build a house for her older son and to pay for a good education for the younger one.

This leads to increased employment and meets the interests of both clients and investors.
