texts.en: Madame Ami A. is 40 years old and sells plastics, dishes, and other items in Lome, Togo. She is married and the mother of one child. Madame Amouve has been selling plastics and other items since 2000. Normally she sells these items from her home, but she also goes to the Adidogome Market in Lome to sell the items to shoppers there. This is Madame Amouve's first loan from WAGES; she is requesting 350,000 CFA in order to purchase more dishes, plastic basins, and other items to sell.

loans.use: To purchase plastics, dishes, and other merchandise

loans.name: Aniceth

texts.en:
Aniceth is 28 years old and still single.  Aniceth, as a young entrepreneur, started a business selling a variety of school items in 2005.  The hours of his business are from 7 am to 9 pm every day except Saturday.  

Aniceth, after realizing that he is not able to satisfy the demands of his customers, would like to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a and hopes that this loan will allow him to increase the size of his business through purchasing more school items for sale.  With the use of this loan to  purchase these items for sale, Aniceth will hopefully earn more profit and this profit will allow him to keep reinvesting in his business and creating more sources of income so that more people from his community can get jobs.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of items used in schools

loans.name: Hukmatulo

texts.ru: Косимов Хукматуло проживает в районе Фархор. Возраст, 40 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается животноводством. Он в основном откармливает и продает скот. В этой области более 5 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупно - рогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en:
Hukmatulo K. lives in Farkhor. He is 40 years old, married, and has three children. He has a high school education. He works in animal husbandry. Mostly he fattens and sells cattle. He has done this for more than five years. He is taking out a loan to buy cattle to increase his herd.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cattle

loans.name: Mente Positivo Group

texts.es:
El comité se encuentra trabajando dentro del sexto ciclo del Programa de comité de Mujeres de Emprendedoras.
Cada una de las integrantes realiza una actividad diferente y todas se están muy contentas con su trabajo ya que mediante el mismo consiguieron ayudar a sus familias.
Así una de las integrantes es la señora Elvira M. quien tiene como actividad principal la atención de su librería  que le genera un ingreso diario.
En su librería ella ofrece útiles escolares como cuaderno, lapices, varios tipos de papeles, carteras escolares, cartucheras y otros.
 Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas útiles escolares para renovar sus mercaderías ademas desea ofrecer nuevas mercaderías como remeras, pantalones, polleras todos para los colegios.
texts.en:
This committee is working on its sixth loan cycle as part of the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs Program. Each member is involved in a different business activity. They are all very happy with their work and hope to continue in the same manner so that they can support their families.

One of the members is Sra. Elvira M.. Her main business activity is managing a bookstore so that she can generate a daily income. At her store she offers school supplies such as notebooks, pencils, different types of paper, school satchels, pouches, and other products.

Elvira is requesting a loan to buy school supplies to revamp her inventory. In addition, she wants to offer new merchandise such as T-shirts, trousers, and skirts that are used for school uniforms.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase school supplies & uniforms

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan K. is currently in the business of selling dried fish and bread, and she is requesting a loan to stock more dried fish and some tomatoes to sell. She is 47 years old and is widowed.  She has 7 children, and only 2 children out of the 7 go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a house for her children.

loans.use: Stock more dried fish and some tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Kamiljon

texts.ru: Рахмонов Камилжон проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 42 года. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Камилжон не имеет высшего образования. Занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Создал все условия для продвижения своего бизнеса. Кредит берет для закупа крупно - рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Kamiljon R. lives in the Shahrituz district. He is 42 years old, married and has 3 children. His wife is a homemaker. Kamiljon does not have a higher education. He is involved in animal husbandry and breeds livestock at home. He created all of the conditions necessary for the growth of his business. Kamiljon is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna N. is currently in the business of selling hair-weaving materials in her beauty salon and is requesting a loan to stock more weaving materials to sell. Anna is 37 years old and is married with a husband that is a teacher. She has 3 children, and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a pharmacy.

loans.use: Stock more weaving materials to sell

loans.name: Twefeeko Development Group-Mukono

texts.en:
Mukono Town, like any other metropolis in Uganda, is crawling with a commercial motorcycle craze, commonly known around the country as Boda Boda. Most people use this form of transportation to beat the gridlock traffic jams that are commonplace all over the country. One person who has developed an inclination towards this craze is 38 year old K. Wilson, a married man with 3 school-going children. It goes without saying that this business is lucrative and that is principally the reason why there are so many people joining this business. 

Wilson like many of his friends has his stage at Ngandu Trading Center. He took root in this business after a close friend gave him the idea. He was previously into fishing. At present, his business brings him weekly profits that total up to 105,000 shillings. With this loan, Wilson wants to purchase a second motorcycle. He anticipates this will help him earn more profits.

loans.use: The purchase of a second motorcycle

loans.name: Anathalie

texts.en:
Anathalie has been selling timber and this is her fifth successful year in this business.  Anathalie is 47 years old and married with two children.  The hours of her business are from 7 am to 6 pm every day.

Anathalie, after realizing that she is not able to satisfy the demands of her customers because of an insufficient number of machines, would like to request one more additional machine which will allow her to cut more timber to sell.  Thus, she will be able to satisfy the demands of her customers and she hopes that her profits will increase.  With these profits, Anathalie plans to keep reinvesting for better financial stability and a better future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase one additional machine for cutting timbers.

loans.name: Katuba Development Group-Mukono

texts.en:
K. Muzamiru is a 30-year-old go-getter. His go-getter attitude has been his dependable resource in his poultry business. He has been rearing and selling poultry for the last 4 years in Namaiba-Mukono. This business is fast becoming one of the most profitable businesses in the country, given the increasing chicken consumption levels, especially in urban areas. He began this business with savings from his teaching job. 

Finding an alternative source of income has helped him a lot, given the low remuneration that teachers get. In a week he is able to make more than 70,000 shillings on poultry sales alone. That means he makes more money in a month out of this business than he makes as a teacher. With this loan, this married father of 2 school-going children wants to buy more bags of chicken feed.

loans.use: The purchase of more bags of chicken feed.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman with four children. Three already completed the high school level, while one still attends the school. She rents a house with electricity and piped water. She has been operating her cereals store for the past eight months and sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. With the loan she wants to purchase five bags of maize and five bags of beans. In addition she sells green vegetables as her other source of income. 

Christine faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to build her own house in future to minimize cost of paying rent. Her main aim of working with Yehu is because of its sustainable financial services. She cites school fees and food as her greatest monthly expenses.

loans.use: To purchase five bags of beans and five bags of maize to resell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice A. is currently in the business of selling crates of beer at the bar and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell. Alice is 27 years old and married to a clinical officer. She has no children yet. 

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a house for rent.

loans.use: Stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Ludeya

texts.en: Ludeya B. is currently in the business of baking and selling local Sudanese bread (gelabia) at home in the mornings. She is requesting a loan to stock more baking flour and cooking oil. Ludeya is 39 years old and is married to a peasant. She has three children and her children do not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to send her children to school.

loans.use: Stock more baking flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Mujeres Al Poder Group

texts.es:
Para la formación el presente comité inicio la Señora Zunilda  Benítez   domiciliada en el Barrio Romancito  de C.D.E. Ella ya formo parte del comité de Mujeres emprendedoras, decidió contactar con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la Zona.
El comité se Denomina “Mujeres al Poder”  están  iniciando el Primer Ciclo   con 15   integrantes, es un grupo de señoras muy responsables y trabajadoras,  ellas tienen distintas actividades  y otras que están emprendiendo una nueva labor y para generar ingresos.
La señora Luisa es una de las integrantes quien trabaja entre las mujeres para fomentar el trabajo en grupo entre las mujeres.
Ella realiza varias  actividades en la semana para generar ingreso, como preparar comestibles, realiza trabajos de limpieza y actualmente está vendiendo bebidas en su domicilio y solicita el préstamo para la compra de gaseosas, jugos, cervezas, licores de varios tipos.
texts.en:
This existing committee was started by Sra. Zunilda B., who lives in the Romancito neighborhood of Ciudad del Este. She decided to contact her neighbors and friends to form a local committee and now they are part of the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs Program.

The committee is named “Mujeres al Poder” (Women in Power). They are starting their first loan with 15 members. The group consists of very responsible and hardworking women, some of whom already have established businesses. Others are starting a new venture in order to generate income.

Sra. Luisa is one of the members who was encouraged to join this group of working women. She engages in different activities during the week to earn money such as preparing food and providing cleaning services. Luisa currently sells beverages out of her home and is requesting a loan to buy sodas, juices, beer, and different types of liquor.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beer, liquor, sodas, and juices

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more things to sell.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is 41 years old, married with five children who are between 7 and 17 years old and she takes care of one child who is 20 years old.  Chantal is commonly known for selling cosmetic goods and the hours of her business are from 7 am to 7 pm every day.

Chaatal needs to renovate her place of her business and purchase more cosmetic goods to sell.  To end this, she would like to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  If successful, Chantal will hopefully attract more customers and in addition, her profits will increase. This will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability and building a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To renovate her place of business and buy cosmetic goods

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose O. is currently in the business of brewing and selling local Sudanese alcohol (siko) at home and is requesting a loan to stock more brewing materials like yeast (kemira) to brew more siko to sell. Rose is 49 years old and married to a peasant. She has five children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to stock crates of beer and open up a bar.

loans.use: Stock more brewing materials like yeast (kemira) to brew more siko to sell

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is a market entrepreneur from Kamenka. She sells groceries, tea, coffee and fruits in one of the local markets. Liana owns a small vending kiosk equipped with electricity and located in a good part of the marketplace. Liana started her business 10 years ago. Presently, she has 32,000 Grivnyas of turnover capital. Her net profit amounts to 5,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Liana is requesting a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise for her kiosk. She tries to offer only fresh produce for sale which has helped her gain good reputation among customers. One of Liana’s long-term plans is to glaze her vending kiosk which will give her a chance to work even in bad weather conditions. Liana’s venture has been developing steadily. There has been consistent progress in her professional growth, too. Liana has a serious approach to lending assistance and is responsible about her liabilities.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Beyola

texts.en: Beyola J. is currently in the business of selling maize flour, rice and beans at her store and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of beans and rice to sell. Beyola is 39 years old and her husband is a businessman. She has 3 children, all attending school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor area of her store.

loans.use: Stock more bags of beans and rice to sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes A. makes porridge from rice and serves it at Elmina with bread and groundnut or peanut spread.  Agnes has received a junior high education.  She is married and has three children. Her husband is a cleaner. She is responsible for helping husband pay school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more rice and to invest in baking other pastries for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: To buy more rice and invest in baking other pastries

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
El Sr. Raúl es casado, tiene dos  hijos,  todos  en edad escolar.
Él se dedica a la venta de verduras y comestibles por las colonias, la misma cada vez más está en ascenso, generándole un buen ingreso. 

Con la ayuda de su esposa  están  saliendo adelante con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo. 
Hoy día él es un microempresario exitoso con una clientela fiel y numerosa, debido a su amabilidad.
Ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y honesta en sus compromisos. 
Solicita el crédito para la compra de frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
Sr. Raúl is married and has two school age children. He sells vegetables and food in different neighborhoods. Since his business is increasing, he is able to generate a good income.

With the help of his wife, Raúl is able to move forward with great sacrifice and effort. Today he is a successful micro-entrepreneur with several loyal customers thanks to his friendly personality. Raúl has demonstrated that he is a responsible individual who is honest in all of his commitments.

He is requesting a loan to buy fruits and vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits & vegetables

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is a small market entrepreneur from Kherson region. She is married with two daughters. Tatyana sells children's clothing and footwear in the small town outdoor markets of the region. She has been working in this sphere of business for 8 years. Her turnover capital amounts to 40,000 Grivnyas. Her monthly income is about 10,000 Grivnyas. 

Tatyana has a long-term view of her venture development and is disciplined with all her business plans. All this promotes successful growth of her business. Moreover, Tatyana is not afraid of serious amounts of hard work, which reveals her great entrepreneurial potential and ensures prompt loan repayment. Tatyana is requesting a loan of 12,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise and offer a better selection of inventory in her kiosk.

loans.use: to diversify assorted merchandise

loans.name: Kikoma Women's, Mubende Group

texts.en:
S. Slyvia, a trained midwife, has been providing medical services to her clients at her clinic located in Mubende town, which she set up after retiring from her government job. Here in Uganda one of the common medical problems faced is that there are very few facilities to cater to the sick, and thus very many people here die while giving birth and many more suffer from malaria due to inadequate medical care services. This is where people like Slyvia come in. Her main problem is that she does not have enough quantity and variety of drugs in her drug shop, which is a hindrance to her career and business.

With this loan, Slyvia plans to construct a house extension to accommodate her patients, and to restock drugs in the clinic. This will see her earn more revenue and live a self-sustaining life.

loans.use: purchase of drugs to stock the clinic

loans.name: Francine

texts.en:
Francine is 40 years old and married with five children who are between 2 and 15 years old.  Francine makes a living by selling a variety of goods in her small shop. She opens her shop from early in the morning until late in the evening.

After 10 years in this business, she wants to start also selling foodstuffs such as Irish potatoes, rice, sugar, beans, peas, etc. as these goods are highly demanded by a large number of customers. She hopes that her profits will increase.  To get the capital, she needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. This loan will allow her to reinvest in this business.

loans.use: To buy a variety of foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Rony Javier

texts.es:
El Sr. Rony Javier B. D. es cliente recurrente de nuestra empresa, el mismo es padre de una nena de 1 año y medio, y  se dedica a la compra-venta y distribución de balanceados en general, para animales de cría domestica y ganado vacuno, también distribuye coco rallado, lo realiza en su propio vehículo, el mismo está domiciliado en Cuidad del Este, donde se encuentra la empresa en la cual presta servicio, se trata de una persona solvente y con moralidad de pago.
El solicita para la compra de balanceados en gran cantidad.
texts.en:
Sr. Rony Javier B. D. is a repeat client of Fundación Paraguaya and the father of a one and a half year old child. He buys, sells, and distributes livestock feed for domesticated animals and cattle. In addition, he sells grated coconut out of his own vehicle. He lives in Ciudad del Este, which also where the company he works for is located. Rony tries to be a person who manages his payments in a responsible and honest manner.

He is requesting a loan to buy large quantities of animal feed.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase large quantities of animal feed

loans.name: Hyvonne

texts.en:
Hyvonne is a married woman with one child who attends school. Her husband is a businessman, and he contributes to his family's needs. She rents a house with electricity and piped water.

She has been operating her business of distributing fresh water to her neighbors and restaurant operators for the past two years, and sells from home. With the Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase a 6000-litre water tank. The major challenge she faces in her business is seasonality. Hyvonne hopes to open another water project someday. She decided to work with Yehu because of its low interest rates and its transparency and accountability. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is married. She is an entrepreneur from Khoost. She owns a clothing sales business, selling children’s clothing merchandise in one of the local markets in her hometown. The inventory she offers for sale is relatively cheap and of good quality. Margarita has been in the trade for 17 years. Her net profit amounts to about 3,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Margarita is seeking a loan of 9,000 Grivnyas to increase the variety of merchandise she offers for sale in her vending kiosk. Margarita’s clients are satisfied with inventory at her kiosk. They are attracted by affordable prices and friendly service. Margarita has her loyal clientele. She can be characterized as a reliable and trustworthy borrower who is seeking to further develop her trade and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Dativa

texts.en:
Dativa is 39 years old and married with nine children who are between 3 and 19 years old.  Dativa is commonly known for selling meat in her butcher shop.  The business hours are from 7 am to 7 pm every day.  

Dativa's business is too small to satisfy her customers.  To end this, she needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a.  With this loan, she will increase the quantity of meats to sell. Therefore the number of her customers as well the profits will increase.  If successful, Dativa wishes to reach the stage where she can be financially stable and be able to fix any financial problems of her family members.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of meat to sell

loans.name: Lavinia

texts.es: La Señora Lavinia dedicada a la venta de ropa y productos en general a crédito y al contado realiza sus visitas a sus clientes para ofrecerles nuevos artículos para su necesidad, entregando estos en cómodas cuotas para que puedan cancelar cada quincena o bien semanal este esfuerzo lo realiza para cumplir una de sus metas que es comprarse un lote donde pueda construir su propia casa y criar sus animalitos que tanto los quiere,con el dinero del credito comprara chompas y chamarras ya que tiene muchos pedidos por el intenso frio que aqueja a todas las ciudades de Bolivia, es una persona muy trabajadora desde muy pequeña salio adelante sola y mejoro su calidad de vida, ahora esta muy agradecida a Dios por todo lo que le brindo, mas que todod por que se encuentra sanita y con ganas de seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Sra. Lavinia sells clothing and general merchandise on credit and for cash. She visits her customers to offer them new products to meet their needs. Upon delivery, she offers her customers convenient installment plans on a biweekly or weekly schedule. With some effort, she hopes to fulfill one of her goals which is to buy a plot of land on which she can build her own house and raise animals.

Using the money from the loan, Lavinia plans to buy sweaters and jackets so that she can fulfill the many orders she has received as a result of the cold weather that has plagued every city in Bolivia. She is a hardworking person who, by herself, has been able to make a little bit of progress and improve her quality of life. Now she is very grateful to God for everything that has been given to her. Most of all, she hopes to have health and the desire to move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sweaters & jackets

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba O. sells palm oil in both small and large quantities at Elmina. Araba has been through senior high school. Her husband is a mason. With the income she makes from her sales, she helps her husband take care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy extra gallons of palm oil for sale. She anticipates using the new profits she hopes to generate as a result of the loan to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy extra gallons of palm oil to sell

loans.name: Térence

texts.fr:
Térence N.  est âgée 60 ans, née en exil en RDC. Elle est mariée et possèdent onze enfants, le moins âgée a 17 ans et le plus âgée à 33 ans, tous sont allés a l’école. Térence avec sa famille habite à Kigali.
Concernant son activité, il est commerçant des boissons non alcooliques(Fanta), il a une expérience de 20 ans dans ce domaine de commerce et il a fait des épargnes qui lui ont aidé d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille en payant le minerval pour ses enfants. Il épargne dans ACB avec laquelle il est client il y a 3ans. Le prêt qu’il vient de contracter, c’est pour acheter des 50 caisses de Fanta, Il les vend en détaille et en tirer les bénéfices et rembourser son prêt. 

Le prêt contracté avec ACB est  le treizième, les intérêts  tirés de son business, il les utilise pour payer les minervaux des ses enfants et augmenter son chiffre d’affaires.

Dans l’avenir, après avoir terminé de rembourser le prêt, il pourra augmenter un niveau de prêt, et il deviendra distributeur agréé de la Bralirwa.
texts.en:
Térence N. is 60 years old and was born in exile in the Democratic Republic of Congo. He is married and the father of 11 children, the youngest 17 years old and the oldest 33. All of them attended school. Térence and his family live in Kigali. His business is the sale of soft drinks (Fanta); he has 20 years of experience in this business and his savings have allowed him to improve living conditions for his family by paying his children’s school fees. He saves with ACB, where he has been a client for three years. The loan that he is requesting is to buy 50 cases of Fanta, which he will sell at retail to make a profit and repay his loan. The loan contracted with ACB is his 13th, the interest paid with his business income. He uses them to pay school fees and increase his sales figures. In the future, after paying back the loan, he will be able to take out a bigger loan and become a certified distributor for Bralirwa (a large brewer and soft drink company in Rwanda).

Translated from French by Rachel Braff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 50 cases of Fanta

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is a married woman with four children; the eldest has finished schooling while three still attend school. She sells second-hand clothes, handbags and shoes. She sells door-to-door and from home to her neighbors.

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase a bale of clothes, handbags and shoes. Vivian faces the major challenge of competition in her business. She hopes to open a shop someday.

She decided to work with Yehu because of its sustainable financial services. She rents a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of clothes, handbags and shoes

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua A. sells fresh okro, pepper and other foodstuffs at Elmina.  She is married and lives together with her four children. Ekua has acquired a senior high education. She contributes to the general welfare of her family. Her loan will be used to buy additional foodstuffs like okro, pepper and other vegetables her customers have been demanding for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a storage place for her vegetables.

loans.use: To buy additional foodstuffs like okro, pepper and other vegetables

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita tiene 57 años vive con su esposo en su casa propia casa. Tiene 40 años D. experiencia vendiendo, ya que en un inicio empezó desD. que se casó, en su misma casa acondiciono una apequeña tienda, para vender algunos productos D. primera necesidad, mientras que su esposo se dedicaba a la agricultura y afirma con orgullo que esta tienda que hoy sigue manteniéndose ha logrado mantener a sus 6 hijos. Actualmente sus hijos son personas adultas e independientes y solo ella en compañía D. su esposo se encargan D. la tienda, ya que les permite el sustento diario, por tanto procuran abastecerla D. varios productos. Su deseo es continuar dedicándose en la atención D. su negocio. Es su sexto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra D. mercadería en gaseosas y productos D. primera necesidad.
texts.en:
Margarita is 57 years old and lives with her husband in their own home. She started selling products 40 years ago after she got married. Margarita established a small store in her house where she sells basic necessities while her husband works as a farmer. She says she is proud that she has been able to maintain her store to this very day and support her six children. Her children are now independent adults, so she lives alone with her husband and continues to manage her store in order to pay for their daily expenses. For this reason, she wants to acquire different products to restock her business and keep it in operation.

This is her sixth loan with MFP. Margarita is happy to know that she has financial support, so she has always demonstrated responsibility with her payments. In addition, she is grateful to be part of her Communal Bank because all the members are very responsible and supportive of one another. She expresses her appreciation to those individuals in charge of approving her loan request, which will be useful in advancing her business. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy merchandise such as sodas and basic necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Munezero Group

texts.fr:
Renovat ManiraK. est un commerçant âgé de 32 ans qui habite la Commune urbaine de Buyenzi en mairie de Bujumbura. Il fait la couture il ya de cela 12 ans. Il a fait ses études secondaires et a obtenu son Diplôme A3 en section paramédicale. Son épouse, U. Assiya, est aussi commerçante. Il arrive au 8e cycle dans le crédit communautaire avec Turame. 

Il a 3 enfants âgés de 8 ans, 6ans et 2ans qui étudient en 1ere  année sauf le cadet qui n’étudie pas encore.

Il demande le crédit Kiva pour  acheter des matériaux de couture comme les tissus et autres accessoires afin d’augmenter les produits de couture qu’il vend aux clients. Il espère dans le futur, avoir son capital propre pour acheter des machines modernes de couture et ainsi être  à mesure de subvenir à ses besoins divers comme sa propre maison, assurer les frais de scolarité de son enfant et autres besoins essentiels. 

 Il est un des membres du groupe  communautaire« Munezero ».
texts.en:
Renovat ManiraK. is a 32 year old retailer who lives in Buyenzi, an urban community which is part of the Bujumbura mayorship. He has been sewing for 12 years. He attended secondary school and got his A3 diploma in the paramedical section. His wife, U. Assiya, is also a retailer. He is currently in the 8th cycle in the community loan with Turame. He has 3 children aged 8, 6 and 2 years old who are in their first year at school, except for the youngest one who does not attend school yet. He is requesting a Kiva loan to buy sewing supplies such as cloths and other accessories in order to increase the production of sewed items that he sells to his customers. In the future, he hopes to have his own capital to buy modern sewing machines and thus be able to provide for the various needs of his household, pay for his children’s school fees and meet other basic needs. He is a member of the “Munezero” community group

Translated from French by Marie-Elodie Bazy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies like cloths and other accessories in order to increase the production of sewed items that he sells to customers

loans.name: Caltex Development, Mubende Group

texts.en:
Hard work and a social nature with a sense of determination have made Frister N. what she is today. This all began after she took a training course in the same business to become a professional tailor. This developed her skills in the tailoring business, which she operates from Kikoma Trading Centre in Mubende. 

This seems to be fulfilling for her as she is in position to get 200,000 Ugandan shillings as profits on a monthly basis. This has made the 45-year-old married mother of three children have the ability to cater to her family needs as she looks forward to achieving her dream of owning a big business in the area and buying herself more sewing machines. With this loan, she hopes to buy a sewing machine and more stock of materials that she can make into good designs for the customers. She also wants to look at business expansion.

Frister N. is the lady seated in the front row, far right in a purple blouse.

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.en:
Madame Adjowa K. is 37 years old and works selling clothing in Lome, Togo. She is married to a merchant and they have one child. Madame K. has been selling clothing since 2008 near the Grand Market in Lome. As a successful business woman, she often needs to take trips in order to purchase her merchandise and travel to different neighborhoods in the city.

She has requested her first loan from WAGES of 400,000 CFA in order to purchase a motorcycle and insurance. This will allow her to do more business and save money on transportation costs.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle and insurance.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama A. uses measuring cups to measure rice to sell. She also sells locally made soap and Fante kenkey at Elmina. Ama has received a junior high education.  She is divorced and takes care of four children.  Ama has been in this business for some time now. She takes care of her children using the income she makes from her sales. Her loan will be used to buy more bags of rice, local soap and Fante kenkey to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to take care of her children.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, local soap and Fante kenkey to sell

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with four children who all attend school.She has been operating her business of selling Kikoi (traditional clothing) for the last five years door to door to her neighboring community.

She rents a house with no electricity and piped water. With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase a bundle of Kikoi's. Fatuma faces the major challenge is transport. She hopes to open a boutique in future and improve her business. She decided to join Yehu so as to get a loan to improve her business. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and transport.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of Kikoi's (traditional clothing).

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
La iniciativa de formar este comité fue de la señora Maria Luisa quien conocía sobre el programa comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras e invito a sus amigas y vecinas y de esta forma conformaron un grupo solidario y responsable y actualmente ya están en el  cuarto ciclo. 
El comité demuestra muchas ganas y buena actitud para el trabajo  .
Una de las integrantes es la señoras María Luisa quien es una señora muy trabajadora con aptitudes muy creativas, ella tiene buenas iniciativas de trabajo y ayuda a todas sus compañeras con sus actividades.
Ella se dedica a la venta de celulares, accesorios para celulares, mini cargas de saldo para celulares.
Comenta que esta actividad le conviene mucho ya todos los productos que ella ofrece son muy solicitado por los clientes.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de nuevos modelos de celulares para seguir brindando calidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The person responsible for starting this committee was Sra. Maria Luisa, who learned about the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs Program. She invited her friends and neighbors to form a solidarity group. They have been responsible and are currently in their fourth loan cycle. The members of the committee have demonstrated that they have the determination and good attitude needed for their work.

One of the members is Sra. Maria Luisa. She is a hardworking woman who has highly creative abilities. Maria has a good work ethic and helps all of the other members in their activities. She has a business selling mobile phones, phone accessories, and electronic loads for mobile phones. Maria says her business is suitable because all of the products she offers are in high demand among her customers.

She is requesting a loan to buy new models of mobile phones so that she can continue providing quality products to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase new models of mobile phones

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor tiene 29 años, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 3 años cultiva alfalfa y cría cuyes, por lo que cada día cuida con mucha dedicación ambas actividades, además cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa que la ayuda en el trabajo. Juntos han logrado en poco tiempo mejorar su condición de vida, por el bienestar de sus hijos. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que es independiente y en cuanto a la venta de cuyes tiene un cliente estable que siempre hace pedidos de la venta de este animal, además esta buscando oportunidades de mejorar sus ingresos. Su deseo es tener una granja de cuyes más grande y también extensiones de terreno. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará madera para construir nuevos galpones y también invertirá una parte en la instalación de fluido eléctrico para su casa, con el fin de tener iluminación en su granja ya que de noche es muy oscuro y le dificulta el trabajo de alimentar a sus animales.
texts.en:
Víctor is 29 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and three children. For more than three years he has been growing alfalfa and raising guinea pigs. He continues in both of these activities every day with great care and dedication. His wife supports him and helps him with the work. Gradually they have worked together to improve their living conditions for the benefit of their children. What he enjoys most about his work is being independent. Víctor has a stable customer base that is always submitting orders for guinea pigs, so he is looking for opportunities to improve his income. His wish is to have a larger guinea pig farm and more tracts of land.

This is his second loan with MFP. Víctor is very happy to know that he has a source of financial support, which explains why he has always demonstrated responsibility when making his payments. He enjoys being part of his Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people. Víctor is grateful to those individuals who will be approving his loan request because the money will be useful in helping him to make progress in his business. The loan will go toward the purchase of wood for building new pens. Part of the money will be used to have electricity installed into his home. This will allow him to have light on his farm because it is very dark at night, thereby making it difficult for him to feed the animals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood to build more guinea pig pens & pay to have electricity installed

loans.name: Jenet

texts.en: Jenet A. is single and prepares locally-made drinks with bread to sell at Elmina. She has been through senior high school. Jenet uses her income to pay for her accommodations and to take care of herself.  Jenet is of the view that the loan will enable her to produce in large quantities. She will therefore use the loan to buy more ingredients to make drinks to sell.  Jenet plans to reinvest the new profits from her expanded business,

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to make drinks to sell.

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
El Sr. Alfonso T. tiene 64 años de edad, esta en pareja y tiene hijos ya mayores e independientes.
El Sr. T. es propietario de una gomería hace más de 20 años, es una profesión que ya heredó de su padre.
Su actividad de servicios abarca a diferentes tipos de vehículos y su especialidad es en los camiones tipo Scania.
Su sueño es ampliar el salón donde recibe a sus clientes ya que parte de su infraestructura lo perdió en un incendio hace unos años atrás.
Solicita el crédito para la compray y  aumentar su stock de mercaderías en cuanto a cubiertas.
texts.en:
Sr. Alfonso T. is 64 years old, married, and has adult children who are independent. He is the owner of a tire repair shop that has been in operation for more than 20 years. Alfonso learned the profession from his father.

He provides replacement services for different types of vehicles, but his specialty is Scania commercial trucks. Alfonso hopes to expand the waiting room where he receives his customers since part of the infrastructure was damaged by a fire that occurred a few years ago.

He is requesting a loan to buy more tires so that he can increase his inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tires in different sizes

loans.name: Clemencia Juana

texts.es:
Clemencia de 54 años, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, a su alrededor tiene el estero salado), ella tiene una papelería, desde hace años para poder mantener y pasar mas tiempo con sus tres hijos. 

Ella tuvo que dejar su trabajo para poder estar mas tiempo con sus hijos, pero como no tenia ingresos suficientes invirtió sus ahorros en papelería para vender a sus vecinos, poco a poco con esfuerzo y ayuda de sus hijos ahora tiene un papelería, trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 21h00pm todos los días.    

Para surtir mas su tienda ella quiere comprar con el préstamo papelería y cuadernos. En el futuro quiere aumentar su negocio y tener un almacén.
texts.en:
Clemencia is 54 years old and lives along the Perimetral Highway of Guayaquil in a periurban area surrounded by a salt marsh. She manages a stationery shop that she started several years ago so that she could spend more time with her three children.

Clemencia quit her job in order to spend more time with her children. Since she no longer had sufficient income, she invested her savings in a stationery shop and began selling to her neighbors. With some effort and the help of her children, she gradually built up a fully functional business. She works every day from 7am to 9pm.

To restock her shop with more merchandise, Clemencia will use this loan to buy paper and notebooks. In the future, she wants to expand her business and open a warehouse.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase notebooks & paper

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El Sr. Juan V. tiene 65 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Aurora  Gayoso, de profesión ama de casa, tienen 2 hijos, ambos menores y cursando la secundaria.
El Sr. Juan es propietario de una herrería, profesión que fue adquirida por su padre, su actividad en forma independiente tiene 13 años de antigüedad. 
Sus principales clientes son los frigoríficos para quienes fabrica los ganchos para los diferentes cortes de carne y tiene clientes en las ciudades vecinas donde realiza variedad de trabajos de herrería.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de materia prima: variedad de cortes de hierros.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan V. is 65 years old and married to Sra. Aurora Gayoso, who is a homemaker. They have two children, both of whom are dependents and attending high school.

Sr. Juan owns a blacksmith shop and learned his profession from his father. He has worked independently for the past 13 years. His main customers are refrigeration companies that request for him to make hooks for hanging different cuts of meat. He has customers from nearby cities who are in need of the various services of a blacksmith.

Juan is requesting a loan to buy raw materials, specifically iron pieces of different sizes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase iron pieces of different sizes

loans.name: Gladys 	Virginia

texts.es: La Señora Gladys Madre de dos hijas muy responsables que lucha en la vida por darles una educación buena a ellas, la actividad que tiene es bastante humilde  sacrificada pero rentable, inicio su negocio ya hace dos años atrás obteniendo buenos resultados ya que las hamburguesas que realiza son muy agradables, debida  a esta razón es que se animo a solicitar un crédito para comprar un carrito mas grande donde pueda elaborar mas hamburguesas y mas rápido y asi los clientes también se sientan cómodos, siendo este un emprendimiento de una mujer es bastante valorado por el esfuerzo que realiza durante todos los días a partir de las 18:00 pm hasta las 24:00 pm, y esta es la rutina de la señora todos los días de la semana, para que sus niñas puedan estudiar dignamente.
texts.en:
Sra. Gladys is the mother of two responsible daughters and struggles in life to provide them with a good education. She has made sacrifices to operate her modest business, but it has been profitable. Gladys started selling hamburgers two years ago and has obtained good results. For this reason, she was motivated to apply for a loan in order to buy a larger food cart so that she could prepare more hamburgers in less time and make her customers feel comfortable. Being a woman entrepreneur, Gladys values the effort she puts into the work she performs every day from 6pm to midnight. Her daily routine enables her daughters to have a decent education.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a larger food cart for selling hamburgers

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua E. is married to a driver and lives together with her two children. She sells oranges, biscuits, body creams and hair lotions at Elmina.  She has received a senior high education. Efua uses her income to help her husband provide the basic needs of her family.  Efua will use the loan to purchase more fruits and other goods to bring variety into her business. With the new earnings, she hopes to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits and other goods

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence K. is 54 years old, married, and has 5 kids and 7 dependents. For the last 20 years, he has been operating his retail shop in Mityana Town.

On shillings 80,000 as profits per week, he has obtained a firm business footing. He began his business with savings from his agriculture business, and he still maintains his agro business as another source of income. Twenty years in any kind of business speaks volumes of somebody’s resilience, hard work, and maturity in making decisions aimed at solidifying his ventures.

Lawrence is happily married and all his children are at school. With this loan, he wants to purchase more retail items like sugar, salt, soap and plastics. He hopes to resell these as a means to an end in his quest for more profits.

loans.use: To purchase more retail items like sugar, plastics, salt, and soap for resale.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La Sra. Lucia A. tiene, 51 años D. edad, esta casada, y tiene 3 hijos, D. los cuales solo una es menor D. edad y esta cursando la secundaria.
La Sra. Lucia y su marido son docentes jubilados y ambos desD. el momento que inició el cobro D. sus jubilaciones decidieron abrir en su domicilio un copetín para dar servicios D. comidas y minutas a empleados D. un supermercado que se encuentra en frente D. su casa.
Solicita el crédito para la compra D.  materia prima como: carne, pollo, panificados, bebidas en general, aceite, harina y otros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lucía A., 51, is married and has three children only one of whom is still a minor and in middle school. Lucía and her husband are retired teachers and since they retired they opened a small snack bar in their home in order to proviD. meals and snacks to employees of a supermarket across the street from their home. She is asking for funds to buy raw materials like: meat, chicken, baked goods, assorted beverages, cooking oil, flour, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials like: meat, chicken, baked goods, assorted beverages, cooking oil, flour, etc.

loans.name: Bailarines Group

texts.es:
El grupo los Bailarines está conformado por Blas Antonio F., María Ines M. Mejía y Jenny Vanessa M. G. quienes son horrados, trabajadores, esforzados y emprendedores. Este grupo ha fructificado sus negocios por medio la oferta de créditos y  los programas de  capacitación los cual les ha permitido desarrollar sus negocios tener recursos y la forma de administrarlos.

El coordinador del grupo es el señor Blas Antonio F. quien es una persona muy activa e independiente. El inicio en el 2002 con una pequeña venta de de chiverías la cual por medio de los prestamos fue creciendo hasta tener una pulpería surtida en la que invertirá el crédito con la compra de granos básicos, chiverías, verduras, frutas etc.
Las otras integrantes del grupo  María Ines M. Mejía de 25 años de edad comercializa perfumes desde el 2006 y Jenny Vanessa M. G. quien comenzó vendiendo ropa por encargo luego instalo una pequeña tienda con una docena.
texts.en:
The Los Bailarines (The Dancers) group members are: Blas Antonio F., María Inés M. Mejía and Jenny Vanessa M. G.. They are honest, hard working, dedicated and enterprising. The group has strengthened their businesses thanks to loans and training workshops that have helped them develop their businesses, have resources and learn to administer them well. The group coordinator is Mr. Blas Antonio F. who is a very active and independent person. In 2002 he began selling yoghurt products. Thanks to the loans, the business gradually grew until he had a well-stocked grocery store. He will use the funds to invest in stock items like: basic grains, yoghurt products, vegetables, fruits, etc. The other group members are: María Inés M. Mejía, 25, who has sold perfume since 2006 and Jenny Vanessa M. G. who started out selling clothing on order and then set up a small store with a dozen.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: El Sr. Carlos vive en el barrio la cuchilla zona 5to anillo la ciudad de Santa Cruz, cuenta con un anticretico que consta de 2 cuartos, en la cual vive con sus 5 hijos y su esposa la misma es ama de casa. El se dedica al servicio de transporte interprovincial, que su ruta comprende, de la parada de la zona del mercado los pozos a tres cruzes y otras comunidades de la zona, cuenta con un vehiculo propio el cual fue adquirido con su esfuerzo propio, ademas de esto tambien tiene conocimiento de mecanica automotriz, el fin del prestamo solicitado sera invertido para hacerle un buen mantenimiento a su vehiculo en la compra de llantas y hacer un buen chaperio, por los muchos viajes a las provincias el vehiculo presenta muchas fallas y esto no le permite brindar un buen servicio, es muy trabajador y siempre pensando en el bienestar de su familia, esta muy agradecido por la oportunidad que se le brinda.
texts.en:
Carlos lives in the La Cuchilla neighborhood in Santa Cruz’s 5th Ring. He lives in a two-bedroom house under the anticrético modality (Anticrético is a transaction not available in the U.S. whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner loses the property to you). He lives with his wife and five children; his wife is a housewife. He provides interprovincial transportation services. His route is from the stop at the Pozos Market to Tres Cruces and other communities in the area. He owns his own vehicle which he acquired through his own efforts. In addition to this, he is versed in auto mechanics. The loan will be used to provide his vehicle with service and repair. He will buy tires and do some body work. Because of all the trips to the provinces, the vehicle is starting to show some wear and have some mechanical problems that prevent him from providing the very best service. He is very hard working and is always thinking about his family’s wellbeing. He is very grateful for the opportunity he is being given.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires and sheet metal.

loans.name: Amador

texts.es:
Amador es un padre de familia de 47 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos en el caserío Las Delicias del distrito de Oyotún, una zona agrícola ubicada a dos horas aproximadamente de  la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas desde hace mas de veinte años, actualmente cuenta con un terreno heredado de su padre con el cual se gana la vida sembrando diversos cereales como el arroz, debido a la abundancia de recurso hídrico en la zona, se suele sembrar arroz hasta dos veces por año. Esta actividad es la principal fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta por lo que siempre da lo mejor de su para mantenerse en el negocio y poder salir adelante.

Amador desea seguir trabajando durante esta temporada del año, el desea sembrar arroz en su campo de cultivo, para realizar su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

El es una persona trabajadora y bastante conocida en la zona por ser alguien amable y que siempre está dispuesto a ayudar cuando se le necesita. Su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para mejorar gradualmente la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Amador, 47, is a father who lives with his wife and two children in Las Delicias settlement, Oyotún district; a farming area located about two hours from the city of Chiclayo. He has been a farmer for over 20 years. He currently has a field that was passed down to him by his father that he earns his living on planting various crops like rice. Because of the abundant water sources in the area, rice tends to be planted up to twice a year. This activity is his main source of income so he always puts in his best effort to insure that his business is successful so that he can progress. Amador wants to continue working during this season. He wants to plant rice on his fields. To reach this goal he has called upon Edpyme Alternativa for the first time requesting a 1000 new sol loan. He is a hard working man who is well known in the area as being a kind person who is always willing to help out when needed. His greatest wish is to continue working and gradually improve his family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For expenses related to rice planting.

loans.name: Mujeres Victoriosas Group

texts.es: Doña Rigoberta es casada, no tuvo la oportunidad D. asistir a la escuela, tiene cinco hijos, el mayor D. doce años y la más pequeña D. cuatro años, el esposo se dedica a la agricultura y ella colabora con algunos gastos familiares, se dedica a la Crianza D. animales (Crianza D. Cerdos y Ovejas), cuenta con 8 años D. experiencia en ésta actividad. Contando con entusiasmo, deseos D. superación, propone a algunas vecinas organizar un grupo, con el fin D. poder solicitar un préstamo. El Banco Comunal se denomina MUJERES VICTORIOSAS, el nombré fue elegido por todas las integrantes con el pensamiento D. que ellas son capaces D. contribuir al desarrollo D. sus familias. Cada una D. ellas se dedican a diversas actividades entre ellos podemos mencionar, la crianza D. animales, elaboración D. canastas, venta D. artículos D. consumo diario y ropas típicas.  El préstamo ella lo utilizará para compra D. animales, así generar más ingresos. Ya que una D. las limitantes que tienen, ha sido la falta del capital, pero han salido adelante y esperan que su inversión crezca y genere más ingresos.
texts.en:
Rigoberta is married. She never went to school. She has five children; the oldest is 12 years old and the youngest is 4. Her husband is a farmer and she contributes to household expenses too raising pigs and sheep. She has been in this line of work for 8 years. Counting on enthusiasm and the desire for self-improvement, she proposed to a group of friends that they organize into a group in order to apply for a loan. Their communal bank is called MUJERES VICTORIOSAS (Victorious Women). The members chose the name thinking that they are capable of contributing to the development of their families. Each of them is involved in a different activity among which we can mention the following: raising small farm animals, basket weaving, the sale of daily use items, sale of typical costumes. She will use the loan to buy animals so that she can generate more income because one of the limiting factors she has faced is the lack of capital. However, they have gotten ahead and hope that their investment will grow and generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs and sheep.

loans.name: Milton Rene

texts.es: El Señor Rene vive en la casa de su Mama quien le ayuda en la crianza de sus animales, ya que el es soltero su mama le dijo que empiece un negocio y ahorre dinero para que pueda comprarse una casita ya que algún día te casaras cuenta el,  no sabia que hacer a que dedicarse y  empezó a trabajar como ayudante de un cerrajero pero no ganaba lo suficiente es por ese motivo que empezó a comprarse una vaquita y le fue bien cuando la vendió luego aumentando a eso compro dos ahora que subió no pudo comprar con lo que tenia es por ese motivo que se animo a sacar el  crédito y así poder aumentar para comprarse una vaquita, viendo sus necesidades nosotros le dimos un crédito kiva y esta muy feliz por eso y muy agradecido por la oportunidad.
texts.en:
René lives in his mother’s house. She helps him raise his animals because he’s single. He told us that his mother told him to start his business and save money so that he can afford a small house because someday he will marry. He didn’t know what to do. He started working as an assistant to a locksmith but he didn’t make much money that way so he decided to buy a little cow. When he sold her he did well. So next he increased his purchase to two cows. Now that prices have risen, however, he is unable to afford to buy more so he ventured to request a loan to be able to buy another little cow. Seeing his need, we granted him a Kiva loan and he is very happy and grateful for the opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Lucia está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, emprendedoras y luchadoras quienes han formado y desarrollado sus negocios con la ayuda de Adim tanto en la oferta de créditos como con  los programas de  capacitación los cuales son  Desarrollo Humano con Enfoque de Género, Desarrollo Empresarial con Enfoque de Género, Intercambio Empresarial  y Articulación de Actores. 

La coordinadora del grupo es la joven Neysi Rebeca C. V. tiene una pequeña librería y comercializa cosméticos y ropa nueva y usada. Esta joven de 25 años inicio con la ayuda de la Asociación de Promotores de la Cultura donde estudio operador en computación  y como forma de apoyarlos les dio un financiamiento para que iniciaran su negocio.

C. decide poner una librería y luego para aumentar el negocio empezó a prestar e invirtió en otro negocio  que es en ropa y cosméticos. Ella actualmente desea aumentar su librería negocio muy bueno especialmente en la época escolar y  con el préstamo comprara  productos para la librería y pacas de ropa.

Las otras integrantes son Idalia U. quien vende frescos, gaseosas y comida casera, y Karla C. de 21 años la cual para poder costear sus estudios y lograr ser una enfermera empezó hace dos años y medio a vender nacatamales, platillo típico que se consume generalmente los fines de semana.
texts.en:
The Santa Lucía group is composed of three hard working, enterprising, tenacious women who have formed and developed their businesses with Adim’s help both through loans and training workshops in Human Development with an emphasis on Gender, Business Development with an emphasis on Gender Focus, Business Interchange and Intercommunication. The group coordinator is Neysi Rebeca C. V.. She has a small bookstore and also sells cosmetics and both new and used clothing. This young 25-year-old started out with support from the Cultural Promoters Association where she studied to be a computer operator and as a way of helping them got financing to start the business. Ms. C. decided to establish a bookstore and later, in order to increase business, invested in a second line of work which is clothing and cosmetics sales. She wants to expand the bookstore which is a very good business especially during the school year. She will use the loan to buy stock items for the bookstore as well as bundles of clothing. The other group members are Idalia U. who sells juices, soft-drinks and home-cooked meals and Karla C., 21, who started to sell nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales, a typical food consumed mostly on weekends) two years ago in order to earn money to pay for her nursing studies.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For notebooks, paste, pencils, erasers, scissors, etc. and clothing.

loans.name: Minna Esi

texts.en: Minna Esi A. operates a provisions shop at Elmina.  Minna Esi has a senior high educational background.  She is married and has two children. Her husband is a security man. Minna Esi has been operating a provisions shop for three years. She helps her husband take care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy extra provisions to fill her shop. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to establish another shop in a different location and if the business should expand, to build a house for her children.

loans.use: To buy extra provisions to fill her shop

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene, de 31 años, es una joven soltera muy emprendedora, vive en casa de sus padres. Marlene, se dedica diariamente a vender periódicos, revistas y dulces en general. Procura siempre colocar en orden para que sea vistoso y sea fácil la venta. Su kiosco se encuentra ubicado en el paradero de buses, favoreciéndole la venta por ser muy concurrida, este negocio le es rentable. Años atrás este puesto de periódicos era de su madre, en donde la ayudaba en el trabajo pero luego que falleciera, se hizo cargo del kiosco. Hoy se siente satisfecha por el trabajo que desempeña; ya han transcurrido 2 años y ahora su mayor prioridad es terminar de construir su casa para instalar una bodega en donde tiene la ilusión de vender productos comestibles, ya que por barrio donde vive hace falta este servicio. Es su primer crédito con MFP y sabe que el crédito le será muy útil para aumentar su capital de trabajo, por lo que se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo. Con el crédito que solicita, adquirirá más revistas y accesorios para su negocio, de esa manera  abastecer su kiosco.
texts.en:
Marlene is 31 years of age and an enterprising young woman who lives at her parents' house. Every day she sells newspapers, magazines, and candy. Marlene always tries to arrange her products in a way that they can be seen and easily sold. Her kiosk is situated in a favorable location at a busy bus stop, thereby helping to make her business profitable. Years ago this newsstand belonged to her mother and Marlene helped with the work, but she took over after her passing. Today she is satisfied with her work. Two years have passed and now her greatest priority if finishing the construction of her house so that she can establish a store where she can sell groceries. Her neighborhood is lacking this type of service.

This is her first loan with MFP. Marlene knows the loan will be very useful in increasing her operating capital, so she commits to completing all of her payments on time. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more magazines and accessories for her business so that her kiosk remains well-stocked.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase magazines & newpapers

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANTU DE SAN JERONIMO”; La  socia vive en la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Ana; ella tiene 32 años de edad y La socia es natural de San Jerónimo, ella es casada,  Ella es comerciante minorista, la soca tienen una tienda de abarrotes, desde hace 9 años,  la socia se dedica a administrar su tienda de abarrotes  e implementa cada cierto tiempo para que siempre este llena y tenga todo para satisfacer a sus clientes. La socia solicita el préstamo para poder comprar mercadería para implementar y así mejorar sus ventas en su negocio.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “KANTU DE SAN JERONIMO” communal bank. She lives in the province and department of Cusco. Her name is Ana, and she is 32 years old. She is from San Jerónimo, and she is married. Her business is retail trade: she has operated a grocery store for the past 9 years. She manages the store herself and stocks it regularly to make sure it is always full of everything necessary to satisfy her customers. Ana is requesting a loan to buy merchandise to stock her store and thus improve her sales. Ana infinitely values and appreciates the loan offered to her, since it will allow her to expand her business and improve her quality of life; accordingly, she is committed to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise to stock her store and improve her sales

loans.name: Obdulia

texts.es:
La Sra. Obdulia S., tiene 53 años de edad, es soltera, tuvo 3 hijos, todos mayores e independientes.
La Sra. Obdulia se dedica hace más de 30 años a la  compra- venta de articulos deportivos, perfumes, cosméticos generales, jeans, camisas y demás artículos de vestir a créditos, sus principales clientes son los empleados de las fabricas cercanas a su domicilio, como también los empleados de estaciones de servicios. 
Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías como: jeans, calzados deportivos, camisas, celulares, perfumes y otros.
texts.en:
Ms. Obdulia S. is 53 years old, single, and has three children who are all grown-up and independent now. Ms. Obdulia has devoted over 30 years to buying and selling sporting goods, perfumes, cosmetics, jeans, shirts, and other items of clothing on credit. Her main customers are the employees of the factories near her house, as well as employees of nearby service stations. She is requesting this loan to buy merchandise like: jeans, athletic footwear, shirts, cell phones, perfumes, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy jeans, athletic footwear, shirts, cell phones, perfumes, and other items

loans.name: Tres Combos Group

texts.es:
El grupo Tres Combos está integrado por tres personas trabajadoras una de ellas es la joven Mariela del Socorro M. C. de 19 años quien desde 2008 se dedica al comercio de cosméticos de la marca Avon reconocida por sus ventas vía catalogo. 

Los otros integrantes del grupo son Ana María P. quien vende ropa y Marció Norlando Q. J. quien se dedica a prestar desde hace un año.
texts.en:
The Tres Combos Group is made up of three hard-working individuals. One of them is the young Mariela del Socorro M. C., who is 19 years old. Since 2008, she has worked as a cosmetics saleswoman for Avon, the brand known for its catalog sales. The other members of the group are Ana María P., who sells clothing, and Marció Norlando Q. J., who has been working for a year.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Avon cosmetics

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANTU DE SAN JERONIMO”; La  socia vive en la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Beatriz; ella tiene 41 años de edad y La socia es natural de de San Sebastián,   ella es soltera y vive sola, la socia trabaja como profesora en una escuela primaria en el distrito de San Sebastián, ella adora su trabajo y es considerada una excelente profesional, La socia solicita el préstamo para poder comprar materiales de trabajo para enseñar a sus niños diferentes almanaques y preparar sus clases de forma más dinámica.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Our associate is part of the “Kantu de San Jeronimo” communal bank and lives in the province and department of Cusco. She is Beatriz, is 41 years old, and a native of San Sebastián. She is single, lives alone, and works as a teacher at an elementary school in the San Sebastián district. She loves her work and others consider her to be very professional. She is asking for this loan so that she can buy working materials to be able to teach her schoolchildren from different books and also make her classes more dynamic. [Beatriz] infinitely values and appreciates this loan which will allow her to grow with her business and improve her quality of life. She promises to repay the loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies with which to teach in school

loans.name: Ayde Marisol

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANTU DE SAN JERONIMO”; La  socia vive en la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Ayde; ella tiene 31 años de edad y La socia es natural de San Jerónimo,  ella es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo,  vive con su pareja su hijo y sus padres, ella es docente de profesión y su conyugue es obrero, maestro de obras, La socia desea poder mejorar su casa y comprar algunos artefactos, ella está pensando en priorizar en algunos que le hagan falta de inmediato, ella comprará tal vez, una lavadora o una nueva cocina. La socia solicita el préstamo para poder comprar un artefacto está pensando entre una nueva cocina o una lavadora.

La socia valora y agradece el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite mejorar su calidad de vida, ella se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “KANTU DE SAN JERONIMO” communal bank. She lives in the province and department of Cusco. Her name is Ayde; she is 31 years old and comes from San Jerónimo. She has a live-in partner and one child. She lives with her partner, her child, and her parents. She is a teacher by profession, and her partner is a laborer and construction supervisor. Ayde would like to be able to improve her home and buy some household appliances. She is thinking of prioritizing some items that her household needs immediately. She may buy a washing machine or a new stove. She is requesting the loan so that she can buy an appliance; she is thinking of a new stove or a washing machine. Ayde values and appreciates the loan granted to her, since it will permit her to improve her quality of life; accordingly, she is committed to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a home appliance; she is considering a new stove or a washing machine

loans.name: Ramona Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Sra. Ramona C. tiene 27 años de edad, esta en pareja, tiene una hija de 3 años.
La Sra. Ramona es propietaria de un salón de belleza hace más de 7 años, este servicio presta en un salón comercial en la zona céntrica de la ciudad de Mariano R. Alonso.
Se inició primeramente  como ayudante de peluquería con una vecina cuando tenia 15 años, con esa experiencia descubrió su vocación, desde ese momento sus padres con mucho esfuerzo le pagaron sus estudios de peluquería y  luego se empleo en peluquerías y ahorró para la montar su propia peluquería.
Su sueño es abrir una sucursal para así brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientelas y también crear fuentes de trabajo.
Solicita el Cto. Para la compra de materia prima: como tintes, cremas, shampoo,cremas para tratamientos y otros.
texts.en:
Ms. Ramona C. is 27 years old. She is in a relationship and has a three year-old daughter. Ms. Ramona has been the proprietor of a beauty salon for over seven years. She provides her services in a commercial space located in central Mariano R. Alonso. She got her start as a hairdressing assistant for a neighbor when she was 15 years old. Through this experience, she discovered her calling. From that moment on, her parents, with much effort, paid for her to study hairdressing. She then worked in hair salons and saved up to start her own hair salon. Her dream is to open another branch of her shop, in order to offer better service to her clients and also to create jobs. She is requesting this loan to purchase materials like: dyes, conditioners, shampoo, treatment creams, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy materials like: dyes, conditioners, shampoo, treatment creams, and other items

loans.name: Primero Dios Group

texts.es:
El grupo Primero Dios está conformado por Damaso V., María Luisa Mejía, Sandra de los Ángeles L. personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras. V. es el coordinador del grupo y desde hace cinco años que se dedica al cultivó y pica leña. Este señor de 56 años quien tiene tres hijos de 2, 17 y 19 años invertirá el crédito en la siembra de maíz.

Las integrantes del grupo son María Luisa Mejía quien comercializa sandalias y Sandra de los Ángeles L.  vende ropa a la moda, de diferentes estilos, colores y formas.
texts.en:
The Primero Dios ("God First") Group is made up of Damaso V., María Luisa Mejía, and Sandra de los Ángeles L., who are all hard-working and enterprising people. V. is the group coordinator and he has worked for five years growing and chopping firewood. He is 56 years old and has three children who are 2, 17, and 19 years old. He will invest this loan in sowing corn. The other group members are María Luisa Mejía, who sells sandals, and Sandra de los Ángeles L., who sells fashionable clothing of various styles, colors, and shapes.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sowing corn

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANTU DE SAN JERONIMO”; La  socia vive en la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Margarita; ella tiene 43 años de edad y La socia es natural de San Jerónimo, ella es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos,   la socia es natural de Quincemil en la ceja de selva del territorio peruano, su conyugue es albañil y ella se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir, para damas, caballeros y niños, ella acomodó un pequeño espacio en su casa y hay trabaja fabricando todo tipo de ropa a la medida y gusto del cliente. La socia solicita el préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos de cocer y otros.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “Kantu de San Jerónimo” communal bank. She lives in the province and department of Cusco.

The member is Margarita. She is 43 years old and is a native to San Jerónimo. She has a live-in partner and has 4 children. She is native to Quincemil in the fringes of the jungle on Peruvian territory. Her partner is a bricklayer and she works making clothing for women, men, and children. She arranged a small space in her house and she works there making all types of clothing fit to the size and taste of the customer. She is requesting the loan to be able to purchase fabrics, sewing thread and other items.

Margarita values and is infinitely grateful for the loan provided since it allows her to grow with her business and improve her quality of life. Likewise, she promises to make her loan payments according to the stipulated time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To be able to purchase fabrics, sewing thread and other items.

loans.name: Yenny

texts.es:
Yenny es una madre de familia de 32 años de edad que vive junto a su padre y a su menor hijo en el distrito de Cayaltí, una zona agrícola que ha venido experimentando un crecimiento comercial moderado, se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica al negocio de la crianza y venta de animales, ella cría aves de corral como patos, pavos y gallinas en diversos corrales situados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, usualmente los ofrece a sus clientes por pedidos, generalmente se los piden con ocasión de festividades especiales y también los vende en restaurantes de la zona. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad ella apoya económicamente a su familia.

Yenny desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas alimento para que sus aves se desarrollen rápidamente, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su meta.

Yenny es una mujer que gusta mucho de las actividades que realiza, ella siempre da lo mejor de si para seguir adelante y poder ayudar a su familia a tener una mejor calidad de vida, en la zona todos la conocen por ser una mujer tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Yenny is a 32 year-old mother who lives with her father and her young son in the Cayaltí district. It is an agricultural area that has been experiencing moderate commercial growth, located one hour from the city of Chiclayo. She devotes herself to the business of raising and selling animals. She raises caged birds such as ducks, turkeys, and chickens in various cages located behind her house. She usually takes orders from her customers, who generally request them for special occasions. She also sells them to restaurants in the area. She supports her family economically with the income from this business. Yenny would like to expand her business by purchasing more feed, so that her birds will develop more rapidly. This is why she is requesting a loan through Edpyme Alternativa for the first time. A loan of 1,500 nuevos soles will help her to achieve her goal. Yenny is a woman who enjoys her work.
