She always does her best in order to get ahead and to be able to help her family to have a better quality of life. In the area where she lives, everyone knows her as a calm and responsible woman.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy feed in order to expand her business raising and selling animals

loans.name: Adoté Novignon

texts.en:
Monsieur Adoté A. is 29 years old and lives in Lomé, Togo. He is married to an accountant and they have one child.

Recently, Adoté purchased a motorcycle for his business as a motorcycle taxi driver in the city. Here in Lomé, this is a lucrative business. Moto-taxis, or Zemidjans as they are called here, are the most common form of transportation in the city. With this new motorcycle he will be able to attract more customers and provide a better service to his clients as well. He has requested a loan of 500,000 CFA for the purchase, insurance, and plates for this new motorcycle.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle, insurance, and registration.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es: La Señora Jovita vive  en alquiler con sus seis hijitos que se encuentran en edad escolar y su esposo ella se dedica a la repostería ya bastantes años. Ella comenzó desde que era pequeña su mama le enseño a hacer pan de arroz y otros es así como la señora mantiene a su familia, ahora ya tiene clientes y pedidos es por eso que saco el crédito y es el primer crédito que ella saca por eso le dimos con crédito  kiva ahora puede comprar sus insumos como harina, levadura, azúcar y otras cositas que necesita para la elaboración de sus productos, esta agradecida  a la institución por la oportunidad que se le brindo.
texts.en:
Ms. Jovita lives in a rented home with her six school-aged children and her husband. She has worked for quite a few years making pastries. She started when she was small and her mother taught her how to make rice bread and other foods. This is how she provides for her family. Now she has customers and orders, and that is why she is taking out this loan, which is her first. Emprender told her that with a loan through Kiva, she will be able to buy her ingredients like flour, yeast, sugar, and other things that she needs to make her products. She is grateful to the organization for the opportunity offered to her.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, and other ingredients

loans.name: David Pastor

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “KANTU DE SAN JERONIMO”; El  socio vive en la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
El  socio es el Sr. David; el tiene 41 años de edad y El socio es conviviente y tienen 3 hijos, él socio tienen superior incompleta, el dejó los estudios por dedicarse al trabajo cuando tuvo  su primer hijo por que necesitaban darle todas las comodidades, desde entonces el socio se dedicó a trabajar, él tienen su carpintería metálica, el socio se encarga de fabricar escaleras metálicas, puertas, rejas, andamios y demás trabajos. El socio solicita el préstamo para poder invertir en su taller de carpintería metálica, él comprará un máquina trasformadora.

El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “Kantu de San Jerónimo” communal bank. He lives in the province and department of Cusco.

The member is David and he is 41 years old. He has a live-in partner and they have 3 children. He has incomplete post-secondary studies. He left his studies to dedicate himself to working when he had his first son because he needed to provide him all of the commodities. Since then, he has been working and he has a metalwork workshop. He is in charge of making metal stairs, doors, railings, scaffolding and other jobs. He is requesting the loan to be able to invest in his metalwork workshop. He will purchase a transformer.

David values and is infinitely grateful for the loan provided since it allows him to grow with his business and improve his quality of life. Likewise, he promises to make his loan payments according to the stipulated time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To be able to invest in his metalwork workshop and purchase a transformer.

loans.name: San Pedro Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Pedro lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es Virginia Velázquez quienes hace ocho años inicio con la venta de gaseosas y jugos actualmente comercializa cosméticos. Ella es madre y padre de joven de 19 años el cual está en su último año de secundaria.
  
Los otros integrantes de grupo son Jeni C. Valberde y Norlan C. ambos se dedican al comercio de pollo crudo. Ellos con el préstamo invertirán en su negocio para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The San Pedro group is made up of three hard working, dedicated, enterprising people. One of them is Virginia Velázquez. Eight years ago she started selling soft drinks and juices and now sells cosmetics. She is both mother and father to a 19-year-old son who is in his last year of middle school. The other group members are Jeni C. Valberde and Norlan C. both of whom are raw chicken merchants. They will use the loan to invest in their business to continue forward.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For cosmetics.

loans.name: Akpéné

texts.en: Madame Akpéné E. is 38 years old and lives in Lomé, Togo. She is married to a man in the military and they have two children. Madame E. sells medicines out of a basket that she carries with her throughout Adidogomé Quartier of Lomé. She purchases her merchandise mostly at the Grand Market in Lomé or in Accra in neighboring Ghana. She’s been in business since 2005. Madame E. is now taking her third loan from WAGES of 500,000 CFA. She will use the loan to purchase different kinds of local and imported medicines to sell.

loans.use: To purchase medicine and other health products.

loans.name: Leopoldo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “KANTU DE SAN JERONIMO”; El  socio vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
El  socio es el Sr. Leopoldo; el tiene 33 años de edad y El socio es casado él terminó solo la secundaria y no pudo estudiar algo superior, él socio tienen 2 hijos, él socio es natural de H. y él es de profesión mecánico, el socio trabaja arreglando automóviles, el socio tiene su taller y él está implementando poco a poco comprando máquinas para hacer su trabajo cada ves más práctico.

El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “Kantu de San Jerónimo” communal bank. He lives in the district of Huanchac and in the department of Cusco.

The member is Leopoldo and he is 33 years old and married. He finished only his secondary studies and could not complete any post-secondary studies. He has 2 children and is a native of H.. He is a mechanic and he works fixing cars. He has his workshop and he is setting it up little by little, purchasing machines to be able to do his work more practically.

David values and is infinitely grateful for the loan provided since it allows him to grow with his business and improve his quality of life. Likewise, he promises to make his loan payments according to the stipulated time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install machines for the mechanic shop

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: La Señora Antonia vive en la casa de su hermana donde tiene su tiendita de barrio ella comenzó con este negocio porque su hermana la empujo a que realice alguna actividad  ya que la señora no tenia ingresos ya viendo eso su hermana le presto para que comenzara y poco a poco fue comprando cada día mas cositas para su tiendita la señora saco el crédito para poder comprar arroz, azúcar, fideo, refrescos, dulces, galletas y otros para surtir mas su tiendita ya que por donde vive tiene bastante demanda ahora ella esta feliz porque le dimos la oportunidad de darle el crédito y especialmente con kiva.
texts.en:
Antonia lives in her sister’s house where she has a small neighborhood grocery store. She started the business because her sister pushed her to get involved in something because she had no income. Seeing this, her sister made a loan to her so that she could start and gradually she bought more and more items for her store. She requested the loan to buy rice, sugar, pasta, beverages, candy, cookies and other items to stock her store because around where she lives there is a lot of demand. She is happy because we gave her this opportunity to have a loan especially with Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries, rice, sugar, beverages.

loans.name: Javier Fausto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “KANTU DE SAN JERONIMO”; El  socio vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo en la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
El  socio es el Sr. Fausto; el tiene 28 años de edad y el socio es padre soltero y tiene 1 hijo, el socio  es mecánico de profesión, el socio vive solo en su taller de este modo el ahorra alquileres y cuida su negocio. El socio desea comprar pinturas para autos, para pintar y una maquina compresora. El socio solicita el préstamo para poder comprar una maquina compresora y pintura para autos.

El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “Kantu de San Jerónimo” communal bank. He lives in the district of San Jerónimo and in the department of Cusco.

The member is Fausto. He is 28 years old and is a single father of one son. He works as a mechanic. He lives alone in his workshop and saves rentals and takes care of his business. Fausto wants to purchase car paint to paint and a compressor machine. He is requesting the loan to be able to purchase a compressor and car paint.

Fausto values nd is infinitely grateful for the loan provided since it allows him to grow with his business and improve his quality of life. Likewise, he promises to make his loan payments according to the stipulated time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a compressor and car paint.

loans.name: Petronila De Las Mercedes

texts.es:
Petronila de 58 años, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, a su alrededor tiene el estero salado), ella tiene un puesto de comidas, vende “bolones” (son bolas de plátano con queso o cuero de chicharrón), y tortillas de plátanos. 

Ella comenzó con su negocio desde que se separo de su esposo, tuvo que comenzar a trabajar vendiendo bolones y tortilla poco a poco con la ayuda de su mama, pudo pagarles la educación a sus hijos. trabaja desde las 07:00 hasta las 12h00pm.   

Ella quiere con el préstamo comprar cemento y bloques para readecuar un cuarto para alquilarlo y así tener mas ingresos, en el futuro quiere seguir construyendo departamentos para alquilar.
texts.en:
Petronila, 58, lives in along Guayaquil’s beltway, a periurbanarea surrounded by a salty estuary. She has a fast-food stall where she sells “bolones” (banana balls stuffed with cheese or fried pork skin) and banana tortillas. She started her business when she separated from her husband. She had to start selling bolones and tortillas. Gradually, with help from her mother, she was able to pay for her children’s education. She works from 7am until 12pm. She wants funding to buy cement and concrete blocks in order to refurbish a room so that she can rent it out for extra income. In the future, she’d like to continue building rooms to rent.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For cement and concrete blocks.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes B. is married and has a child. She has received a junior high education. Agnes travels to buy gari in sacks and comes back to sell in smaller quantities at Elmina. She has been in this business for two years. Her husband is a mason. Agnes uses her income to help her husband ensure the wellbeing of the entire family. Agnes will use the loan to purchase more gari to distribute to her increasing number of customers. With the new revenues from her expanded business, Agnes plans to save towards her child’s education.

loans.use: To purchase more gari

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es: Enrique, de 42 años de edad, vive en compañía de su esposa y sus 2 hijos. Se dedica a brindar servicio de movilidad con su moto carro, para ello cuenta con una empresa formal. Desde entonces empieza a trabajar por las mañanas, ofreciendo este servicio a los niños que acompañados de sus madres van a la escuela raudamente, durante el día transporta a todos los transeúntes que requieran de sus servicios. Afirma que este año no ha tenido mayores riesgos; por lo que se siente muy tranquilo, además las ganancias son regulares que le ayudan a sustentar a su familia. Para el futuro tiene planeado retomar el trabajo en el campo ya que necesita de capital para comprarse otra moto. Para él, es su primer crédito con MFP, y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que sabe que le será muy útil para seguir trabajando con su moto carro. Piensa invertir el crédito que solicita en la compra de llantas para cambiar las que tiene su moto para que pueda trabajar sin problemas.
texts.en:
Enrique is 42 years old and lives with his wife and two children. His business is providing transportation services in his moto-car. He has recently started working in the mornings, offering this service to mothers taking their children to school. During the day he transports anyone else who needs his services. He tells us that he has not had to take many risks this year and he is relaxed. His income is steady and it helps him to support his family. In the future he plans to restart working in the fields because he needs capital to buy another motorcycle. This will be his first loan through MFP and he is committed to making his payments on time, because he knows that the money will be very useful for him to continue working with his moto-car. He will use the money from this loan to replace the tires so that he can work without any problems.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tire replacement

loans.name: Justino

texts.es: El Señor Justino tiene un taller de costura, desde hace seis años, trabaja junto con su esposa, actividad donde confeccionan poleras, chamarras, deportivos, actividad donde les va muy bien le realizan pedidos y también su esposa entrega a los distintos puestos de venta del mercado de la ciudad, este crédito es para la compra de telas e hilos, tiene un pedido de  poleras para un sindicato. Tiene casa propia, tiene tres hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, es su primer crédito con emprender, el señor es garante de un cliente antiguo, según referencias indican que es responsable y muy trabajador, esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindad en la otorgación del credito.
texts.en:
Justino has had a tailor shop for the past six years. He works alongside his wife. They make jackets, t-shirts and athletic wear. They do well in that they get orders to fill and his wife also distributes product among various market stalls in the city. The loan will be used to buy fabric and thread because he has a pending order for t-shirts for a labor union. He owns his own house and has three school aged children. This is his first loan with Emprender. He acted as guarantor for a long-standing client and, according to his references, is responsible and very hard working. He is grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in him upon granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Ariel David

texts.es: El Señor Ariel se dedica a la mecánica de automóviles a diesel y gasolina lo cual tiene experiencia de mas de 8 años en el oficio, tiene su pequeño taller de autos lo cual trabaja juntamente con su hermano, el señor vive en casa familiar con su esposa y su pequeña hija la casa es de su tío, Ariel adquirió la profesión de su Papa el señor David que falleció el le enseño el oficio, Su Padre también era cliente de emprender y tuvo varios créditos con fondos kiva, lamentablemente el señor falleció, pero su hijo deseoso de seguir con la institución se le dio un crédito con tasa preferencial kiva, Con el dinero del credito comprara una variedad de repuestos para automoviles y asi poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, el señor esta agradecido con kiva por que le ayuda mucho en la compra de repuestos que los compra al por mayor. "gracias kiva"
texts.en:
Ariel is both a diesel and gasoline auto mechanic. He has over 8 years experience in this occupation. He has a small auto shop where he works alongside his brother. He lives with his wife and young daughter in his uncle’s house. Ariel learned his profession from his father, David, who has passed away. He trained him, though. His father was also a client of Emprender and had several loans through Kiva. Sadly, he died, but his son, wanting to continue with the institution was granted a loan at Kiva’s preferential rate. He will use the funds to buy an assortment of auto replacement parts so that he can provide improved customer service. He is grateful to Kiva because it helped him a lot in buying the parts which he was able to get at wholesale. “Thank you Kiva”

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy auto replacement parts.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 62 años de edad, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo y sus 2 hijos. El negocio al que se dedica es la venta de objetos artesanales y  artículos para el hogar, dejando primero a crédito, y luego de un tiempo considerable, sus clientes le van pagando. Este trabajo le genera satisfacciones económicas, además le agrada mucho la actividad que hace, lleva ya 15 años apoyando a su madre, desde entonces jamás renuncio a ello, y cuando se casó; su horario lo adecuo de acuerdo al tiempo que dispone, para ofrecer sus productos. Sus planes a futuro es ampliar y diversificar su negocio, con la finalidad de introducir mayor cantidad productos, para satisfacer a sus clientes. Este es su quinceavo crédito con MFP, y su compromete en pagar como en anteriores ocasiones, además está conforme con sus compañeras, ya que son responsables. Gloria piensa invertir el crédito que solicita en comprar cajas de cervezas, así podrá aumentar las utilidades de su negocio.
texts.en:
Gloria is 62 years old. She lives in her own house in the company of her husband and 2 children. The business in which she works is the sale of artisanal objects and household items, allowing on credit first and her customers pay her later, after a considerable amount of time. This job brings her economic satisfaction. In addition, she likes very much the work that she does. She has been helping her other for 15 years and since then, she has never stopped. When she got married, she adjusted her schedule to her time available to sell her products. Her future plans are to expand and diversify her business, with the end goal of bringing in a larger quantity of products to satisfy her customers. This is her fifteenth loan with MFP and she promises to make her payments just like in the past. In addition, she is happy with her fellow members since they are responsible. Gloria plans to invest the loan that she is requesting in the purchase of crates of beers to increase the profits of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase crates of beer to diversify her merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy supplies like fungicides, nitrogenated manure, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a piece of property (a lot).

loans.name: Justo

texts.es: El Sr. Justo, vive en zona radial 26 y quinto anillo,  de la cuidad de Santa Cruz, cuenta con una vagoneta propia que trabaja prestando el servicio de taxi en el area urbana, vive como casero en las oficinas de la linea de micros 40, tiene un nucleo familar que esta constituido por su hijo de unos tres años de edad, su esposa realiza la actividad de limpieza en las mencionadas oficinas que recibe una sueldo que le ayuda a los gastos que su esposo realiza en el hogar, llego a nuestra oficina por promociones que se realizo en la zona y por recomendación de algunos clientes que se tiene por esa zona, El Sr. Justo tiene la nesecidad de hace que es la de mejorar  su vehiculo y lo mas importante de cambiar las llantas del mismo para brindar seguridad y eficiencia en su trabajo, por este motivo el solicita un credito para poder comprar llantas para su automovil y brindar un mejor servicio de transporte urbano, con los ingresos que cubre su deuda y para vivir y poder ahorrar para comprarse un lote, esta muy agradecido por la oportunidad que se le brinda.
texts.en:
Justo lives in Santa Cruz’s Radial Zone 26, Fifth Ring. He owns a van with which he provides urban taxi services. He lives as a watchman in the Microbus Line 40 offices. His nuclear family is made up of a three-year-old son and his wife is employed in the above-mentioned offices as a cleaning woman; her salary helps her husband meet household expenses. He came to our office thanks to a promotional campaign in his area and recommended by some of the clients we have in that area. Justo needs to make some improvements on his vehicle; specifically he needs to replace the tires in order to offer enhanced safety and efficiency in his work. For this reason, he is asking for a loan to buy tires for his car and provide better urban transportation service. His earnings will be used to repay the loan and to cover household expenses and also to save in order to buy a lot. He is very grateful for the opportunity this opens up for him.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José Luis es un padre de familia de 31 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijas en el distrito de Chepén, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial situada en la provincia del mismo nombre, dentro de la región La Libertad a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace tres años a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina con la que se brinda servicio de transporte), el brinda su servicio dentro de la ciudad de Chepén y con las ciudades cercanas durante la mayor parte del día. En la zona estos vehículos son bastante frecuentados ya que ofrecen la posbilidad de contar con un medio de transporte barato, por lo que la demanda siempre es estable.

El contínuo uso brindado a su vehículo ha hecho que este empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a realizar esta acción.

José Luis siempre trabaja de la mejor manera posible para poder ayudar a su familia a salir adelante, su mayor anhelo es brindarles la posibilidad de superarse y mejorar su calidad de vida de manera gradual. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institucion demostrando puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
José Luis, 31, is a father living with his wife and his two daughters in Chepén, an agricultural area with lots of commercial activity located in Chepén province within La Libertad region an hour from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital. For the last three years he has provided passenger and cargo transportation services in a mototaxi (a motorcycle with an attached cabin used to provide transportation services). He provides service within the city of Chepén and with nearby cities most of the day. In the area these vehicles are quite popular because they provide an inexpensive mode of transportation so demand is always steady. The continuous use of his vehicle has caused it to start to have some mechanical difficulties that require urgent attention to guarantee correct functioning. Therefore, he is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new sol loan that will make this operation possible. José Luis always works in the best way possible to provide for his family and help them succeed. His greatest wish is to give them the possibility of self improvement and to improve their quality of life gradually. He has collaborated with our Institution in the past and has shown punctuality and responsibility with respect to repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For mototaxi repairs and service.

loans.name: Pedro Buenaventura

texts.es:
Pedro de 41 años, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, a su alrededor tiene el estero salado), el tiene un taller de metales es cerrajero desde que su papa le enseño y también con la ayuda de sus estudios en cerrajería.  

Cuando comenzó a ser cerrajero tuvo que trabajar muy duro para poder tener el taller en su casa, poco a poco compro los materiales y las maquinas, ahora el taller lo tiene en la parte delantera de su casa para mas facilidad. Trabaja solo desde muy temprano hasta el anochecer. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar una maquina soltadora para su negocio, en el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Pedro, age 41, lives along Guayaquil’s beltway, a periurban area surrounded by a salty estuary. He has a metal shop. He has been a locksmith since his father taught him. His locksmith studies also helped him. When he started to be a locksmith he had to work very hard to be able to have a shop in his house. Little by little he bought the materials and the machines. Now he has his shop in the front part of his house, and it is easier. He works alone from very early until the evening. He wants to use the loan to buy a welding machine for his business. In the future he wants to finish building his house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Welding machine

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: Cecilia tiene 56 años de edad, vive junto a su hija en su casa que gracias a mucho esfuerzo logró adquirir. Ella se dedica en la venta de comida, en las afueras de su domicilio, en un inicio vendía juguetes entre otros artículos. Cecilia es una mujer muy carismática y siempre tiene muchas energías para trabajar, es por ello que tiene varios clientes los cuales que siempre la consideran. Actualmente prepara chocolate caliente, pues este postre tiene mucha demanda en la temporada en la que vive. En un futuro quiere un negocio más estable como una tienda y dejarle este negocio a su hija, ya que le gusta este tipo de actividad. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete en ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, quiere comprarse mayor cantidad de ingredientes para preparar sus platillos así como chocolates.
texts.en:
Cecilia is 56 years old. She lives together with her daughter in her house which she was able to acquire thanks to a great deal of effort. She works in food sales outside of her home. In the beginning she used to sell toys and other items. Cecilia is a very charismatic woman and she always has a lot of energy to work. This is why she has many customers who always consider her. She currently prepares hot chocolate; this dessert is in high demand in the current season. In the future she wants a more stable business such as a store and to leave this business to her daughter, since she likes this type of work. This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to be very punctual in all of her payments. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase a greater quantity of ingredients to prepare her food, such as chocolates.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to prepare her foods and hot drinks.

loans.name: Mujeres De Pachawacan Group

texts.es: Doña Eufemia Gumercinda I. T. , es una persona que se ha dedicado a la crianza de animales y, a través de este trabajo ella a superado, a si mismo a podido mantener a su familia y cubrir los gastos de su hogar, por tal razón ella tomó la idea de formar un grupo de señoras, para que ellas puedan superar también este grupo está conformado por once integrantes,  mujeres que se dedican en diferentes funciones como crianza de animales, venta de frutas y verduras, venta de artículos de consumo diario. Los integrantes del Banco Comunal, Mujeres de Pachawacan, del Paraje Pachawacan Barrio Santa Ana, Momostenango están conformados por mujeres, decidieron solicitar un crédito en ASDIR para poder ampliar su capital de trabajo y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia, y  mejorar sus ventas como también sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Eufemia Gumercinda I. T. is a person who devotes herself to raising animals. Through this work she has prevailed. She has been able to support her family and cover the household expenses. That is why she had the idea of forming a group of women so that they could also do well. This group is comprised of 11 members. The women devote themselves to different activities like raising animals, selling fruits and vegetables, and selling daily consumption items. The members of the “Mujeres de Pachawacan” (Women of Pachawacan) Communal Bank are from the Pachawacan parish, Santa Ana neighborhood, Momostenango. The group is comprised of women. They decided to request a loan from ASDIR to be able to increase their working capital and improve their living conditions and those of their families. They want to improve their sales and their income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: La Alternativa 5 & 6 Group

texts.en:
Luz is the coordinator of her group, La Alternativa 5 & 6 (The Alternative). She makes her home in a simple structure with her longterm partner and four children. She says that her most difficult challenge was to start her business. She spent so many years asking HOW she could do it. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying cooking and working (by working she want to see her dreams come true).

Luz is excited to be taking her 4th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business, which she started it with less than $100 US, for nine years. By selling little by little and reinvesting in her business, after two years of Esperanza loans she is earning a better income.

Luz plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying clothing, shoes and underwear. She will use the profits to to buy a television and invest in more products. She want to improve her business and her plans are to buy a pick-up truck and use it to carry her sales to other communities to sell more. She wants to build her business locally and have a big store to sell both wholesale and retail.

This associate began with Esperanza because she liked the way it pays and provides more than just a loan. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in Samana, a lush, rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas in the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable).

loans.use: To buy more clothes, shoes and underwear to sell

loans.name: Olga Virginia

texts.es: Doña Olga Menchú tiene con 26 años de edad, es casada de oficios Costurera, “Confección de Delantales típicos para mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 2 Máquinas, habita junto a su  hijo y conjuntamente con su esposo, se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 4 años de laborar  en su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío Tzamatzam, ha tenido éxito en lo que realiza, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con el objetivo de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su hijo, y mejorar su condicion de vida.
texts.en:
Olga Menchú is 26 years old, and she is married. She is a seamstress, and she makes typical aprons for women. She has a shop with two machines. She lives with her son and her husband. They work in the same occupation, and they have two employees. She has worked in her house, which is in the Tzamatzam settlement, for four years. She has had success in what she does. However, her financial situation does not suffice for her to be able to increase her capital. That is the reason she went to the Asociación ASDIR to request a loan. The loan is to buy raw material in order to be able to increase her sales. She also hopes to be able to get her son ahead and to improve his living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Julia Marina

texts.es: La Señorita Julia C. tiene con 29 años de edad, es Soltera de oficios , Artesana “Confección de delantales típicos para mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 2 Máquinas, habita junto a su Mamá conjuntamente, se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados  para la misma actividad, lleva 6 años de Confeccionar delantales en su residencia que se encuentra en Caserío Xetinimit, la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tener una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Miss Julia C. is 29, single, and a craftswoman who makes traditional women's aprons. She has a workshop with 2 machines and lives with her mother. They do the same work and have two employees. For 6 years she has made aprons in her residence in Caserio Xetinimit. Her customers' demand has grown, but the economic conditions in which she finds herself are not sufficient for her to increase her working capital. For this reason she went to Asociacion ASDIR, to request a loan with the intention of buying basic supplies. This way she will increase her sales, with the hope of getting her family ahead and to have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: José Armando

texts.es: El Señor José T.,  tiene con 45 años de edad, es Casado de oficios , Servicio “Maestro de Educación Primaria Rural”, lleva 8 años de Laborar como Maestro en su residencia que se encuentra en Caserío Xepatan, actualmente por la necesidad que tiene que cubrir sus gastos personales, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de cubrir sus  necesidades como el pago de estudios de sus hijos para darles una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jose T. is 45 years old, married, and works in services. He is a teacher who works in rural primary education. For 8 years he has worked as a teacher in his home, which is located in the rural Xepatan settlement. Now he has a need to cover his personal expenses, but the economic conditions have left him short of resources. For this reason he has come to the Asociación ASDIR to request a loan. He intends to use the proceeds to cover his necessary expenses, such as paying for the education of his children so that he can provide a better quality of life for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for the education of his children

loans.name: Aura

texts.es:
Aura G. de 28 años que  vive en Bogotá, en una zona estudiantil y muy cercana a la estación del trasmilenio, es una joven de mucha creatividad, porque desde hace 10 años se inició en el arte de elaborar productos en material de Porcelanicron y ha aprendido muchas técnicas por eso también aplica   el  bordado líquido  y sus productos muy especializados,  son  distribuidos en almacenes y a particulares; últimamente se ha dedicado a  enseñar este hermoso arte a muchos especialmente a jóvenes y amas de casa, para que más personas puedan vivir de é,l así como ella lo hace en su negocio  de artes plásticas que lleva el nombre de “AURARTE” donde fabrica diferentes figuras adornos y  enseña métodos porque realiza curso de Porcelanicron  mediante el moldeo preparación de  masa , adorno y la  decoración, que la convierten en una artista con mucha magia e imaginación.
Desde el año 2008 que recibió su primer crédito a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, su vida ha cambiado, ahora tiene un almacén  abierto al público diariamente y se han mejorado sus ingresos, al fortalecer  su negocio.  En la actualidad está aplicando a este crédito que invertirá en materias primas para la fabricación  de artesanías en  Fomy, Porcelanicron y madera. 
El sueño de Aura  es tener una gran academia donde se enseñe artesanías especializadas en  varias técnicas artesanales empezando por bordado líquido y Porcelanicron. Aunque algunas veces ha enfrentado   desafíos, cuando ha dejado en consignación  sus productos a pequeños negocios o personas,  porque se le han deteriorado y algunas veces  perdido,    pero esta es su  experiencia más significativa,  porque  ha aprendido a ser más precavida a la hora de definir su sistema de ventas y  está usando controles más efectivos.
texts.en:
Aura G. is 28 years old and lives in Bogota in a student area that is very close to the Trasmilenio station. She is a very creative youth, because 10 years ago she started to make products from the material Porcelanicron (an air dry clay used in crafts), and she has learned many techniques to work with this material. In addition, she also does liquid embroidery, and her products are very specialized. She distributes her products through stores and individuals. Lately, she has also been teaching this beautiful art to many people, especially youths and housewives, so that more people can live as well as she does. She named her plastic arts business "Aurarte," where she makes different ornamental figures and she teaches methods for making handicrafts; in the class she teaches students how to prepare the Porcelanicron material, mold the dough, and make the decorative items, which transforms them into an artist with a lot of magic and imagination. Since the year 2008, when she received her first loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, her life has changed. Now she has a store that is open to the public daily, and she has improved her income and strengthened her business. Now she is applying for this loan that she will invest in raw materials for the production of handicrafts in Fomy (craft foam), Porcelanicron and wood. Aura's dream is to have a big school where she could teach specialized handicrafts and various handicraft techniques, including liquid embroidery and working with Porcelanicron. Although at time she has faced challenges, such as when she has left her products on consignment at small stores or with individuals and the products have been damaged and sometimes lost, this has been important experience for her because she has learned to be more cautious about her sales systems and is using more effective controls.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make crafts in foam, air dry clay and wood

loans.name: Maryluz

texts.es:
En un sector muy comercial de la localidad de Engativá, en la ciudad de Bogotá  Mary Luz D.  diseña y confecciona vestidos para fiestas especiales y también se dedica al alquiler de esta misma línea de  ropa.
Este es su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y lo invertirá  en la compra de materia prima, telas e insumos,  para elaborar  vestidos de novia y de quinceañeros que requieren sus clientes. Mary Luz Inició trabajando como jefe de producción en varias fábricas de confecciones, continuó su trabajo  en una boutique especializada en vestidos de novia y hace menos de 2 años, empezó a desarrollar su sueño de ser empresaria: se independizó y  ahora confecciona los más elegantes diseños de vestidos de novia, primera  comunión, quinceañeros vestidos coctel y también ofrece servicios de alquiler para aquellos que asì lo requieran.
Su meta es remodelar las instalaciones donde funciona su negocio,  para que sus productos estén mejor exhibidos  y sean más atractivos a sus clientela; así mismo  sueña con abrir otro almacén para tener más ingresos. Su desafío  constante es la falta de liquidez para comprar materias primas e insumos, que resultan costosos y poder  entregar oportunamente los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes.
texts.en:
In the Engativá section of the city of Bogotá, Mary Luz Durán designs and makes gowns for special occasions; she also rents her line of clothing. This is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she plans to use it to buy raw materials, fabric and supplies, to make wedding and fifteenth birthday party gowns that her customers require. Mary Luz began working as a production supervisor in several dressmaking factories. She continued working in a boutique that specialized in wedding dresses. A little less than two years ago she began to realize her dream of becoming a businesswoman. She became independent and now designs the most elegant gowns for weddings, first communions, fifteenth birthdays and cocktail dresses. She also rents the dresses to those who so wish. Her goal is to remodel her business location so that her products can be better displayed and be more attractive to her customers. In addition, she’d like to open a second store to generate additional income. Her challenge is the constant lack of liquidity to buy raw materials and supplies that are costly and to be able to complete her orders on time.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials, fabric and supplies, to make wedding and fifteenth birthday dresses that her customers require.

loans.name: Diocelina Isabel

texts.es:
Diocelina C., es una mujer que toda la vida ha tenido negocio, ella es comerciante  y fotógrafa profesional desde hace mucho tiempo, por eso tiene contratos con instituciones educativas, grupos musicales y participa en eventos como grados matrimonios, revistas deportivas etc. Vive en el popular barrio Villablanca, con sus dos hijos en las edades de 30 y 32 años, muy cerca de una arteria principal de Barranquilla llamada la calle Murillo, donde  contrasta el comercio al pormenor, el deporte, los espectáculos culturales y la convivencia pacifica de muchas  familias que allí habitan. 

Diocelina inició su negocio desde hace 30 años, porque se puede decir que toda su vida ha sido comerciante, trabaja 12 horas diarias y  hasta lo fines de semanas en eventos especiales de celebración,  como grados, matrimonios, primeras comuniones, actividades educativas colegiales y como si fuera poco acompaña a grupos musicales como mariachis cuando brindan serenata, pues ellos la contratan para el registro fotográfico pertinente.
Diocelina ha recibido  8 créditos a través de  la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con ellos ha logrado nuevos y mejores ingresos y hoy su nivel de vida es diferente. Su sueño siempre es progresar para ayudar  económicamente a sus familiares, por eso no deja de trabajar duro y parejo. Diocelina va a comprar con su credikiva una cámara fotográfica digital de mayor tecnología para mejorar sus registros, una impresora y mercancías variadas para fortalecer su negocio como comerciante al detalle.
texts.en:
Diocelina C. is a woman who has wanted to have her own business her entire life. She has been a merchant and professional photographer for a long time. She has contacts with educational institutions, musical groups and participates in graduations, weddings, sports magazines, etc. She lives in the popular Villablanca neighborhood with her two children who are 30 and 32 years of age near one of Barranquilla’s main thoroughfares, called Calle Murillo, which is noted for its retail businesses, sports, cultural events and peaceful coexistence of the many families that live there. Diocelina started her business 30 years ago because it can be said that she’s been a merchant her whole life. She works a 12 hour day and even on weekends at special celebratory events like graduations, weddings, first communions, school educational activities. As if this weren’t enough, she goes along with musical groups, like mariachis, when they go out on serenades because she’s hired to photographically record the pertinent moments. Diocelina has gotten 8 previous loans through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. They have helped her attain new and better earnings and today her living standard is different. Her dream is to always continue progressing in order to help her family financially. This is why she never stops working hard and steadily. Diocelina will use her Kiva credit to buy a technologically advanced digital camera to attain better photographs, a printer and assorted supplies to augment her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For a technologically advanced digital camera to improve her photos, a printer and assorted supplies.

loans.name: Fermina Isabel

texts.es:
Fermina A. J. de 56 años se dedica a la elaboración de comidas rápidas y repostería;  tiene 7 hijos en las edades de 19 a 40 años de edad, que ha levando con mucho esfuerzo pero con muy buenos principios.

Desde la edad de 25 años Fermina procedente de San Marcos, en el departamento de Sucre, donde  sembraba yuca, plátano, ñame y arroz,  llegó a un barrio del sur occidente  de Barranquilla e inició trabajando como empleada doméstica y a los 6 años de vivir en esta ciudad, desarrolló su habilidad para trabajar independiente, por eso creó el negocio de elaboración de cocadas, panochas, deditos, empanadas  y desde ese momento  es la actividad que ejerce al lado de sus hijas y que la ayudado al bienestar de su familia.

Fermina A.  ha recibido 3 créditos durante tres años, apoyada por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Su meta siempre ha sido superarse por eso estudió repostería en el Sena para algún día tener una gran repostería, que es una de sus metas. Su sueño y gran desafío es que sus dos hijas menores terminen los estudios universitarios, para que sean exitosas y logren mejorar su calidad de vida;  mas adelante espera tener su propia casa, pues ahora vive en condiciones de arrendamiento. En la Actualidad Fermina está aplicando a un crédito por valor de $ 1.500.000 COP para comprar materias primas y elaborar de sus fritituras, entre asaduras, papa  harinas y demás insumo
texts.en:
Femina A. J., 56, makes fast-food and pastries. She has 7 children between the ages of 19 and 40 who she raised with much effort but with very good principles. Femina is from San Marcos, Sucre department, where she farmed manioc, banana, yams and rice. At the age of 25 she moved to a neighborhood in southwest Barranquilla and started working as a domestic employee. After six years living in this city she developed the ability to work independently and started her pastry business making cocadas (macaroons), panochas (a crêpe-like corn and cheese pastry), deditos (lady fingers), empanadas (turnovers). Since then, this is the activity she’s been in accompanied by her daughters which has helped her support her family. Femina has gotten 3 previous loans during three years from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Her goal has always been to improve. This is why she took pastry making courses at SENA (Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje-National Learning Service) in order to some day having a large pastry shop, which is one of her goals. Her dream and challenge is that her two youngest daughters finish their university education so that they will be successful and attain a better quality of life. Later on she hopes to have her own home because she’s currently a renter. Femina is applying for a $1.500.000 COP loan to buy ingredients for her fast-food items, among them grilled meats, potatoes, flours and other ingredients.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies for her fast-food items.

loans.name: Santa Angela

texts.es: La Señora Santa Menchú, persona de 56 años de edad, es Casada de oficios , Comerciante “Venta de cortes típicos para mujeres” cuenta con un Pequeño negocio; habita junto a sus esposo,  y se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados  para la misma actividad, lleva 15 años de Vender  su residencia que se encuentra en Caserío Tzamatzam, actualmente tienen demanda de su negocio por lo que necesita aumentar su capital, entonces acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar más Mercadería y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, y que tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Santa Menchú is 56-years-old. She's married and works as a merchant selling traditional clothing for women. She has a small business that she runs with her husband. There are two employees for the same activity. She's been selling from her house in the hamlet of Tzamatzam for 15 years. Currently her business is in demand so she needs to increase her capital. She went to ASDIR to ask for a loan with the intention of buying more merchandise to increase her sales and improve her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Julio Antonio

texts.es: El Joven Julio M., tiene  21 años de edad, es Soltero de oficios , Artesano “Elaboración de Cortes típicos para mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 2 Telares, habita junto a sus Papás, El sus papas se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados  para la misma actividad, lleva 8 años de Elaborar delantales en su residencia que se encuentra en Caserío la Libertad, actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar material para la tejeduria y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, para obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Julio M., 21, is single. He’s a craftsman. He manufactures women’s traditional clothing in a two-loom shop. He lives with his parents who are in the same occupation. They have two employees. He has been making aprons for 8 years in his home which is located in La Libertad. Demand has risen but the economic condition he finds himself in prevents him from increasing his capital. For this reason, he has called upon Asociación ASDIR to request a loan with the intention of buying weaving supplies so that he can increase sales thus obtaining higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy weaving supplies.

loans.name: Jesús Josefa

texts.es: Doña Jesús, tiene 58 años de edad, es casada de oficios Costurera, “Confección de Delantales típicos para mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 2 Máquinas, habita junto a su  hijo a su hija, Ella y su hija se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 4 años de laborar  en su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío Xetinimit, ha tenido éxitos en su oficio y la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, y que tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Jesús is 58 years old, married, and works as a dressmaker making traditional aprons for women. She has a workshop with 2 sewing machines, and she lives with her son and her daughter. She and her daughter work in the same trade, and they also have 2 employees that work with them. She has been working in her home, which is located in the rural Xetinimit settlement, for 4 years. She has had success in this line of work, and the demand of her customers is growing. However, the economic conditions are such that she is lacking the resources she needs, and so she came to the Asociación ASDIR to request a loan to increase her capital. She intends to buy raw materials, and in this way she can increase her sales. She also hopes to be able to provide for her children so that they can have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Marieme

texts.fr:
-Madame Marieme N.  est une  dame qui habite dans la localité  de  Ouakam. Elle est âgée de  34 ans  et  est mère  de 4 enfants. Madame N.  pratique l’activité  de commerce depuis 1996. Et depuis 10 ans elle s’adonne à la vente de fruits, biscuits, jus, crème  et divers  autres produits alimentaires. 
Elle est membre de la caisse de  Ouakam depuis 7 ans. Elle sollicite un crédit  de 200 000 frs dans le but d’acheter un réfrigérateur  pour le démarrage  d’une nouvelle activité  de vente de poulets de chair. Dans l’optique d’une diversification de ses activités  et d’un  accroissement de ses revenus  madame Marieme N.  souhaite mieux développer  son commerce.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marieme N. is a woman who lives in the town of Ouakam. She is 34 years old and the mother of 4 children. Mrs. N. has run her business since 1996. For 10 years she has devoted herself to the sale of fruits, biscuits, juice, cream and various other food products. She has been a member of the Ouakam fund for 7 years. She is asking for a loan of 200,000 frs in order to buy a refrigerator to start up a new business selling chicken meat. In view of the diversification of her business and a growth of her profits, Mrs. Mariem N. wishes to better develop her store.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fund Increase

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es: El señor Alfredo G. C., de 52 años de edad, con nivel  académico de sexto primaria aprobado, Casado, se dedica a la prestación de Servicios como: Agente de Seguridad, en una institucion en Totonicapán, en la actualidad  cuenta con gastos imprevistos, por motivos de tener problemas de salud, y no dispone del dinero necesario para cubrir dicho gasto, y se acerco a la asociación ASDIR para solicitar un préstamo  y así poder cubrir sus necesidades, la cual contribuirá a obtener bienestar y una mejor calidad de vida familiar, ya que es muy importante para el tener una buena salud para seguir trasbajando en benneficio de su familia y la sociedad.
texts.en:
Alfredo G. C., 52, finished 6th grade. He’s married and works as a security guard in an institution in Totonicapán. He is currently facing some unexpected expenses due to health problems and he does not have enough money for them. He called upon Asociación ASDIR to request a loan to cover his needs. This will contribute to improved wellbeing and a better quality of life for his family because it’s very important to be in good health in order to continue working to benefit both the family and society.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For personal health expenses.

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en: Josephat is 31 years old, married and has a four-year-old son named Jonah. He makes a living by selling second-hand furniture while his wife earns an income by running a beauty a salon. Josephat has been in business for five years and now has one employee. Before he started his current business, he made a living selling second-hand clothes. Thanks to help from the Kamiti Road group in Faulu, Kenya, he has been able to expand his business by taking out a loan which he repaid on time. Now he is applying for a new loan, for 80,000 KES, to buy more furniture to sell to his customers. Josephat hopes to expand his business in the future so that he can improve his family's living standards. He also hopes to open a new wholesale business.

loans.use: To buy more furniture to selll to his customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy flash disks and memory cards to sell to her customers

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is 23 years old, single and makes a living by providing transportation services. He has been in this business for two years, and is a member of a group called Bright Star in Faulu, Kenya where he saves money every week and gets various forms of financial support. Samuel is applying for a loan for 50,000 KES to buy a motorbike. In the future, he hopes to own a fleet of vehicles and have many employees.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Serah

texts.en: Serah M. K. is a 40 years old, married and has five children. She owns and runs a shop where she sells vegetables such as spinach and kale. Before opening this business, she made a living as a seamstress. Since she joined the Biashara Imara group in Faulu, Kenya, her business has really grown, in part because of two loans she has received and repaid. She has been in business for six years and now has two employees. Serah is applying for a loan for 50,000 KES to buy 30 bags of spinach and five bags of kale to sell to her customers. In the future, she hopes to buy a plot of land and build a house for her family to live in.

loans.use: To buy 30 bags of spinach and five bags of kale to sell to her customers

loans.name: Oulimata

texts.fr:
Madame Oulimata S. est une femme de 57 ans qui vit dans la localité  de Ouakam. Elle est mariée et mère  de 6 enfants. 
Madame S.  a démarré  son activité  de petit commerce en vendant des jus, de la glace, puis des produits en provenance de la Mauritanie. Actuellement elle a une expérience  de 4 ans dans le commerce de tissus, parfums, et fruits de mer pendant l’été. 
Elle est sociétaire  depuis 4 ans dans la caisse de l’U-IMCEC a Ouakam et a déjà  rembourse 2 prêts antérieurs. Elle sollicite un prêt de 150 000 frs destine à renforcer son commerce de fruits de mer puisqu’on est en période d’été. 
Par conséquent  ce crédit  lui permettra de mieux développer  son commerce  pour mieux faire  face aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Oulimata S. is a 57 year old woman who lives in the town of Ouakam. She is married and the mother of 6 children. Mrs. S. started up her small business selling juices and ice cream, and then products from Mauritania. Most recently, she has been working for four years selling cloth, perfumes, and seafood during the summer. She has been a member of the l'U-IMCEC fund in Ouakam for 4 years and has already paid back 2 previous loans. She is requesting a loan of 150,000 frs, meant to strengthen her seafood business since it is the summer period. Thus, this loan will allow her to expand her business and better meet the needs of her children.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Growth of working capital funds.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is single and has two children. She works hard to support her children by selling firewood. After separating from her husband, she began to take her business very seriously because she was now the family's breadwinner. Jane has been in business for seven years and has applied for a loan for 45,000 KES to buy more firewood to sell to her customers. Her goal is to earn enough money to provide her children with decent housing and quality education.

loans.use: To buy firewood to sell to her customers

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is 26 years old and married.  He has been running a butcher shop for five years.  He acquired the necessary skills for operating the business in a butchery where he was previously employed.  He belongs to a group in Faulu, Kenya, whose members guarantee each other loan.  He previously took out a loan of 100,000 KES which was used to expand his business.  He has successfully repaid the previous loan, and hence has been allowed to take out another loan of 40,000 KES.  He will use the new loan amount to purchase a freezer, roaster grills and weighing machine. He hopes to open more outlets in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer, roaster grills and weighing machine

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is blessed with a three-year-old child.  She operates a salon to earn a living.  As a single mother, she works hard in her business in order to earn enough income to raise her child.  She opened her salon six years ago, and has managed to expand her business in Faulu, Kenya.  This was possible because of a previous loan of 20,000 KES taken out by her. Mary now wants to buy beauty products, hair braids and hair oil. Hence she is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES.  She hopes to expand her business further and open a hair dressing college in the future.

loans.use: To buy beauty products, hair braids and hair oil

loans.name: Peris

texts.en: Peris is a member of Githurai Vison group in Faulu, Kenya.  She joined the group as a young entrepreneur to be able to access loans. She also saves money on weekly basis with the group. She has been operating a butcher shop for six months. Peris used to sell fruits earlier to earn a living.  She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy meat for resale.  In ten years, she wants to own several butcher shops by which she can earn more income.

loans.use: To buy meat for resale

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lenin

texts.es: Lenin tiene 50 años de edad, ella vive junto a su esposo en su casa propia, sus dos hijos que tiene ya son independientes y tienen su propia familia. Hace más de 6 años trabaja vendiendo ropa, la modalidad de venta lo realiza visitando a sus clientes, y luego de un tiempo se dispone a realizar las cobranzas de su producto. Este trabajo es su principal fuente de ingresos, es así que visita los centros comerciales, los más concurridos de su ciudad, para adquirir variedad de prendas de vestir, en diversos colores y diseños que sean atractivos para su clientela, que en su mayoría es público femenino.  Espera seguir trabajando como hasta ahora, ganando buena cantidad de clientes para así mejorar sus ingresos económicos y en un futuro poder poner una gran tienda de ropa. Es su tercer crédito con MFP y se compromete en ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de prendas de vestir y así aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Lenin is 50 years old. She lives together with her husband in her own house. Her two children that she has are already independent and have their own family. For more than 6 years she has worked selling clothing. Her method of sales is to visit her customers and after a period of time, she prepares to collect the money for her product. This work is her main source of income so she visits the malls, the most popular in her city, to acquire a variety of clothing in various colors and designs that are attractive for her customers, of whom the majority are female. She hopes to continue working like until now, gaining a good amount of customers to improve her economic earnings and in the future, to be able to have a large clothing store. This is her third credit with MFP and she promises to be very punctual with all of her payments. With the loan she is requesting, she will be purchase more clothing to increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To acquire more clothing.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is 23 years old, married and has one child.  He has been selling shoes for three years.  Besides, he runs a retail shop. He joined Githurai Vison group in Faulu Kenya. He has gained business ideas through the group.  He also saves money weekly with the group during their meetings.  He is asking for 20,000 KES to buy a stock of shoes to sell. He hopes to provide for his son's quality education.  He wants to move his shop to the city centre, which has a busy environment, in the next 10 years so as to get more customers.

loans.use: To add stock of shoes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Cyrus

texts.en: Cyrus is a member of Pendano group, which consists of young entrepreneurs, associated with Faulu Kenya.  He runs Agape Auto spares and Car Locks shop. He started the business 15 years ago.  He has seen his business grow with the help of Pendano group in Faulu kenya. He has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase car locks and ignitions.  He hopes to expand his business so that he can earn enough income to educate his child.

loans.use: To purchase car locks and ignitions

loans.name: Danilo Jose

texts.es: Danilo José tiene 37 años, tiene 2 hijos menores de edad que están a su cargo  por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, por lo que son de gran ayuda para su negocio. Su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de transporte de taxi, es este automóvil que él se gana diariamente el pan de cada día, pues también pone en riesgo su vida ya que la delincuencia en nuestro país aumenta pero la necesidad de proporcionarle a su familia lo necesario es lo que cada lo hace salir adelante. El financiamiento que solicita en la actualidad es para la compra de repuestos de su automóvil, como llantas, focos, frenos entre otras cosas. Por lo que siempre sueña con mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Danilo José, 37, has two minor children under his care so this is not the first time he has requested financing which is of great help to him in his business. He provides taxi services. It is this car that he uses daily to earn his daily bread but he also puts his life in jeopardy because crime is increasing in the country. However, the need to provide for his family compels him to continue. He will use the requested funds to buy car replacement parts like: tires, headlamps, brakes and others. He always dreams with making improvements to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair.

loans.name: Agueda

texts.es: Agueda tiene 28 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijo en su casa, que gracias a mucho esfuerzo lograron adquirir. El trabajo al que se dedica, es la venta de ropa, siendo estas adquiridas en el mercado central de su ciudad y a un menor precio. Su forma de trabajo consiste en visitar a sus amistades y vecinos a ofrecer estos productos. El buen gusto que tiene Agueda para conseguir las prendas le ha dado mucha ventaja ante sus clientes, de esa manera logra vender con rapidez toda su mercadería. Ella se siente muy contenta con el trabajo que realiza, pues le es rentable, ya que el acceso a la zona en la que vive es complicado, es por ello que sus vecinas no pueden ir por sus propios medios a comprar ropa. Es su segundo crédito con MFP y se compromete de a ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, quiere comprar mayor cantidad de prendas de vestir para así mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Agueda is 28 years old. She lives together with her husband and son in her house that they were able to acquire thanks to much effort. The business in which she works is clothing sales, which she acquires in the central market of her city and at a lower price. Her method of work consists of visiting her friends and neighbors to sell these products. Agueda’s good taste for getting clothing has given her a great advantage with her customers and she is able to sell all of her merchandise quickly. She feels very pleased with the work that she does and it is profitable since the access that the area in which she lives has is complex. As a result, her neighbors cannot go by their own means to purchase clothing. This is her second loan with MFP and she promises to be very punctual with all of her payments. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase more clothing to improve her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To acquire more items of clothing.

loans.name: Keyling Vanessa

texts.es: Keyling es una madre de familia de 21 años. Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad por lo que su pulpería está establecida en su vivienda, allí ella ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo de productos de uso diario por los cuales tendrían que dirigirse hasta el mercado para adquirirlos. Ella se encarga de que sus clientes encuentren los productos que necesitan en su establecimiento, por ello trata de ofrecerles productos de buena calidad, esto y el trato amable con el que los atiende han hecho que actualmente cuente con un grupo de clientes fieles que mantienen una preferencia por su negocio.Es así que solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima gaseosas, jugos, golosinas, granos básicos, detergentes entre otras.Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Keyling is a 21-year-old mother. She has a grocery store installed in her home where she sells basic needs items. She stocks all kinds of daily use items that customers would have to go all the way to the market to get. She sees to it that her customers find everything they need in her store so tries to offer high quality items. This and the kind manner in which she helps them have led to her having a large base of regular customers who prefer her store over others. She is asking for funding to buy stock items for her store like: soft-drinks, juices, sweets, basic grains, detergents, etc. She has collaborated in the past with our Institution and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility with respect to her repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Union De Mujeres En Desarrollo Group

texts.en:
Josefina is the coordinator of her group Union de Mujeres en Desarrollo 5 (Unite women for development). She began with Kiva partner, Esperanza, to improve her business and get training. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Josefina's group is located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and the sugar cane industry, and also home to a cement factory, and others. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.
Josefina makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband. She says that her most difficult challenge is to build a concrete roof, because the one she has now allows part of the inside of her house to get wet. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying to be with her family.
Josefina is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has run her business for ten years, starting out with the intention of finding a way to earn extra income to survive. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying more gas to sell by the gallon or bottle. She will use the profits to save and repair her roof.

loans.use: To buy gas

loans.name: Edison Jeovanny

texts.es:
Edison Jeovanny G. R. tiene 36 años.  Es casado y vive en la Comunidad de Matilde Esther  en el cantón Chillanes provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos, Bayron (11) y Joel (8).

Edison es un socio de la ventanilla rural Rey de Reyes, que está ubicada a hora y media de Chillanes. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Edison  se dedica a la agricultura, tiene sembrado cacao, naranja, piña y además tiene un bus de transporte. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la misma comunidad sus productos los vende en el Cantón Bucal cada 15 días.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en los cultivos de cacao, naranja y piña. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños son tener más producción  y tener una casa para su familia. Enfrenta desafíos como plagas. 

Le gusta caminar por los cultivos mirando el desarrollo de su producción.
texts.en:
Edison Jeovanny G. R., 36, is married and lives in Matilde Esther, Chillanes canton, Bolívar province. He has two sons: Bayron, 11, and Joel, 8. Edison is a member of the Rey de Reyes (King of Kings) communal bank which is located an hour and a half from Chillanes. It has a total of 23 members most of whom are farmers. This is the first loan they have gotten from Cooperativa San José. Edison is a cacao, orange and pineapple farmer. He also has a bus for transportation. He makes his purchases monthly in his same community and sells his products every two weeks in Bucal canton. He is asking for funds to invest in his cacao, orange and pineapple crops. He feels that the loan is a way of getting ahead. His dream is to have more production and to have a home for his family. He faces challenges like pests. He enjoys walking among his plants observing their development.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in cacao, orange and pineapple crops.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 24 años de edad, ella vive con sus padres en la casa de ellos. Pese a su juventud demostró ser una persona muy responsable y es así que gracias a sus ahorros que tenía desde hace varios años, pudo instalar una tienda de comestibles. Ahora muy tranquila trabaja, además que le agrada comunicarse con sus amigos, los cuales siempre la visitan por ser una de las tiendas más cercanas de la zona en la que vive. En el futuro desea implementar su tienda con mostradores y vitrinas, además de abastecerse de artículos de librería y bazar para que su negocio sea completo y pueda captar mucho más la atención de la clientela. Es su segundo crédito con MFP y se compromete de a ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, quiere comprarse mayor cantidad de productos para abastecer su tienda.
texts.en:
Julia is 24 years old. She lives with her parents in their house. Despite her young age, she demonstrated being a very responsible person and it is thanks to her savings that several years ago, she was able to set up a grocery store. She works very calmly now. In addition, she likes talking with her friends, who always visit her since her store is one of the closest in the zone where she lives. In the future she wants to set up a counter and showcase, in addition to stocking up on bookstore and hardware items so that her business is complete and can capture much more attention from her customers. This is her second loan with MFP and she promises to be very punctual with all of her payments. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase more items to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up her store with assorted items.

loans.name: Mujeres Del Valle Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Mujeres del Valle esta compuesto por 5 personas empresariales del pueblo de Santa Maria en Jamastran, El Paraíso. Los integrantes del grupo son la Sra. Leyla del Carmen M. C., la Sra. Neybi Sofia R. O., la Sra. Julia Amparo O., la Sra. Yolanda Maribel M. V. y el Sr. Félix O. M..

 A continuación se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan diariamente para generar ingresos monetarios:

 La Señora Leyla del Carmen M. C. es madre de tres hijos y reside con su compañero de hogar, el señor Josué Herrera, en Santa Maria de Jamastran, El Paraiso. 

Leyla es una vendedora ambulante que vende cosméticos en su comunidad. Algunos de los productos que Leyla tiene a la venta son: Cremas para el cuerpo, cremas faciales, desodorantes, lociones, shampoo, acondicionador y brillos labiales. Leyla lleva varios años vendiendo a sus clientes de la comunidad creando una red leal de consumidores muy felices con su nivel de atención. El negocio de Leyla ayuda a pagar los gastos de la casa y la educación académica de sus tres hijos. 

Leyla utilizara el préstamo para surtir su inventario con los productos mas populares, como ser lociones, desodorantes y brillos labiales al igual que para la compra de nuevos productos, como peines, lápiz labial y sombras. Con las ganancias del negocio, Leyla cubrirá los costos académicos de sus hijos al igual que mejorar su nivel de vida.

 La Sra. Neybi Sofia R. O. es compañera de hogar del señor Sebastián M. con quien tiene 4 hijos. Sebastián emigro a los Estados Unidos en busca de una mejor vida y le manda remesas a Neybi todos los meses para ayudar con los gastos familiares. 

Neybi vende productos de uso personal como ser brillos labiales, talcos, shampoo, acondicionador, cremas corporales y cremas faciales. Neybi lleva a cabo la mayoría de sus ventas de manera ambulante en la aldea de Santa Maria, Jamastran. Con las ganancias del negocio, Neybi ha podido sacar adelante a su familia proveyéndoles una educación para un futuro mejor. Neybi utilizara el préstamo para comprar mas productos y así poder incrementar la variedad que ofrece a sus clientes para mejores ventas.

 La Sra. Julia Amparo O. tiene cuatro hijos y esta casada con el Señor José Rodríguez. Julia y Jose residen en la aldea de Santa Maria en Jamastran, El Paraiso. Jose es un agricultor que siembra maíz y frijoles todos los años. Julia lleva varios años preparando comida desde su propia casa después que el comedor vecino dejo de operar y los clientes le pidieron a ella si podía cocinarles. La mayoría de la clientela de Julia es de la Policía Nacional dentro de su aldea y del Chichicaste. Con este préstamo, Julia pagara la instalación de una caseta en frente de su casa para vender comida rápida y golosinas. Julia utilizara las ganancias de su negocio para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

 La Sra. Yolanda Maribel M. V. tiene 3 hijos y esta casada con el Señor Walter Ardon con quien reside en la aldea de Santa Maria en Jamastran, El Paraiso. Yolanda se dedica a la venta de pan y golosinas desde hace varios años de forma ambulante. Cuando hay juegos de fútbol en su aldea, Yolanda prepara su canasta de pan y golosinas para caminar al estadio y vender comida a los espectadores. Durante la semana, Yolanda se dedica a hornear pan para venderlo a las pulperías de la aldea. 

Yolanda utilizara el préstamo para cubrir los gastos de la compra de huevos, harina de trigo, aceite, manteca, margarina, azúcar, levadura, carne de res, repollo, tomate, cebolla, harina de maíz y frijoles. Las ganancias del negocio ayudaran a Yolanda y su esposo para apoyar a sus hijos en que continúen con sus estudios escolares.
