 El Sr. Félix O. M. se dedica a la sastrería en su pueblo de Santa Maria en Jamastran, El Paraiso. Félix no tiene hijos pero ayuda a una sobrina que depende de el. Félix se dedica a la confección de pantalones de hombre y trajes de mujeres desde hace varios años. A pesar de que Félix reside en Santa Maria tiene muchos clientes que viajan desde comunidades cercanas por sus servicios ya que la calidad de su trabajo es bien conocida. Félix utilizara el préstamo para comprar más telas y accesorios de sastrería. Con las ganancias de su negocio, Félix podrá mejorar su nivel de vida y cubrir los gastos de vivienda con su sobrina.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres del Valle" ["Women of the Valley"] is made up of 5 enterprising people, from the village of Santa Maria in Jamastran, El Paraíso. The members of the group are Leyla del Carmen M. C., Neybi Sofia R. O., Julia Amparo O., Yolanda Maribel M. V. and Félix O. M.. The following sections describe the diverse activities they carry out each day to earn their income: Leyla del Carmen M. C. is the mother of three children and resides with her live-in partner, Josué Herrera, in Santa Maria de Jamastran, El Paraiso. Leyla is a traveling salesperson who sells cosmetics in her community. The products she sells include body and facial creams, deodorants, lotions, shampoo, conditioners and lip gloss. Leyla has sold these products to her customers in the community for several years, building up a loyal network of customers who are very happy with her level of service. Leyla's business helps her pay the household expenses and the educational fees for her three children. Leyla will use the loan to expand her inventory with the most popular products, such as lotions, deodorants and lip gloss, as well as buying some new products, such as combs, lipstick and eye shadow. With the earnings from her business, Leyla will cover the academic costs for her children and improve her family's quality of life. Neybi Sofia R. O. is the common-law wife of Sebastián M., with whom she has 4 children. Sebastián emigrated to the United States in search of a better life, and he sends funds to Neybi every month to help with the household expenses. Neybi sells personal care products such as lip gloss, powders, shampoo, conditioner, and body and facial creams. Neybi makes most of her sales as a traveling salesperson in the municipality of Santa Maria, Jamastran. With the earnings from her business, Neybi has been able to help her family get ahead, providing her children with an education so they can have a better future. Neybi will use the loan to buy more products and thus increase the variety she offers to her customers, so she can improve her sales. Julia Amparo O. has four children and is married to José Rodríguez. Julia and Jose live in the municipality of Santa Maria in Jamastran, El Paraiso. Jose is a farmer who plants corn and beans every year. For several years, Julia has worked preparing food in her own house, after the small restaurant next door closed down, and the customers asked her if she could cook for them. Most of Julia's customers are members of the National Police from her municipality and from Chichicaste. With this loan, Julia will pay for the installation of a stand in front of her house from which she will sell fast food and snacks. Julia will use the earnings from her business to improve her family's quality of life. Yolanda Maribel M. V. has 3 children and is married to Walter Ardon, with whom she lives in the municipality of Santa Maria, in Jamastran, El Paraiso. Yolanda has worked for several years selling bread and snacks as a mobile vendor. When there are soccer games in her town, Yolanda prepares her basket of bread and snacks and walks to the stadium, where she sells food to the spectators. During the week, Yolanda works baking bread to sell in the corner stores in her town. Yolanda will use the loan to cover the expenses of buying eggs, flour, oil, shortening, margarine, sugar, yeast, beef, cabbage, tomatoes, onion, corn flour and beans. The earnings from her business will help Yolanda and her husband support their children, so they can continue with their studies. Félix O. M. works as a tailor in his village of Santa Maria in Jamastran, El Paraiso. Félix has no children, but he helps a niece who depends on him. Félix has made men's pants and women's suits for many years. Although Félix lives in Santa Maria, he has many customers who travel from nearby communities for his services, because the quality of his work is well known. Félix will use the loan to buy more fabrics and accessories for tailoring. With the earnings from his business, Félix will be able to improve his standard of living and cover his niece's housing expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying more products to expand her inventory

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jose Eduardo

texts.es:
Jose Eduardo G. I. tiene 41 años. Estado unión libre y vive con su esposa, no tiene hijos, en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar.
 
Jose  es un socio de la ventanilla rural Rey de Reyes, que está ubicada a hora y media de Chillanes. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Jose   se dedica a la agricultura, tiene sembrado cacao. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la misma comunidad sus productos los vende en el Cantón Bucal.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en le cultivo de cacao. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños son tener más producción  y tener una casa para su familia. Enfrenta desafíos como plagas y enfermedades. 

Le gusta pasear en la moto.
texts.en:
Jose Eduardo G. I. is 42 years old. He lives with his common-law wife (they have no children) in the Chillanes canton in the province of Bolivar. Jose is a member of the "Rey de Reyes" rural community bank that is about and hour and a half from Chillanes. There are 23 members all together, and the majority make a living through agriculture. This is their first loan request through Cooperativa San Jose. Jose makes a living farming cacao. He makes his monthly purchases in the community and sells his products in the canton of Bucal. He is requesting a loan to invest in cacao farming. He feels that the loan in a chance to get ahead. He dreams with increasing production to have a house for his family. He is faces challenges such as plagues and diseases. He likes to ride his motorcycle.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in cacao farming

loans.name: Elvis Omar

texts.es:
Elvis Omar A. A. tiene 33 años. Es soltero vive con sus padres, tiene 1 hijo, Ana (3) vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Elvis  es un socio de la ventanilla rural Rey de Reyes, que está ubicada a hora y media de Chillanes. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Elvis  se dedica a la agricultura, tiene sembrado cacao. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la misma comunidad sus productos los vende en el Cantón Bucal.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en le cultivo de cacao. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños son tener más producción  y tener una casa para su familia. Enfrenta desafíos como el cambio del clima, y los caminos para llegar a los terrenos que no están en buen estado. 

Le gusta salir a caminar, escuchar música y pasear con la familiar.
texts.en:
Elvis Omar A. A., 33, is single and lives with his parents. He has a child, Ana, 3. He lives in Chillanes canton in Bolívar province. Elvis is a member of the Rey de Reyes (King of Kings) communal bank located an hour and a half from Chillanes. It has a total of 23 members who are mostly farmers. This is the first loan they have gotten from Cooperative San José. Elvis is a cacao farmer. He makes his purchases monthly in the same community and sells his products in Bucal canton. He is asking for funding to invest in his cacao crops. He believes that the loan is an opportunity to get ahead. His dreams are to have more production and a house of his own for his family. He faces challenges due to weather changes and that the access roads to his fields are in poor condition. He enjoys going out for walks, listening to music and family outings

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in cacao crops.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: Roxana tiene 29 años, vive junto a su esposo y dos pequeños hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 5 años vende ropa, considerándolo como un trabajo muy rentable,  pues consigue su mercadería a precio al por mayor y de ahí lo vende a un precio conveniente para que aumente sus ganancias. De esta manera Roxana visita a sus amigas ofreciendo la prendas que vende y al cabo de un tiempo esta recibiendo el pago de dicho producto. Le gusta mucho su trabajo pues ha ganado muchas amistades en el trascurso del tiempo, además es muy conocida por su vecindario por sus buenas ofertas y variedad de mercadería que ofrece. Solo espera mas adelante consolidar un negocio más grande, pero sabe que aún necesita juntar capital para conseguirlo. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, desea comprar mayor cantidad de prendas de vestir y así aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Roxana is 29 years old and lives with her husband and two small children in the family's own house. For more than 5 years, she has sold clothing, finding it a quite profitable business. She obtains her merchandise wholesale and sells it at a convenient price that provides her with increased profits. Roxana visits her friends and offers the garments she sells, and after a while she receives payment for her products. She enjoys her work very much, because she has made many friends over the course of time. She is also well-known among her neighbors for her good prices and the variety of merchandise she offers. Her hope for the future is to establish a larger business, but she knows that she still needs to save up the capital to achieve this. This is her second loan with MFP, and she is committed to being very punctual with all of her payments. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to buy a larger quantity of garments so that she can increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding her stock of garments

loans.name: Manuel Masias

texts.es:
Manuel Masias S. Q. tiene 20 años. Es soltero vive con sus padres, tiene 1 hijo, Rosa (3) vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Manuel  es un socio de la ventanilla rural Rey de Reyes, que está ubicada a hora y media de Chillanes. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos S. con la Cooperativa San José.

Manuel  se dedica a la agricultura, tiene sembrado cacao. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la misma comunidad sus productos los vende en el Cantón Bucay.
para invertir en el cultivo de cacao
Solicita el préstamo . Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños son tener más producción  y la compra de un vehiculo para transportar sus productos. Enfrenta desafíos como el cambio del clima, y los caminos para llegar a los terrenos que no están en buen estado. 

Le gusta cuidar la granja.
texts.en:
Manuel Masias S. Q., 20, is single and lives with his parents. He has a child, Rosa, 3. He lives in Chillanes canton, Bolívar province. Manuel is a member of the Rey de Reyes (King of Kings) communal bank located an hour and a half from Chillanes. It has a total of 23 members who are mostly farmers. This is their first loan with Cooperativa San José. Manuel is a cacao farmer. He makes his purchases monthly in the same community and sells his products in Bucay canton. He is asking for funds to invest in his cacao crops. He believes the loan is an opportunity to get ahead. His dreams are to increase production and to buy a vehicle to transport his products. The challenges he faces are climate changes and the poor condition of access roads to his fields. He enjoys tending to his farm.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in cacao crops.

loans.name: Mayra Azucena

texts.es: Mayra tiene 2 hijos de diferentes edades pero ella se encarga de mantenerlo y proporcionarle el alimento diario. Por lo que no es la primera experiencia que ha obtenido con los financiamientos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, hace mas de 3 años que tiene este negocio, actividad que realiza desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche todos los días, pues siempre está pendiente de los que sus clientes le solicitan y esta es la oportunidad que tiene para buscar nuevos productos. Por lo que  solicita un préstamo para la compra de pantalones, vestidos, trajes formales ya que en estos paquetes viene una gran variedad.
texts.en:
Mayra has two children of different ages that she is in charge of supporting and feeding. This is not, therefore, the first time she’s gotten financing. She sells used clothing. She has been in this line of work for over 3 years. She works from 7am until 8pm every day and is always attentive to her customers’ needs. This is her opportunity to seek out new products. She is asking for funding to buy pants, dresses and formal wear since the bundles have a great variety of items.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted clothing.

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
El comité “FORTALEZA” se encuentra trabajando dentro de las 3er. ciclo del Programa en la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso. 
Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, para ingresos para sus familias. 
Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora Graciela quien se dedica a la venta de la venta de joyas y es muy medio muy importante para su familia porque le genera ingreso para los gastos de alimentación diario. 
Comenta que las capacitaciones de las asesoras la ayuda mucho para mejorar el manejo de los ingresos con que cuenta. 
Ella pertenece a una familia muy humilde pero muy trabajadora que procura para salir delante de la mejor manera posible. 
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de joyas para vender como cadenas, gargantilla, pulseras, anillos, aros.
texts.en:
The “Fortaleza” (Strength) committee is in the Program’s 3rd cycle in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. All the group members are involved in independent activities to earn income for their families. The members form a very unified group that is capable of undergoing group activities than strengthen their companionship. One of the members is Graciela who sells jewelry. This is an important means for her family because it generates income to cover their daily food expenses. She comments that the training she gets helps her improve managing her income. She belongs to a very humble but very hardworking family that tries to get ahead the best way they can. She is asking for funds to buy jewelry to sell like: chains, necklaces, bracelets, rings, hoops, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted silver jewelry.

loans.name: Jasmina Katherine

texts.es:
Jasmina Katherine P. M. tiene 25 años. Es casada vive con su esposo e hijos  tiene 3 hijos, Edgar (11), Natalia (22 dias) y Dario (8) vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Jasmina  es una socia de la ventanilla rural Rey de Reyes, que está ubicada a hora y media de Chillanes. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Jasmina  se dedica a la crianza de pollo, chanchos. Realiza sus compras en la misma comunidad y los productos los vendos en la misma comunidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir para la compra de animales. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener dinero para comprar un terreno para sembrar. Enfrenta desafíos es la falta de dinero

Le gusta le cuidar a sus hijos y leer la biblia.
texts.en:
Jasmina Katherine P. M. is 25 years old and married. She lives with her husband and their three children; Edgar (11), Natalia (22 days), and Dario (8). She lives in the Chillanes canton in the Bolívar province. Jasmina is a member of the “Rey de Reyes” (King of Kings) Communal Bank, which is one and a half hours from Chillanes. There are 23 members in all. Most of them devote themselves to farming. This is their first loan with the Cooperativa San José. Jasmina devotes herself to raising chickens and pigs. She makes her purchases in the same community, and she also sells her products there. She is requesting a loan to buy animals. She thinks that the loan is an opportunity to get ahead. Her dream is to have the money to buy a piece of land for planting. The lack of money is the challenge she faces. She likes to take care of her children and reading the Bible.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy animals

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma es una madre de familia de 47 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el sector Chequén del distrito de Chepén, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia del mismo nombre, en la región La Libertad, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de diez años a la venta de verduras, ella cuenta con un puesto de venta instalado dentro de un mercado de la ciudad de Chepén conocido como La Parada, allí ella ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo de verduras frescas. Su negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida debido a que siempre trata de brindar productos de buena calidad y un trato amable. Con los ingresos que ella percibe de esta actividad ayuda a su esposo, que es agricultor, en el sostenimiento de la economía familiar.

Irma desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas verduras, de modo que pueda incrementar su stock de productos y aumentar sus ventas, para lograr su meta ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1600 nuevos soles.

Irma es una mujer trabajadora que siempre ha luchado por salir adelante y ayudar a sus familiares, anteriormente ya ha tenido préstamos con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Irma, age 47, lives with her husband and their two children in the Chequén sector, Chepén district. It is an agricultural area with plenty of commercial movement. It is situated in the province of the same name in the La Libertad region. It is an hour from the city of Chiclayo, which is the capital of the Lambayeque region. For over ten years she has been selling vegetables. She has a stand set up in the Parada market in the city of Chepén. She sells her customers all types of fresh vegetables. Her business is very well received because she always tries to offer good quality products and friendly service. With the income she gets from this activity she helps her husband, a farmer, to financially support the family. Irma wants to expand her business by purchasing more vegetables. She will do this so that she can increase her stock and increase her sales. She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,600 soles in order to meet her goal. Irma is a hard-working woman who has always struggled to get ahead and help her family. She has had previous loans with our institution, and she has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy vegetables to increase her business of selling in the market

loans.name: Mercy Roció

texts.es:
Mercy Roció B. G. tiene 24 años. Es casada, y vive con su esposo en el cantón de Ventanas, en la provincia de Los Ríos. Esta esperando una niña.

Mercy es una socia de la ventanilla rural Recinto San Ramón, que esta ubicada en Nuevo San Ramón, a 12 Km. de Ventanas. Son 20 socios en total, que están trabajando en la agricultura de corto ciclo (cosecha de 6 meses). Esto es el primer crédito que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa.

Mercy esta estudiante para ser secretaria administrativa, y al mismo tiempo, ayudando a su esposo en la agricultura (maíz y arroz). Hacen las ventas de sus productos en los comerciales López y G. de Ventanas cada 6 meses. 

Solicita el préstamo para sembrar maíz: comprar semillas y abonos. Piensa que este crédito le ayudara a tener ganancia y más rentabilidad. Sus sueños son tener una casa, comprar un carro y tener una mejor vida para todos los hijos que va a tener (quisiera tener 6). Enfrenta desafíos en los cultivos de arroz con plaga y problemas de salud en la familia. 

Le gusta dormir en su tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Mercy Roció B. G. is 24 years old. She is married and lives with her husband in the Ventanas cantón, in the province of Los Ríos. She is expecting a daughter. Mercy is a member of the Recinto San Ramón solidarity group, which is located in Nuevo San Ramón, 12 kilometers from Ventanas. There are 20 members in all, who work in short-cycle agriculture (harvesting every 6 months). This is the first loan that that they have taken out through Cooperativa San Jose. Mercy is studying to be an administrative secretary and at the same time, she is helping her husband with their farming (corn and rice). Every six months, they sell their products in the López y G. commercial area of Ventanas. She is requesting this loan to plant corn: to buy seeds and fertilizer. She thinks that this loan will help her to make gains and to have greater profitability. Her dreams are to have a house, to buy a car, and to have a better life for all of the children she is going to have (she wants to have 6). She faces challenges like pests in her rice crop and health problems in her family. She likes to sleep in her free time.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to grow corn: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Jader Jose

texts.es:
Jader Jose de 21 años de edad es soltero, habita en colonia Talolinga, labora en su unidad de produccion realizando actividades agricolas y pecuarias, sirviendo como su principal fuente de ingreso, trabaja en conjunto con su mama y 2 hermanos, su padre Rafael Gacia le dio la potestad que administrara la unidad de produccion y su pequeño inventario ganadero. 

Jader necesita este financiamiento para invertirlo en  compra de 2 vacas paridas con el objetivo de aumentar su inventario ganadero e introducir animales con calidad de raza lechera, mejorando sus ingresos economicos por la venta de leche, lo que le permitira mejorar sus condiciones de vida.

En la colonia donde habita lo consideran como un hombre responsable, trabajador y de buenos valores morales, espera ser beneficiado con este credito, para poder llevar a cabo su actividad proyectada.
texts.en:
Jader Jose is 21 years old and single. He lives in the neighborhood of Talolinga, and he carries out farming and ranching activities in his production unit, which serves as his main source of income. He works together with his mother and two brothers. His father, Rafael Gacia, gave him the authority to administer the production unit and his small inventory of livestock. Jader needs this loan to invest in buying 2 calved cows with the aim of increasing his inventory of livestock and adding high-quality dairy stock. This will increase his income from selling milk, which will permit him to raise his standard of living. In the neighborhood where he lives, he is known as a responsible and hard-working man with strong moral values. He hopes to gain benefits from this loan so that he can carry out his planned activity.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying two calved cows

loans.name: Jorge Aladino

texts.es:
Jorge Aladino V. M. tiene 25 años. Es soltero vive con su padres, no tiene  hijo, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Jorge  es un socio de la ventanilla rural Rey de Reyes, que está ubicada a hora y media de Chillanes. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Jorge  se dedica a la agricultura, siembra cacao y maracuya. Realiza sus compras las realiza cada mes en Matilde Esther y las ventas las realiza en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en semillas para cacao y maracuya. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener una plantación para aumentar la producción. Enfrenta desafíos es el clima y las plagas y enfermedades.

Le gusta los deportes.
texts.en:
Jorge Aladino V. M. is 25 years old. He is single, does not have any children, and lives with his parents in the Chillanes district in the province of Bolívar. Jorge is a member of the Rey de Reyes rural loan group, which is located an hour and a half from Chillanes. In all, there are 23 members of the group, and the majority of them make a living farming. This is the first loan that Jorge has taken out with Cooperativa San José. Jorge also makes a living farming: he grows cacao and passion fruit. He makes his purchases in Matilde Esther each month and also sells his produce there. Jorge will use the loan he is requesting to invest in cacao and passion fruit seeds. He sees the loan as an opportunity to get ahead. His dream is to have a field so that he can increase his production. The main obstacles he faces are the climate, pests, and diseases. Apart from farming, Jorge enjoys sports.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing cacao and passion fruit seeds

loans.name: Juana Del Pilar

texts.es:
Juana del Pilar T. P. tiene 33 años. Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Ventanas, en la provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 3 niños, de casi 3 años a 14 años.

Juana es una socia de la ventanilla rural Recinto San Ramón, que esta ubicada en Nuevo San Ramón, a 12 Km. de Ventanas. Son 20 socios en total, que están trabajando en la agricultura de corto ciclo (cosecha en 6 meses). Esto es el primer crédito que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa.

Juana trabaja en la agricultura, cultivando maíz y arroz. Hace sus ventas en Ventanas y Pechincha cada 6 meses (hay 2 cosechas al año aquí en la Costa). 

Solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos, semillas y abonos. Piensa que su vida cambiara con apoyo del préstamo, porque el interés es mínimo con la Cooperativa y la ganancia es mayor que los otros prestamos afuera. Sus sueños son tener su negocio propio (una tienda) y tener una casa propia (ahora vive en la casa de sus papas). Enfrenta enfermedades en el maíz (langosta) 

Le gusta leer la Biblia, ver la televisión, escuchar música y ayudar a los deberes de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juana del Pilar T. P., age 33, lives in a common-law marriage in the Ventanas canton in the Los Ríos province. She has three children ranging in age from almost 3 years to 14 years. Juana is a member of the “Recinto San Ramón” (San Ramón Neighborhood) Communal Bank. It is located in Nuevo San Ramón 20 kilometers from Venanas. There are 20 members in all. They are working with short growing cycle crops (harvest in six months). This is their first loan with the Cooperativa. Juana works in agriculture; she grows corn and rice. She makes her sales in Ventanas and Pechincha every six months (in La Costa there are two harvests a year). She is requesting the loan to buy supplies, seeds, and fertilizer. She thinks that her life will change with the help of the loan. She thinks this because the interest with the Cooperativa is minimal, and the gain is greater than other outside loans. Her dreams are to have her own business (a store) and to have her own house (now she lives in her parents’ house). The corn crop faces diseases (locust). She likes to read the Bible, watch television, listen to music, and help her children with their chores.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies, seeds, and fertilizer

loans.name: Rosa Pepita

texts.es:
Rosa de 47 años, vive en el Suburbio de Guayaquil(zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales), ella tiene un pequeño restaurante, hace comidas típicas como seco de chivo, pollo y carne. 

Uno de sus hijos la motivo a que dejara de cocinar en su casa y se pusiera su propio negocio de comidas, comenzó haciendo platos típicos poco a poco invirtió dinero para comprar una cocina industrial, por esa buena decisión ella ahora tiene un pequeño restaurante hace almuerzos y meriendas, trabaja desde las 16h00 hasta las 22:00pm todos los días. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar bebidas y arroz para sus comidas, en el futuro quiere tener un local y trabaja con mas personas.
texts.en:
Rosa, who is 47 years old, lives in the Suburbio de Guayaquil (an urban area; the majority of inhabitants are small business owners). She has a small restaurant where she makes typical foods like braised goat stew, chicken stew and beef stew. One of her children urged her to stop cooking in her house and start her own food business. She began by making typical dishes and little by little invested the money to buy an industrial kitchen. Because of this good decision she now has a small restaurant where she makes meals and snacks. She works from 4:00 pm until 10:00 pm everyday. Rosa wants to use the loan to buy drinks and rice for her foods. In the future, she wants to have a larger restaurant and work with more people.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Drinks, rice

loans.name: Juana Piedad

texts.es:
Juana Piedad G. C. tiene 52 años. Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Ventanas, en la provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 4 hijos, de 24 a 30 años.

Juana es una socia de la ventanilla rural Recinto San Ramón, que esta ubicada en Nuevo San Ramón, a 12 Km. de Ventanas. Son 20 socios en total, que están trabajando en la agricultura de corto ciclo (cosecha en 6 meses). Esto es el primer crédito que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa.

Juana trabaja en la agricultura, cultivando maíz y arroz de verano. Hace sus ventas en los comerciales Laura, López y Cinero de Ventanas cada 6 meses. 

Solicita el préstamo para seguir aumentando el negocio: comprar semillas y abonos. Piensa que este crédito le ayudara a superarse trabajando.
Su sueño es comprar un carro para su hijo y después para ella. Enfrenta problemas de salud en la familia.

Le gusta divertirse mucho: escuchar música, bailar y jugar y cantar con sus nietos. Se dedica a su finca toda la semana y a su familia el fin de semana.
texts.en:
Juana Piedad G. C. is 52 years old. She is in a common-law marriage and lives in the district of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. She has 4 children ranging in age from 24 to 30. Juana is a member of the Recinto San Ramón rural loan group, which is located in Nuevo San Ramón, about 12 km from Ventanas. In all, there are 20 members of the group who make a living cultivating short-cycle crops (harvesting in 6 months). This is the first loan that Juana has taken out with Cooperativa San José. Juana also makes a living farming: she grows corn and dry-season rice. She sells her produce at the Laura, López, and Cinero stores in Ventanas every 6 months. Juana will use the loan she is requesting to grow her business by purchasing seeds and fertilizer. She thinks that this loan will help her improve her work. Juana’s dream is to purchase a car for her son, and later one for herself. The main problem she faces is poor health in the family. Juana enjoys many things: listening to music, dancing, and playing and singing with her grandchildren. She attends to her farm all week and then spends time with her family on the weekend.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Growing her business by purchasing seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Martha Yasmina

texts.es: Martha Yasmina tiene 25 años, su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 2 años que se dedica a ofrecer a sus clientes una gran variedad de productos, anteriormente trabajaba en una tienda como dependiente, pero debido a las dificultades que atravesaban en la tienda no siguió laborando ahí, por lo que fue con estos años de experiencia que ha obtenido decide iniciar su propio negocio, como es la venta de mercadería en general. Por lo que sueña con establecer su propia tienda. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de perfumes, colonias, ropa interior, ropa en general.
texts.en:
Martha Yasmina is 25 years old. She earns money selling general merchandise. For more than two years, she has offered her customers a wide variety of products. She previously worked as a sales clerk in a store, but due to the difficulties that she encountered in the store, she did not continue working there. With those years of experience, though, she decided to start her own business selling general merchandise. She dreams of establishing her own store. The financing she is requesting is for the purchase of perfumes, colognes, undergarments, and other clothing items.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy perfumes, colognes, undergarments, and other clothing items

loans.name: Progreso Hacia Adelante 1, 2 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Miguelina is the coordinator of her group, Progreso Hacia Adelante (Forward Progress). She makes her home in a simple structure with her longterm partner and two children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to raise her children in the community they live in. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying cooking.

Miguelina is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for two years. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying rice, beans, chicken and oil. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business.

This associate began with Esperanza because she wanted to earn more money and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Miguelina’s group is located in San Pedro D. Macoris, a city famous for its baseball players and its sugarcane industries. The main economic activity is the free-trading zone, a cement factory, and others. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable).

loans.use: To buy more rice, beans, chicken and oil to cook and sell

loans.name: Nezar Kleber

texts.es:
Nezar Kleber B. C. tiene 58 años. Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Ventanas, en la provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 4 hijos, de 24, 25, 30 y 36 años.

Nezar es un socio de la ventanilla rural Recinto San Ramón, que esta ubicada en Nuevo San Ramón, a 12 Km. de Ventanas. Son 20 socios en total, que están trabajando en la agricultura de corto ciclo (cosecha en 6 meses). Esto es el primer crédito que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa.

Nezar trabaja en la agricultura, cultivando maíz, arroz y cacao. Hace sus ventas en el comercial García de Ventanas cada 6 meses. 

Solicita el préstamo para comprar agricultura de verano para sembrar: comprar semillas y abonos. Necesita dinero para la agricultura. Esta ahorrando con la Cooperativa, pero no esta suficiente para trabajar. 

Su sueño es dejar algo a sus hijos. Le gusta jugar indoor fútbol, tiene su propio equipo que juega cada domingo.
texts.en:
Nezar Kleber B. C. is 58 years old. He is in a common-law marriage and lives in the Ventanas cantón, in the province of Los Ríos. He has four children, who are 24, 25, 30, and 36 years old. Nezar is a member of the Recinto San Ramón solidarity group, which is located in Nuevo San Ramón, 12 kilometers from Ventanas. There are 20 members in all, who work in short-cycle agriculture (harvesting every six months). This is the first loan that they are taking out from Cooperativa San Jose. Nezar works in agriculture, growing corn, rice, and cocoa. He makes his sales every six months in the García commercial area of Ventanas. He is requesting this loan in order to purchase summer crops to plant. He will buy seeds and fertilizer. He needs money for farming. He is saving with the Cooperativa, but it is not enough to make ends meet. His dream is to leave something behind for his children. He enjoys playing indoor soccer, and has his own team that plays every Sunday.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to plant summer crops: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Luís Ricardo

texts.es:
Luís Ricardo R. V. tiene 20 años. Es soltero y vive con sus padres en el cantón de Ventanas, en la provincia de Los Ríos. 

Luís es un socio de la ventanilla rural Recinto San Ramón, que esta ubicada en Nuevo San Ramón, a 12 Km. de Ventanas. Son 20 socios en total, que están trabajando en la agricultura de corto ciclo (cosecha en 6 meses). Esto es el primer crédito que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa.

Luís esta estudiando, y al mismo tiempo trabaja en la agricultura, cultivando maíz y arroz. Hace sus ventas en Ventanas cada 6 meses. 

Solicita el préstamo para trabajar en agricultura: comprar insumos, semillas y abonos. Piensa que este crédito le ayudara un poco a salir adelante. Su sueño es seguir estudiando en la Universidad si puede. Dice que falta de ganancia para esto. 

Le gusta leer en su tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Luís Ricardo R. V. is 20 years old. He is single and lives with his parents in the canton of Ventanas, in Los Ríos province. Luís is a member of the Recinto San Ramón communal bank, which is located in Nuevo San Ramón, 12 kilometers from Ventanas. The group has a total of 20 members, who work in short-cycle agriculture (with harvests after 6 months). This is their first loan with the Cooperative. Luís is a student while also working in agriculture, growing corn and rice. He sells his crops in Ventanas every 6 months. He is requesting the loan to advance his agricultural work, buying supplies, seeds and fertilizers. He believes that this loan will help him get ahead a little. His dream is to keep studying at the university if he can. He says that he still does not have enough income to do so. In his free time, he likes to read.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing supplies, seeds and fertilizer for his agricultural work

loans.name: Henry Alberto

texts.es:
Henry Alberto T. C. tiene 39 años. Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Ventanas, en la provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 4 hijos, de 10, 14, 16 y 20 años.

Henry es un socio de la ventanilla rural Recinto San Ramón, que esta ubicada en Nuevo San Ramón, a 12 Km. de Ventanas. Son 20 socios en total, que están trabajando en la agricultura de corto ciclo (cosecha en 6 meses). Esto es el primer crédito que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa.

Henry trabaja en la agricultura, cultivando maíz y arroz. Hace sus ventas en Ventanas cada 6 meses. 

Solicita el préstamo para trabajar en ciclo corto: comprar abonos, semillas y fertilizantes. Su sueño es tener una buena producción y pagar los estudios de sus niños.  Enfrenta desafíos en los cultivos, como plaga y langosta. 

Le gusta jugar indoor fútbol.
texts.en:
Henry Alberto T. C. is 39 years old. He lives with his common-law wife in the canton of Ventanas, in Los Ríos province. He has 4 children, aged 10, 14, 16 and 20. Henry is a member of the Recinto San Ramón communal bank, which is located in Nuevo San Ramón, 12 kilometers from Ventanas. The group has a total of 20 members, who work in short-cycle agriculture (with harvests after 6 months). This is their first loan with the Cooperative. Henry works in agriculture, growing corn and rice. He sells his crops in Ventanas every 6 months. He is requesting the loan to support his short-cycle agricultural work, buying compost, seeds and fertilizers. His dream is to have a good level of production and to pay for his children's studies. He has faced some challenges with his crops, such as pests and locusts. He enjoys playing indoor soccer.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying compost, seeds and fertilizers for his short-cycle crops

loans.name: Abel Geremias

texts.es:
Abel Geremias M. M. tiene 20 años. Es soltero y vive con sus padres en el cantón de Ventanas, en la provincia de Los Ríos. 

Abel es un socio de la ventanilla rural Recinto San Ramón, que esta ubicada en Nuevo San Ramón, a 12 Km. de Ventanas. Son 20 socios en total, que están trabajando en la agricultura de corto ciclo (cosecha en 6 meses). Esto es el primer crédito que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa.

Abel esta estudiando, y al mismo tiempo trabaja en la agricultura, cultivando maíz y arroz. Hace sus ventas en Ventanas cada 6 meses. 

Solicita el préstamo para sembrar maíz y arroz: comprar fertilizantes, semillas y abonos. Piensa que este crédito le ayudara  si lo invierte bien para trabajar bien. Su sueño es terminar sus estudios y tener un buen trabajo afuera de la agricultura. 

Le gusta hacer deportes: jugar indoor fútbol y pelota, leer y cantar con la guitarra en su tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Abel Geremias M. M. is 20 years old. He is single and lives with his parents in the canton of Ventanas, in Los Ríos province. Abel is a member of the Recinto San Ramón communal bank, which is located in Nuevo San Ramón, 12 kilometers from Ventanas. The group has a total of 20 members, who work in short-cycle agriculture (with harvests after 6 months). This is their first loan with the Cooperative. Abel is a student while also working in agriculture, growing corn and rice. He sells his crops in Ventanas every 6 months. He is requesting the loan to buy compost, seeds and fertilizers for his corn and rice crops. He thinks that this loan will be a great help to him if he can invest it wisely to improve the effectiveness of his work. His dream is to finish his university studies and have a good job outside of agriculture. In his free time, he enjoys playing sports such as indoor soccer and pelota (an Ecuadorian form of soccer), reading, singing and playing the guitar.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying compost, seeds and fertilizers for his rice and corn crops

loans.name: Las Flores Group

texts.es:
el grupo Las Flores son mujeres que se dedican al comercio, cada una de ellas posee su propio negocio, son mujeres que se conocen muy bien entre ellas mismas ya que residen en la misma comunidad.
a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan diariamente:

la sra. Alejandrina Maria D. se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es la venta de abarrotería, su negocio opera bajo el nombre de Pulpería “DINORA” 
Doña alejandrina tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, y es notable que durante este tiempo lo a sabido administrar, con los ingresos que le genera su negocio le ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y de sus hijos.

El esposo de la Sra. Díaz se dedica a la agricultura ya que este es uno de los oficios más productivos en toda la zona de El Coyolar Jutiapa.        
El negocio de Doña María luce bien surtido en la comunidad del Coyolar ya que dentro del mismo se encuentra lo más necesario para el consumo diario como ser: Azúcar, arroz, manteca, jabón, café, salsa, espaguetis, carnes, embutidos, queso, mantequilla, etc.

la sra. Marta Facunda M. tiene varios años de dedicarse al negocio, su actividad principal es una pequeña pulpería, misma que opera bajo el nombre de Pulpería “M.”
Doña Marta nos comento que inicio con poco producto en su negocio, pero cada vez a logrado hacerlo mas grande, las ganancias la invierte de nuevo en su negocio y de esta forma a hecho que sea mas grande cada vez.

  En su negocio se encuentra lo más necesario para el consumo diario como ser: Azúcar, Jabón, manteca, arroz, café, espaguetis, salsa, papel higiénico, pollo, carnes, embutidos etc.
Su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación y con las ganancias que recibe a sacado adelante a sus 2 hijos.
Su compañero de hogar el Sr. Marco Ruiz se dedica al destazo de Res y a la agricultura. el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia al por mayor y asi surtir mas su pulperia.


la sra. Mariana del Carmen M. D. tiene 2 años de haber iniciado con su negocio de elaboración y venta de tortillas de Maíz, negocio en el cual le va muy bien.
Doña Mariana tiene contrato diario de lunes a viernes de por lo menos L. 180.00 de tortillas con la dueña de la caseta del Instituto Polivalente de la aldea de Jutiapa, mas lo que vende dentro de la comunidad donde ella reside y esto equivale por lo menos 5 medidas de maíz molidas diariamente.
Doña Mariana nos comento que por las cantidades de que muele, un saco de maíz solo le dura de 8 a 10 días y con las ganancias que percibe de su tortillera a colaborado con su compañero de hogar a la manutención y estudio de sus 2 hijos. El Sr. Donaldo Rodríguez es su compañero de hogar y se dedica a la agricultura.
texts.en:
The group "Las Flores" ["The Flowers"] is made up of women who work in trade. They all have their own businesses, and they are women who know each other very well, since they live in the same community. The following sections describe the various activities they carry out each day: Alejandrina Maria D. works in trade, and her main activity is selling groceries. Her business operates under the name "Pulpería DINORA" ["Dinora General Store"]. Alejandrina has worked in this business for several years, and her excellent management during this time has been noteworthy. With the income from her business, she helps her husband with the expenses of their household and children. Mrs. Díaz' husband works in agriculture, since it is one of the most productive areas of all of the zone of El Coyolar Jutiapa. Her business is one of the best-stocked in the community of Coyolar, containing all of the basic necessities for daily life, such as sugar, rice, shortening, soap, coffee, sauces, spaghetti, meat, sausages, cheese, butter, etc. Marta Facunda M. has worked in her business for several years. Her main activity is a small general store, which operates under the name of "Pulpería M..” Marta tells us that she began with just a few products in her store, but she has gradually been able to expand it. She has invested her earnings back into her business, and in this way she has been able to make it bigger and bigger. Her business include the most necessary items for daily consumption, such as sugar, soap, shortening, rice, coffee, spaghetti, sauces, toilet paper, chicken, meat, sausages, etc. Her store is located in the house where she lives, and with the profits she receives, she has helped her 2 children get ahead. Her live-in partner, Marco Ruiz, is a beef butcher and farmer. She will use the loan to buy more merchandise on a wholesale basis and thus expand her store's inventory. Mariana del Carmen M. D. started her business two years ago. She works preparing and selling corn tortillas, a business that is going very well for her. Mariana has a daily contract, from Monday through Friday, for at least L.180.00 worth of tortillas from the owner of the food stand at the Multipurpose Institute in the municipality of Jutiapa, plus what she sells within the community where she lives. This represents at least 5 measures of ground corn each day. Mariana tells us that because of the quantities she grinds, a sack of corn only lasts her 8 to 10 days. With the earnings from her tortilla business, she has worked together with her life partner Donaldo Rodríguez, a farmer, to pay their household expenses and educate their 2 children.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying products such as sugar, rice, shortening, soap, coffee, sauces, spaghetti, meat, sausage, cheese, butter, firewood, corn, lime, water and matches

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Reynaldo José

texts.es: Don Reynaldo C. tiene 32 años de edad, su señora es ama de casa, tiene 3 hijos de 16, 11 y 8 años de edad, todos ellos se encuentran estudiando. Habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, en donde se dedica a la agricultura, tiene 16 años de experiencia, inició esta actividad con la ayuda de su papá, él siembre piña, y el crédito será usado para la compra de Insumos y fertilizantes para aplicárselo a su siembre y así asegurar la producción de esta fruta, y con eso también asegurará el poder seguir apoyando a sus hijos para que logren terminar sus estudios y llegar a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Mr. Reynaldo C. is 32 years old, his wife manages the home, they have 3 children of 16, 11 and 8 years of age, all of them are attending school. He lives in the Ticuantepe municipality where he has worked in agriculture for 16 years. He began his work with his fathers help, he grows pineapples. The loan will be used to buy supplies and fertilizer to use on his crops. This will ensure the production of his fruit and he will be able to support his children so that they can finish their studies and be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Maria Lucia

texts.es:
María de 62 años, vive en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil), ella tiene en su casa una pequeña tienda de golosinas. 

Comenzó con la tienda para poder mantener a su familia y ayudar a su esposo que es albañil, vendiendo en una carretilla recorriendo Duran completo el dinero para ubicar su pequeña tienda en su casa. Vende caramelos, cachitos, etc. Trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 19h00pm todos los días.  

Para poder seguir con su negocio quiere comprar golosinas y una vitrina pequeña, en el futuro quiere tener dinero para una tienda para su hijo.
texts.en:
Maria, 62, lives in Primavera de Duran (on the outskirts of Guayaquil in an area with a deteriorating ecosystem). She has a small candy store in her house. She started the store so that she could take care of her family and help her husband who is a bricklayer. She started selling in a small cart all through Duran and was able to put up a small store in her house. She sells caramels, small rolls, etc. She works from 7 am until 7 pm every day. So that she can continue her business she wants to buy candies and a small display case, and in the future she would like to have the money for a store for her son.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Candies, a display case

loans.name: Gladys Severa

texts.es:
Gladys Severa M. M. tiene 35 años. Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Ventanas, en la provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 7 niños, de 9 hasta 17 años.

Gladys es una socia de la ventanilla rural Recinto San Ramón, que esta ubicada en Nuevo San Ramón, a 12 Km. de Ventanas. Son 20 socios en total, que están trabajando en la agricultura de corto ciclo (cosecha en 6 meses). Esto es el primer crédito que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa.

Gladys trabaja en la casa, y apoya su esposo en la agricultura, cultivando maíz y arroz. Hacen sus ventas en Ventanas cada 6 meses. 

Solicita el préstamo para hacer maíz: comprar semillas y abonos. Piensa que este crédito le ayudara a tener dinero a invertir. Su sueño es dar estudios a sus hijos y comprar lo que necesitan. Enfrenta plaga y langosta en los cultivos.

Le gusta pasar su tempo libre con sus hijos.

En la fotografica esta con su esposo.
texts.en:
Gladys Severa M. M. is 35 years old. She lives with her common-law husband in the canton of Ventanas, in Los Ríos province. She has 7 children, ranging from age 9 to 17. Gladys is a member of the Recinto San Ramón communal bank, which is located in Nuevo San Ramón, 12 kilometers from Ventanas. The group has a total of 20 members, who work in short-cycle agriculture (with harvests after 6 months). This is their first loan with the Cooperative. Gladys works within the home and also supports her husband in agricultural work, growing corn and rice. They sell their crops in Ventanas every 6 months. She is requesting the loan to buy seeds and compost to grow corn. She believes that this loan will help her earn money to invest. Her dream is to pay for her children's studies and buy them what they need. She has battled pests and locusts in her crops. She likes to spend her free time with her children. She is shown with her husband in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying seeds and compost to grow corn

loans.name: Santos David

texts.es:
El Sr. Santos García se dedica a la venta de productos escolares y de productos de uso personal, sus condiciones de vida han mejorado y el crecimiento en su negocio es notable.
Tiene seis años de dedicarse a este tipo de negocio.
El señor García es casado y con las ganancias que ha percibido de su negocio a pagado los gastos estudiantiles y manutención de sus 2 hijos, su esposa la señora Ada Luz Zelaya es enfermera y juntos han mejorado sus condiciones de vida.    
Su negocio opera bajo el nombre de “Variedades MELISSA” este luce de una gran variedad de surtido como ser: Papelería (cuaderno de espiral, tarea, dibujo, caligrafía, bong, cartulina, lápices etc.) cremas, desodorantes, regalos para toda ocasión, y venta de ropa nueva y americana.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia y asi tener mas surtido su negocio.
texts.en:
Santos García sells school products and personal use products. His living conditions have improved, and the growth of his business is notable. He has been devoting himself to this type of business for six years. Mr. García is married. With the income from his business he has supported his two children and paid their educational expenses. His wife, Ada Luz Zelaya, is a nurse. Together they have improved their living conditions. His business operates under the name “Variedades MELISSA”. His business carries a great variety of stock like paper products (spiral notebooks, forms, drawing paper, calligraphy products, cardboard, and pencils, etc.), creams, deodorant, gifts for all occasions, and new and American clothing. He will use the loan to buy more merchandise. That way his business will be better stocked.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy deodorant, shampoo, soap, pencils, papers, markers, erasers, liquid corrector, glue, and tooth paste

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Flor Maria

texts.es:
Flor Maria T. A. tiene 24 años. Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Ventanas, en la provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene un niño de 18 meses.

Flor es una socia de la ventanilla rural Recinto San Ramón, que esta ubicada en Nuevo San Ramón, a 12 Km. de Ventanas. Son 20 socios en total, que están trabajando en la agricultura de corto ciclo (cosecha en 6 meses). Esto es el primer crédito que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa.

Flor trabaja en la agricultura, cultivando maíz y arroz de verano. Hace sus ventas en Ventanas cada 6 meses. 

Solicita el préstamo para comprar ureas, semillas y abonos. Piensa que este crédito le ayudara a trabajar.Su sueño es tener una casa propia. Enfrenta desafíos con su bebe que se enferma mucho y con enfermedades en los cultivos. 

Le gusta escuchar música de Ecuador en su tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Flor Maria T. A. is twenty-four years old and lives with her partner in the canton of Ventanas, in the province of Los Rios. She has an eighteen month old son. Flor is a member of the communal bank "Recinto San Ramon" which is located in Nuevo San Ramon, twelve kilometers from Ventanas. The communal bank has twenty members who all work in six month farming cycles. This is the first loan they are taking out. Flor is a farmer who grows corn and summer rice. She sells her crops in Ventanas every six months. She is taking out a loan to buy seeds, nitrogen, and fertilizers. Flor thinks that this loan will help her with her work. She dreams of having her own home. She faces many challenges -- her baby gets sick a lot and her crops are affected by pests.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds, nitrogen and other fertalizers

loans.name: Las Colinas Group

texts.es:
Este comité se encuentra trabajando dentro del tercer ciclo de comité del programa comite de mujeres, todas estas trabajando con mucha esperanza para mejorar sus trabajos y también sus ingresos con el objetivo de mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias.

Así cada una de las señoras trabaja de forma independiente dependiendo de la necesidad de la zona en que se encuentran.
Estas señoras son de familias muy humildes y las zonas donde viven son muy despobladas y con muchas necesidades, pero todas procuran para salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Lida quien se dedica a la venta de comestibles, ella prepara todo muy temprano en su casa y luego sale en las zonas donde concurre mucha gente de esa forma para vender todos sus comestibles.
Ella tiene varios hijos y su marido no cuenta con ingreso fijo suficiente para mantener la familia ya que es jornalero, es por ello que ella procura muchísimo para salir adelante.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de ingredientes como dulces de leche y guayaba, carne, verduras, aceites, y otros.
texts.en:
This committee is in its third loan cycle as part of the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs Program. They are working with great hope of improving their businesses and incomes so that they can raise the quality of life for their families. Each woman works independently based on the needs of the communities where they live. These women are from very modest families and live in areas that are sparsely populated yet have many needs. They all seek to move forward. One of the members is Sra. Lida who sells food. She prepares everything very early at home and then goes to places where many people gather in order to sell all of her inventory. Lida has several children, but her husband works as a farm laborer and does not earn a steady income that is sufficient for supporting their family. For this reason, it is difficult for them to get ahead. Lida is requesting a loan to buy ingredients such as condensed milk, guavas, meat, vegetables, oil, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase condensed milk, guavas, meat, vegetables, oil, and other items

loans.name: Ana Maryuri

texts.es:
Ana Maryuri T. C. tiene 28 años. Es soltera y vive con sus padres en el cantón de Ventanas, en la provincia de Los Ríos. 

Ana es una socia de la ventanilla rural Recinto San Ramón, que esta ubicada en Nuevo San Ramón, a 12 Km. de Ventanas. Son 20 socios en total, que están trabajando en la agricultura de corto ciclo (cosecha en 6 meses). Esto es el primer crédito que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa.

Ana trabaja en la agricultura, cultivando maíz, arroz, cacao y plátanos para el consumo de la familia. Hace sus ventas en Ventanas, cada mes para el cacao y cada 6 meses para los otros cultivos. 

Solicita el préstamo para trabajar en ciclo corto: poner más arroz, comprando insumos, semillas, fertilizantes y abonos. Piensa que este crédito le ayudara a salir adelante trabajando.
Su sueño es trabajar para tener una casa arreglada. Enfrenta problemas de salud en la familia con su mama enferma y los cultivos con plaga y langosta.

Le gusta escuchar música (bachata).
texts.en:
Ana Maryuri T. C. is 28 years old, single, and lives with her parents in the canton of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.

Ana is a member of the Recinto San Ramón Communal Bank, which is located in Nuevo San Ramos, 12km outside of Ventanas. The group consists of 20 members who engage in short cycle agriculture (growing crops that can be harvested in six months). They are requesting their first loan from Cooperativa San José.

Ana is a farmer who grows corn, rice, cacao, and bananas for family consumption. She also sells her crops in Ventanas. The cacao is sold every month, while the other crops are sold every six months.

She is requesting a loan for her work in short cycle farming. Ana wants to plant more rice, so she plans to buy supplies, seeds, fertilizers, and compost. She believes this loan will help her get ahead in her work. Her dream is to have a remodeled home. Among the problems she has to confront are the poor health of her mother and diseases and locusts that harm her crops.

Ana enjoys listening to Bachata music.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies, seeds, fertilizers, and compost for planting rice

loans.name: Pedro Benigno

texts.es:
Pedro Benigno T. P. tiene 64 años. Vive en unión libre con sus 6 hijos de 23 hasta 40 años, en el cantón de Ventanas, en la provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pedro es un socio de la ventanilla rural Recinto San Ramón, que esta ubicada en Nuevo San Ramón, a 12 Km. de Ventanas. Son 20 socios en total, que están trabajando en la agricultura de corto ciclo (cosecha en 6 meses). Esto es el primer crédito que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa.

Pedro trabaja en la agricultura, cultivando maíz, arroz y cacao. Hace sus ventas en Ventanas cada 6 meses. 

Solicita el préstamo para trabajar en los cultivos de verano. Ya tiene el terreno preparado, solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y abonos. Piensa que este crédito le ayudara porque el costo es bajo y podría tener buenos beneficios de su trabajo. Su sueño es tener salud y dar estudios a sus nietos (4 viven con el). Quisiera tener poquito más de dinero. Los únicos problemas que tiene son a veces discusiones animadas con su mujer (son casados hace mas de 40 años)

Le gusta dormir y descansar en su tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Pedro Benigno T. P. is 64 years old and lives in the canton of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province. He is in a common law marriage and has six children between the ages of 23 and 40.

Pedro is a member of the Recinto San Ramón Communal Bank, which is located in Nuevo San Ramos, 12km outside of Ventanas. The group consists of 20 members who engage in short cycle agriculture (growing crops that can be harvested in six months). They are requesting their first loan from Cooperativa San José.

Pedro is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and cacao. He sells his crops in Ventanas every six months.

He is requesting a loan for his summer crops since he has already prepared the land. Pedro plans to buy seeds and compost. He believes the loan will be helpful because it does not cost him much and he will be able to achieve good benefits in his work. His dream is to be healthy and provide an education for his four grandchildren that live with him. Pedro also wants to have a little more money. The only problems he faces are whenever he occasionally gets into heated discussions with his wife. After all, they have been together for more than 40 years.

He enjoys sleeping and relaxing in his spare time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds & compost for his summer crops

loans.name: Heydi Del Socorro

texts.es: Heydi Del Socorro tiene 31 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio en un cyber. Hace más de 15 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que siempre está pensando en mejorar para el bienestar de su familia, ella siempre ha sido una madre muy responsable y disfruta de su negocio, por lo que tiene 1 hijo menor de edad que tiene que hacerse cargo. Para en el futuro ella desea incrementar su negocio, estableciendo nuevas computadoras para sus clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de computadoras, teclados y accesorios para computadora.
texts.en:
Heydi Del Socorro is 31 years old and offers Internet services at her cybercafé. She has been in business for more than 15 years and is always thinking about making improvements for the welfare of her family. Heydi has always been a very responsible mother who enjoys running her business. She has a young child who is under her care.

In the future, she wants to expand her business by setting up new computers for her customers. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy computers, keyboards, and computer accessories.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase computers, keyboards, and accessories

loans.name: Isaías

texts.es:
Isaías  T. Godínez  es un joven de 29  años de edad el cual vive con su esposa y su hijo en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Isaías se ha destacado por ser un joven valiente y trabajador. Su familia siempre se ha dedicado a la ganadería de doble propósito. Esto le ha permitido tener una fuente de ingresos, con lo que  ha logrado  comprar su propia casita, para vivir con su esposa y su hijo que acaba de nacer.

Para seguir con su negocio Isaías necesita un préstamo de ¢618.000 (seiscientos dieciocho mil colones), para comprar semilla de pasto  y mejorar las condiciones del corral donde tiene sus  vacas. Con esto el podrá mejorar la calidad de su producto y así obtener mejores ingresos.

Don Isaías es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo  préstamo,  y con él espera crecer seguir creciendo para forjar un mejor futuro para su hijo.
texts.en:
Isaías T. Godínez is a young man who is 29 years of age. He lives with his wife and child in the community of Santa Fe, which is located in Los Chiles in Alajuela Province. This community is known for being situated in a mountainous area near the northern border of the country. The main business activities are livestock breeding and farming, specifically the cultivation of basic grains, sugar cane, and oranges.

Isaías is known for being a courageous and hardworking young man. His family has always engaged in raising livestock for the purpose of producing both milk and meat. This has enabled him to have a source income by which he was able to build his own house where he lives with his wife and newborn son.

In order to move forward in his business, Isaías needs a loan of 618,000 CRC to buy grass seeds and improve the condition of the pasture where he keeps his cattle. This will improve the quality of his product and help him obtain better earnings.

Don Isaías is a member of the Manantial de Santa Fe Communal Credit Enterprise, one of 100 member organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his second loan and he hopes to continue growing so that he can build a better future for his son.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grass seeds and make improvements to his pasture

loans.name: Víctor

texts.es: Víctor R. M., tiene la edad de 40 años, está casado, y tiene  5 hijos, de 22, 20, 18, 17 y 7 años, y son su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de mercadería. El se dedica a la venta de artículos para el hogar.  Desea tener un inventario más variado de artículos para la venta, también desea  hacer nuevas rutas para ofrecer  sus productos para  el hogar y así ir ampliando su clientela. No es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le han brindado siempre. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como comerciante.
texts.en:
Víctor R. M. is 40 years old, is married and has 5 children who are 22, 20, 18, 17 and 7 years old, they are his main priority. He wants the loan to buy merchandize. Víctor sells household articles and wishes to have a greater variety of inventory for sale and to have new routes to offer his household products so that he can increase his clientele. This is not his first time getting a loan with FUDECOSUR and is very happy with the help that he has received. In the future he hopes to give his family a better quality of life and more economic stability and to keep growing in his personal and professional life.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce ( to buy household articles)

loans.name: Melva Pilar

texts.es:
Melva Pilar T. C. tiene 26 años. Es separada y vive con sus 3 hijos de 8,10 y 11 y media años, en el cantón de Ventanas, en la provincia de Los Ríos. 

Melva es una socia de la ventanilla rural Recinto San Ramón, que esta ubicada en Nuevo San Ramón, a 12 Km. de Ventanas. Son 20 socios en total, que están trabajando en la agricultura de corto ciclo (cosecha en 6 meses). Esto es el primer crédito que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa.

Melva trabaja en la agricultura, cultivando maíz, arroz, y cacao. Hace sus ventas en Ventanas, cuando hay cacao (semanal) y cada 6 meses para maíz y arroz.

Solicita el préstamo para trabajar maíz y arroz: comprar insumos, semillas, y abonos. Piensa que este crédito le ayudara a seguir adelante y quedar bien para tener más crédito después. Su sueño es seguir adelante, que las cosas sean mejor en el futuro y que los niños no tienen enfermedades. Enfrente plagas en los cultivos.

Le gusta jugar con sus niños y jugar fútbol con mujeres.
texts.en:
Melva Pilar T. C. is 26 years old, separated from her husband, and has three children (ages 8, 10, and 11½). She lives in the canton of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.

Melva is a member of the Recinto San Ramón Communal Bank, which is located in Nuevo San Ramos, 12km outside of Ventanas. The group consists of 20 members who engage in short cycle agriculture (growing crops that can be harvested in six months). They are requesting their first loan from Cooperativa San José.

Melva is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and cacao. She sells cacao in Ventanas on a weekly basis. The corn and rice are sold every six months.

She is requesting a loan for growing corn and rice. Melva plans to buy supplies, seeds, and composts. She believes this loan will help her move forward and become eligible for subsequent loans. Her dream is to be successful, acquire nicer things in the future, and prevent her children from getting sick. She still has to confront diseases that affect her crops.

Melva enjoys playing with her children and playing women’s soccer.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies, seeds, and compost for planting rice and corn

loans.name: Estrellas Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Estrellas esta integrado por tres personas empresarias que residen en la aldea de Santa Marta en Jamastran, El Paraíso. Los tres integrantes del grupo son el Señor José Fermín B. Pavón, el Señor Narciso Méndez y el Señor Heriberto Sánchez. 


Don José es padre soltero, tiene dos hijos que dependen completamente de él. 

El Sr. José B., tiene varios años de dedicarse al comercio siendo su principal actividad  la compra y venta de granos básicos, plátanos, bananos, y una gran variedad de frutas y verduras como chile, tomates, repollo, cebollas, papas, mangos, sandias, naranjas, ciruelas y otras.

José sale a vender su producto en un carro de su propiedad,  Su negocio consiste en viajar a las montañas para comprar bananos, plátanos, maíz y frijoles.  luego maneja hasta la capital para llevar los productos al mercado de Tegucigalpa más conocido como el “mayoreo”  a venderlos. José aprovecha su visita al mayoreo no solo para vendar su producto sino también para comprar productos que se necesiten en su pueblo. De esta forma cuando José sale de Tegucigalpa lleva su carro lleno de productos para vender en la zona de Santa Maria y sus alrededores.

José utilizara el préstamo para comprar bananos, plátanos, may y frijoles. Con los ingresos que le genera su negocio, José continua en la lucha de sacar adelante a su familia. 

El Señor Narciso Méndez es casado y padre de 4 hijos de los cuales tres todavía dependen de él. Su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos y al cuidado de sus hijos. La familia se mudo hace 20 anos a vivir en Santa Maria en Jamastran, El Paraíso.


Narciso se dedica a la Microindustria siendo su especialidad la elaboración de bloques de concreto en diferentes medidas. Su fabrica de bloques es una de las mas fuertes en la zona de Santa Maria, donde actualmente se ha convertido en una Microempresa generando fuentes de empleo, en la actualidad la fábrica tiene tres empleados de manera permanente.

Además de vender el producto en el lugar donde se encuentra ubicada la fabrica de bloques, Narciso también tiene el servicio de acarreo de los mismo, ya que cuando el cliente compra el producto y no tiene en que transportarlo él brinda este servicio a otro costo adicional, el cual le genera otra fuente de ingresos adicional a su negocio.

Narciso y su esposa han sabido llevar hacia el camino del éxito esta fábrica de bloques que es muy conocida en la aldea de Santa Maria. Con el préstamo, Narciso comprara cemento y arena para la producción de bloques de cemento. Narciso utilizara las ganancias para expandir su negocio y así poder contratar mas personas en un futuro cercano.

 Don Heriberto reside en la Aldea de Santa Maria con su esposa e hijos. La esposa del Sr. Sánchez, se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y al cuidado de sus hijos. Con los ingresos que le ha generado  su negocio ha pagado los costos escolares de sus hijos mayores al igual que los gastos de la vivienda.

Heriberto tiene varios años de dedicarse al comercio. El sale a vender ropa americana nueva en un vehículo de su legítima propiedad, a las diferentes comunidades aledañas a Santa Maria.

Además de dedicarse a la venta de ropa, Heriberto también se dedica a negociar en su carro comprando y vendiendo granos básicos, plátanos, bananos y leña al igual que hacer pequeños fletes y acarreo de carga.

Heriberto utilizara el préstamo para comprar ropa nueva, granos básicos, plátanos, bananos y leña. Con las ganancias, Heriberto continuara apoyando a su hijo en su educación ya que su meta es ver a su hijo graduado para que sea un buen profesional y un hombre de bien.
texts.en:
The “Estrellas” (“Stars”) Communal Bank is made up of three businessmen who live in the village of Santa Maria in Jamastran, El Paraíso. The three members of the group are José Fermín B. Pavón, Narciso Méndez and Heriberto Sánchez. Don José is a single father. He has two children who are completely dependent on him. José B. has worked for several years, his primary activity being purchase and sales of basic grains, plantains, bananas, and a large variety of fruits and vegetables like chiles, tomatoes, cabbage, onions, potatoes, mangoes, watermelon, plums and other items. José goes out to sell his products in a car which he owns. His business consists of traveling to the mountains to buy bananas, plantains, corn and beans. Later he drives to the capital to bring the products to sell at Tegucigalpa's most well-known market, known as the “Mayoreo.” José takes advantage of his visit to the Mayoreo not only to sell his products, but also to buy products that are needed in his town. In this way, when José leaves Tegucigalpa, he brings a car full of products to sell in Santa Maria and the surrounding communities. José will use the loan to buy bananas, plantains, corn and beans. With the income that his business generates, José continues the struggle to help his family get ahead. Narciso Méndez is married and has 4 children, three of whom are still dependent on him. His wife takes care of the house and their children. The family moved 20 years ago to live in Santa Maria in Jamastran, El Paraíso. Narciso works in micro-industry, his specialty being the manufacture of concrete blocks in different sizes. His block factory is one of the strongest in the area of Santa Maria, where it has become a Microbusiness generating employment. Now the factory has three permanent employees. Besides selling his products at the block factory, Narciso also has a block hauling service. When a customer buys the products and has no means to transport them, he offers this service for an additional charge, which gives him another source of income for his business. Narciso and his wife have known how to bring this block factory, which is very well-known in Santa Maria, along the road of success. With the loan, Narciso will buy cement and sand for the production of cement blocks. Narciso will use the earnings to expand his business and hire more people in the near future. Don Heriberto lives in the Village of Santa Maria with his wife and children. Mr. Sánchez's wife takes care of the house and their children. With the income from his business, he has paid schooling costs for his elder children as well as living expenses. Heriberto has worked for many years. He goes out in a vehicle which he owns to sell new American clothing in the different communities on the outskirts of Santa Maria. Besides clothing sales, Heriberto also works from his car, buying and selling basic grains, plantains, bananas and firewood, as well as doing some small-scale hauling. Heriberto will use the loan to buy new clothing, basic grains, plantains, bananas and firewood. With the earnings, Heriberto will continue supporting his son's education since his goal is to see his son graduate so he can be a professional and be financially successful.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bananas, plantains, corn, beans, new clothing to sell, cement and sand

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco López Chavarría es un señor de 42  años de edad quien vive con su esposa y su hija en una comunidad llamada Canalete localizada en Upala en la provincia de Alajuela, es un lugar semi montañoso y sus actividades económicas se centran en la agricultura y mayormente en la ganadería. Es una comunidad con una gran oportunidad de desarrollo y establecimiento de microempresas, tanto de agroindustria como  comercio. 

Don Francisco  y su familia siempre se han  dedicado a la ganadería de doble propósito aprovechando tanto la carne como la producción de leche.  Comenta que es muy buen negocio ya que la demanda es bastante grande alta en la comunidad, y hoy  sus productos se venden a buen precio en especial la Leche. Comenta que gracias a este negocio tiene la posibilidad de enviar a su hijo al colegio.


Actualmente don Francisco    desea obtener un microcrédito  por ¢618.000 (seiscientos dieciocho    mil colones), para comprar  3  vacas para doble propósito, y compra los materiales necesarios para mejorar las condiciones de su corral, incluyendo alambre y semillas de pasto.

Don Francisco  es socio  de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
