Francisco López Chavarría is a 42 year old gentleman who lives with his wife and daughter in the community of Canalete, which is located in the town of Upala in Alajuela Province. This place is semi-mountainous and the local business activities are mostly livestock breeding and agriculture. The community provides a great opportunity for developing and establishing microenterprises in the agriculture and retail sectors.

Don Francisco and his family have always engaged in livestock breeding for the purposes of producing meat and milk. He says this is a very good business to be in since there is high demand in the community. Today his products sell at a good price, especially the milk. Thanks to this business, he says he has the chance to send his daughter to college.

At the moment, Don Francisco wants to obtain a microloan in the amount of 618,000 CRC so that he can buy three heads of cattle for meat and milk production. He will also buy materials needed for improving the conditions of his corral, including wire and grass seeds.

Don Francisco is a member of the Canalete Communal Credit Enterprise, one of 100 member organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan and he hopes to continue growing personally and financially. He also plans to be an active participant of his local credit organization.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase three heads of cattle & materials for making improvements to his corral

loans.name: Georgina Nancy

texts.es:
Georgina Nancy G. C. tiene 56 años. Tiene 5 hijos de 24 hasta 40 años, y vive en el cantón de Ventanas, en la provincia de Los Ríos. 

Georgina es una socia de la ventanilla rural Recinto San Ramón, que esta ubicada en Nuevo San Ramón, a 12 Km. de Ventanas. Son 20 socios en total, que están trabajando en la agricultura de corto ciclo (cosecha en 6 meses). Esto es el primer crédito que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa.

Georgina trabaja en la agricultura, cultivando maíz, arroz, y cacao. Hace sus ventas en el comercial García en Ventanas, cada 6 meses para maíz y arroz.

Solicita el préstamo para trabajar en agricultura: comprar fertilizantes, semillas, y abonos. Piensa que este crédito le ayudara a ingresar dinero porque ya no tiene. Su sueño es estar de buena salud. 

Le gustan manualidades en la casa.
texts.en:
Georgina Nancy G. C. is 56 years old and has five children between the ages of 24 and 40. She lives in the canton of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.

Georgina is a member of the Recinto San Ramón Communal Bank, which is located in Nuevo San Ramos, 12km outside of Ventanas. The group consists of 20 members who engage in short cycle agriculture (growing crops that can be harvested in six months). They are requesting their first loan from Cooperativa San José.

Georgina is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and cacao. She sells her products at the García Trading Center in Ventanas. The corn and rice are sold every six months.

She is requesting a loan to use for farming. Georgina plans to buy fertilizers, seeds, and compost. She believes this loan will help her earn money because she has none. Her dream is to be in good health.

Georgina enjoys making handicrafts at home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers, seeds, and compost

loans.name: José Alfredo

texts.es: José Alfredo Rodríguez G., tiene la edad de 49 años, está divorciado, y tiene 4 hijos de 1, 4,9 y 11 años de edad, son su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don José Alfredo también trabaja desde hace varios años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
José Alfredo Rodríguez G. is 49 years old he is divorced and has 4 children of 1, 4, 9 and 11 years old who are his main priority. The loan will be used to help his ranch, specifically his coffee crops by buying manure and fertilizer. He wishes to give his coffee crops the adequate care needed to have better quality and in that way have better earnings when it is harvest time. This will be his first loan with FUDECOSUR and is very happy with their help. Don José Alfredo has worked in agriculture some years. In the future he hopes to give his family a better quality of life and more economic stability and to keep growing in his personal and professional life.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For his ranch (coffee crops)

loans.name: Piedad De Jesús

texts.es:
Piedad de Jesús L. V. tiene 38 años. Vive en unión libre y tiene 2 hijos, Félix Antonio y Félix Javier. Ellos viven en el cantón de Ventanas, en la provincia de Los Ríos. 

Piedad es una socia de la ventanilla rural Recinto San Ramón, que esta ubicada en Nuevo San Ramón, a 12 Km. de Ventanas. Son 20 socios en total, que están trabajando en la agricultura de corto ciclo (cosecha en 6 meses). Esto es el primer crédito que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa.

Piedad se dedica a la agricultura, cultivando maíz, y a ama de casa. Hace sus ventas en Ventanas, cada 6 meses para maíz.
Solicita el préstamo para invertir en cultivos de ciclo corto (maíz): comprar insumos, semillas, y abonos. Piensa que este crédito le ayudara porque los intereses son cómodo y hay facilidad de pago (pagan solo al fin cuando tienen cosecha). Su sueño es dar estudios a sus hijos, y aumentar más su producción para su negocio y así poder solventar a su familia. Enfrente problemas de langostas en el maíz.

Le gusta lavar ropa y ayudar a sus hijos a hacer sus deberes.
texts.en:
Piedad de Jesús L. V. is 38 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children, Félix Antonio and Félix Javier. She lives in the canton of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.

Piedad is a member of the Recinto San Ramón Communal Bank, which is located in Nuevo San Ramos, 12km outside of Ventanas. The group consists of 20 members who engage in short cycle agriculture (growing crops that can be harvested in six months). They are requesting their first loan from Cooperativa San José.

Piedad is a homemaker and a farmer who grows corn. She sells her crops in Ventanas every six months.

She is requesting a loan to use for her short cycle crops of corn. Piedad plans to buy supplies, seeds, and composts. She believes this loan will help her because the interest rates are affordable and the payment schedule is simple (everything is repaid when the harvest is due). Her dream is to provide an education for her children, increase the production of her business, and be able to support her family. She must confront the problem of locusts that can attack her corn.

Piedad enjoys doing laundry and helping her children with their homework.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies, seeds, and compost for planting corn

loans.name: William

texts.es: William J. C., tiene la edad de 44 años, está casado, y tiene 3 hijos de 20,15 y 11 años de edad, son su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don William también trabaja desde hace varios años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
William J. C. is 44 years old; he is married and has 3 children who are 20, 15 and 11 years old and are his main priority. The loan will be used to help his ranch, specifically his coffee crops by buying manure and fertilizer. He wishes to give his coffee crops the adequate care needed to have better quality and in that way have better earnings when it is harvest time. This will be his first loan with FUDECOSUR and is very happy with their help. Don William has worked in agriculture some years. In the future he hopes to give his family a better quality of life and more economic stability and to keep growing in his personal and professional life.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For his coffee crops

loans.name: Sonia Beatriz

texts.es:
Sonia Beatriz R. C. tiene 38 años. Vive en unión libre con sus 5 hijos de 5 hasta 22 años, en el cantón de Ventanas, en la provincia de Los Ríos. 

Sonia es una socia de la ventanilla rural Recinto San Ramón, que esta ubicada en Nuevo San Ramón, a 12 Km. de Ventanas. Son 20 socios en total, que están trabajando en la agricultura de corto ciclo (cosecha en 6 meses). Esto es el primer crédito que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa.

Sonia se dedica a la agricultura, cultivando maíz y arroz. Hace sus ventas en Ventanas, cada 6 meses para maíz y arroz.

Solicita el préstamo para trabajar maíz y arroz: comprar insumos, semillas, y abonos. Piensa que este crédito le ayudara económicamente a tener el dinero que necesita. Su sueño es dar estudios a sus hijos para que sean alguien y que salen adelante. Se necesita capacitación para enfrentar lanchas en el maíz

Le gusta bordar en su tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Sonia Beatriz R. C. is 38 years old. She lives with her five children, ages ranging from 5 to 22, in the hamlet of Ventanas, in the Los Ríos province. Sonia is a member of the “La Ventanilla Rural Recinto San Ramón,” which is located in Nuevo San Ramón, 12 kilometers from Ventanas. There are a total of 20 members who work in short cycle farming (harvest within six months of planting). This will be the first loan they obtain through the cooperative. Sonia raises corn and rice and makes her sales of rice and corn in Ventanas every six months. She is asking for this loan in order to buy supplies, seeds, and fertilizer to raise the corn and rice. She believes that this loan will help her economically so that she will have the money that she needs. Her dream is to give her children an education so that they can become somebody and get ahead. She needs the capability to combat plant diseases in the corn. She likes to embroider in her spare time.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Farming supplies

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es: Freddy C. G., tiene la edad de 51 años, está casado, y tiene un hijo de 17 años de edad, es su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Freddy también trabaja desde hace varios años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Freddy C. G. is 51 years old; he is married and has a 17 year old son who is his main priority. The loan will be used to help his ranch, specifically his coffee crops by buying manure and fertilizer. He wishes to give his coffee crops the adequate care needed to have better quality products and in that way have better earnings when it is harvest time. This will be his first loan with FUDECOSUR and is very happy with their help. Don Freddy has worked in agriculture some years. In the future he hopes to give his family a better quality of life and more economic stability and to keep growing in his personal and professional life.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For  his coffee crops.

loans.name: Carlos Clemente

texts.es:
Carlos Clemente R. T. tiene 45 años. Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Ventanas, en la provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos de 20 y 22 años.

Carlos es un socio de la ventanilla rural Recinto San Ramón, que esta ubicada en Nuevo San Ramón, a 12 Km. de Ventanas. Son 20 socios en total, que están trabajando en la agricultura de corto ciclo (cosecha en 6 meses). Esto es el primer crédito que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa.

Carlos trabaja en la agricultura, cultivando maíz, arroz y cacao. Hace sus ventas en Ventanas y Puerto Pechicho cada 6 meses para arroz y maíz y vende cacao solo en pequeña cantidad. 

Solicita el préstamo para trabajar en los cultivos de verano, para comprar semillas y abonos. Piensa que este crédito le ayudara porque el interés es mínimo y le quedara bastante ganancia. Su sueño es dejar algo a sus hijos, trabajar más y dejar propio el cacao y maíz. Ahora tiene desafíos porque cae langosta en los cultivos. 

Le gusta descansar y cocinar en su tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Carlos Clemente R. T. is 45 years old and lives in the Ventanas hamlet, located within the Los Ríos province. He has two children, ages 20 and 22. Carlos is a member of the “La Ventanilla Rural Recinto San Ramón,” which is located in Nuevo San Ramón, 12 kilometers from Ventanas. There are a total of 20 members who work in short cycle farming (harvest within six months of planting). This will be the first loan they obtain through the cooperative. Carlos works as a farmer, raising corn, rice, and cacao. He sells his products in Ventanas and Puerto Pechicho, every six months for the corn and rice, but only small quantities of cacao. He is requesting this loan in order to work the summer season; to buy seed and fertilizer. He feels that this loan will be helpful because the interest rate is low and he will earn a good income. His dream is to leave something behind for his children and to be able to work more. He likes to cook and rest in his spare time.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Didier

texts.es: Didier V. E., tiene la edad de 38 años, está en unión libre, y un hijo de 8 años de edad, es su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Además, desea comprar una novilla, y así aumentar el número de animales que posee. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Didier trabaja desde hace varios años a la agricultura y al ganado . El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Didier V. E. is 38 years old, is in a common law marriage and has an 8 year old son who is his main priority. The loan will be used to help his ranch, specifically his coffee crops by buying manure and fertilizer. He wishes to give his coffee crops adequate care to have a better quality product so that when it is harvest time he will have better earnings. Didier also wants to buy a heifer to increase the animals that he has. This will be his first loan with FUDECOSUR and is very happy with their help. Don Didier for some years has worked in agriculture and with livestock. In the future he hopes to give his family a better quality of life and more economic stability and to keep growing in his personal and professional life.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For  his coffee crops and to buy a heifer.

loans.name: Pedro Orlando

texts.es:
Pedro Orlando C. B. tiene 47 años. Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Ventanas, en la provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 5 hijos de 9 hasta 27 años.

Pedro es un socio de la ventanilla rural Recinto San Ramón, que esta ubicada en Nuevo San Ramón, a 12 Km. de Ventanas. Son 20 socios en total, que están trabajando en la agricultura de corto ciclo (cosecha en 6 meses). Esto es el primer crédito que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa.

Pedro trabaja en la agricultura, cultivando maíz, arroz, plátanos y cacao. Hace sus ventas en Ventanas cada 6 meses para arroz y maíz y vende cacao y plátanos cada semana. 

Solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas, fertilizantes y abonos. Piensa que este crédito le ayudara a administrar bien su trabajo. Su sueño es sembrar más cacao. 

Le gusta descansar y pensar la planificación en el campo en su tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Pedro Orlando C. B. is 47 years old and lives in the Ventanas hamlet, located within the Los Ríos province. He has five children, ranging in ages from 9 to 27. Pedro is a member of the “La Ventanilla Rural Recinto San Ramón,” which is located in Nuevo San Ramón, 12 kilometers from Ventanas. There are a total of 20 members who work in short cycle farming (harvest within six months of planting). This will be the first loan they obtain through the cooperative. Pedro works as a farmer, raising corn, rice, bananas, and cacao. He sells his products in Ventanas and Puerto Pechicho, every six months for the corn and rice; and every week for bananas and cacao. He is requesting this loan in order to buy seed and fertilizer. He feels that this loan will help him to run his business well and hopes to be able to plant more cacao. He likes to rest and plan out his field in his spare time.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seed and fertilizer

loans.name: María Felícita

texts.es:
María Felicita es una madre de familia de 32 años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el sector Cultambo del distrito de San José, una zona eminentemente agrícola situada en la provincia de Pacasmayo, región La Libertad, ubicada a mas de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir para damas y caballeros en un pequeño establecimiento situado en su domicilio, ella adquiere su mercadería en la capital de su región (la ciudad de Trujillo) y la ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y conocidos, para asegurarse la demanda de sus clientes también trabaja en base a pedidos. Este negocio le sirve para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares ya que los ingresos que percibe como obrero no son suficientes para mantenerlos.

María desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas mercadería para poder ampliar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias que le permitan sacar a su familia adelante. Para lograr su objetivo ella ha creído pertinente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer responsable y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir adelante con su negocio para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. En la zona donde vive ella es muy conocida y respetada.
texts.en:
María Felicita is 32 years old and the mother. She lives with her family in the Cutambo sector, within the San Jose district. Cutambo is mainly an agricultural zone, situated within the Pacasmayo province, in the La Libertad region, located more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. She sells men’s and women’s clothing in a small shop located within her home. She buys her merchandise in the region’s capital (city of Trujillo) and offers it for sale to her neighbors and acquaintances. In order to ensure that she meets her customers’ needs, she also takes orders. This business allows her to help her husband with the family expenses, because the money he earns as a laborer is not enough to sustain them. María wants to expand her business by buying more merchandise to increase her sales and her income. This will permit her to move her family ahead. In order to meet her objective, she has seen fit to request her first loan of 700 PEN ($250) through Edpyme Alternativa. She is a very hard working and responsible woman. Her greatest desire is to move ahead with her business in order to improve her family’s quality of life. She is very well known and respected within her zone.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing for resale

location.town: Cultambo - San José - Pacasmayo - La Libertad

loans.name: Libia Gladis

texts.es:
Libia Gladis C. M. tiene 22 años. Es soltera y tiene un hijo de un año, Javier. Viven en el cantón de Ventanas, en la provincia de Los Ríos. 

Libia es una socia de la ventanilla rural Recinto San Ramón, que esta ubicada en Nuevo San Ramón, a 12 Km. de Ventanas. Son 20 socios en total, que están trabajando en la agricultura de corto ciclo (cosecha en 6 meses). Esto es el primer crédito que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa.

Libia se dedica a la agricultura, cultivando maíz y arroz. Hace sus ventas en Ventanas, cada 6 meses para maíz y arroz.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la agricultura: comprar insumos, semillas, y abonos. Piensa que con este crédito seria más cómodo para trabajar y le gusta que los intereses sean bajos. Su sueño es tener su casa y un poquito de tierra. 

Le gusta escuchar música y jugar en la casa con su hermana en su tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Libia Gladis C. M. is 22 years old. She is single and has a one year old son, Javier. They live in the hamlet of Ventanas, in the Los Ríos province. Libia is a member of the “La Ventanilla Rural Recinto San Ramón,” which is located in Nuevo San Ramón, 12 kilometers from Ventanas. There are a total of 20 members who work in short cycle farming (harvest within six months of planting). This will be the first loan they obtain through the cooperative. Libia is a farmer who raises corn and rice and makes her sales of rice and corn in Ventanas every six months. She is asking for this loan in order to buy supplies, seeds, and fertilizer. She believes that this loan will make it easier for her to work and she likes the fact that the interest rates are low. Her dream is to have her own house and a bit of land. In her spare time she enjoys listening to music and playing with her sister at home.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Farming supplies, seed, and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Display cases

loans.name: Clara Elizabeth

texts.es:
Clara Elizabeth V. A. tiene 26 años. Es casada y vive con su esposo y 3 hijos de 1, 3 y 7 años, en el cantón de Ventanas, en la provincia de Los Ríos. 

Clara es una socia de la ventanilla rural Recinto San Ramón, que esta ubicada en Nuevo San Ramón, a 12 Km. de Ventanas. Son 20 socios en total, que están trabajando en la agricultura de corto ciclo (cosecha en 6 meses). Esto es el primer crédito que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa.

Clara se dedica a la agricultura, cultivando maíz y arroz. Hace sus ventas en Ventanas, cada 6 meses para maíz y arroz.

Solicita el préstamo para trabajar maíz y arroz: comprar fertilizantes, semillas, y abonos. Piensa que este crédito le ayudara a sembrar por los ciclos cortos y porque sale más económico que las otras opciones de crédito que tienen. Su sueño es ayudar a sus hijos en los estudios.

Le gusta escuchar música en su tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Clara Elizabeth V. A. is 26 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and three children, ages 1, 3, and 7, in the Ventanas hamlet, located in the Los Ríos province. Clara is part of the “La Ventanilla Rural Recinto San Ramón,” which is located in Nuevo San Ramón, 12 kilometers from Ventanas. There are a total of 20 members who work in short cycle farming (harvest within six months of planting). This will be the first loan they obtain through the cooperative. Clara raises corn and rice and makes her sales of rice and corn in Ventanas every six months. She is asking for this loan in order to buy seeds, and fertilizer. She believes that this loan will help her to be able to plant in the short cycles and that it is more feasible than other methods of finance that she has available to her. She wants to be able to help her children with their education. She likes listening to music in her spare time.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es: Concepción tiene 70 años, ella tiene su medio de trabajo que es la venta y elaboración de tortillas y frijoles cocidos. Hace más de 31 años que tiene de poseer este negocio, pues sus inicios fueron muy difíciles, ya que no tenía el capital suficiente para salir adelante con su negocio, pues poco a poco es que ha ido creciendo con su actividad. No es la primera vez que realiza este financiamiento por lo que se siente muy contenta con tener esta oportunidad nuevamente. El  financiamiento que solicita es para la compra maíz, leña, frijoles entre otras cosas. Sueña con mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Concepción is 70 years old and works making and selling tortillas and beans. She had a difficult time starting out because she didn’t have the necessary capital, but she’s had this business now for more than 31 years and has grown it little by little. This is not the first time that she’s gotten a loan and she is very happy to have this opportunity once more. She will use the money from this loan to buy firewood, beans, and other things. She dreams of improving her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Antenor

texts.es:
Antenor, de 23 años, es un joven muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida. En la provincia de Chanchamayo, se encuentran las chacras de Antenor, sus tierras son amplias y con los cuidados que les brinda las ha convertido en uno de los cultivos mejores trabajados del poblado. Es por eso que cuando lleva a vender sus productos como plátano y café al mercado de la ciudad, obtiene muy buenos precios debido a la buena calidad de lo cosechado.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y hacerlas fértiles, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de la plagas que pueden afectar su plantas. Con el tiempo, desea comprar más tierras en otros poblados para así aumentar su producción y variar sus cultivos. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo puntualmente, si quiere acceder a otro crédito en el futuro. En su grupo comunal es un socio muy responsable y siempre esta pendiente de los acuerdos a los que llegan en el grupo. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras.
texts.en:
Antenor is 23 years old, he is a nice and hardworking young man, he lives in his parents home and what he wishes most for is to get ahead in life. His small farms are in the Chanchamayo province, his land is ample and with his care he has turned them into some of the best crops in the area. That is why when he goes to sell his products like bananas and coffee in the city’s market, he gets very good prices due to the quality of his crops.

What Antenor enjoys most of his work is sowing his land and making them fertile, he’s been working for 4 years and says that the most difficult part of taking care of his crops are the plagues that affect them. With time he wishes to buy more land in other areas to increase his production and have a variety of crops. This is his fourth loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner) and knows that he has to pay punctually if he wants future loans. In his communal group, Antenor is very responsible and is always mindful of the agreements made within the group. With the three thousand nuevos soles he will buy more manure and fertilizer to improve his land.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure to improve his crops.

loans.name: Raquel Francisca

texts.es:
Raquel de 35 años, vive en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil), ella vende cosméticos a sus vecinos y conocidos quiere en un futuro tener un local de venta de productos de uso personal. 

Comenzó a vender cosméticos debido a la falta de oportunidades que tenia, invirtió sus últimos ahorros y comenzó a vender a sus vecinas y conocidas, poco a poco obtuvo Ingresos para mantener a sus dos hijos de 9 y 2 años que estudian en escuelas fiscales.  

Para construir mejor su casa y así darles una mejor vida a sus hijos ella quiere comprar con el préstamo cementos y bloques , en el futuro quiere tener un local de cosméticos y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Raquel is 35 years old and lives in “Primavera de Duran” (a suburban zone with a dissolving ecology located outside of Guayaquil). She sells cosmetics to her friends and acquaintances and in the future she would like to have a shop where she can sell personal use products. She began selling cosmetics because of the lack of other opportunities. She invested her last savings and began selling to her neighbors and acquaintances. Little by little she earned income with which to support her two children, ages 9 and 2, who attend public school. In order to make improvements to her home and give her children a better life, she wants to buy cement and cinder blocks with her first loan. In the future she wants to have a cosmetics shop and finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Blanca Ninosca

texts.es:
Blanca de 31 años de edad, labora como docente de primaria desde hace 10 años en la Escuela Salomon Ibarra Mayorga ubicada en la colonia los Angeles, es madre soltera de un niño de 7 años de edad que estudia su primer grado de Primaria en la Escuela Mauricio cajina, ella cuando viaja todos los dias a las seis de la mañana ya le deja el desyuno hecho a su hijito y lo deja al cuido de su abuelita materna.  

Esta solicitando su 7mo credito para hecharle el piso a una habitaciòn y repellarla, para contar con mayor comodidad; su mayor sueño en la vida es seguir estudiando y que a su hijo no le falte nada, es importante mencionar que esta clienta es bien cumplida con sus compromisos y se caracteriza por ser honesta y muy trabajadora.
texts.en:
Blanca is 31 years old, and works as a primary school teacher at the Salomon Ibarra Mayorga School located in the Angeles colony. Blanca is a single mother to a 7 year old boy who is in first grade in the Mauricio Cajina school. She works everyday from six in the morning and leaves her son’s breakfast already made and leaves him in the care of his maternal grandmother.

This will be Blanca’s seventh loan which will be used to put a floor in the bedroom and finish plastering to have better comfort. Her biggest dream in life is to keep studying and that her son will not lack anything, it is important to note that the customer is very punctual with her responsibilities and is characterized as someone who is honest and very hardworking.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To put a floor in the bedroom and finish plastering.

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es:
Isidro tiene 47 años de edad, reside en San Rafael de Oriente, Departamento de San Miguel, es casado y tiene dos hijos los cuales son independeientes, vive solo con la esposa, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijoles.
El  cultivo de la tierra se los enseñaron los padres, tiene experiencia en el cultivo de maíz y frijoles, actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para compra de  Fertilizantes para cultivo de Maiz y frijoles que le permitan obtener una buena cosecha, el préstamo le ayudara para cubrir necesidades básicas. 
Las aspiraciones son cultivar la tierra para generar ingresos y sacar adelante la familia, contribuir a mejorar las condiciones de vida de la familia.
texts.en:
Isidro is 47 years old and lives in “San Rafael de Oriente” in the San Miguel department. He is married and has two adult children on their own. He lives with his wife and works as a farmer raising corn and beans. His parents taught him how to work the land and he is experienced in the raising of corn and beans. He is requesting a loan so that he can buy fertilizer for his corn and bean crop, which will help bring him a better harvest. The loan will help him cover his basic expenses. His aspirations are to work the land to earn an income, to move his family ahead, and to improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es: Maricela Rodríguez C., tiene la edad de 22 años, está en unión libre, y tiene un hijo de 1 año que es  su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Doña Maricela trabaja desde hace algunos años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Maricela Rodríguez C. is 22 years old and is in a common law marriage, she has a 1 year old son that is her main priority. The loan will be used to help her ranch, specifically to cultivate coffee, to buy manure and fertilizer. She wishes to give adequate care to her coffee crops to have a better quality product and earnings when it is harvest season. This is the first time that she gets a loan with FUDECOSUR (Kiva’s field partner) and is very happy with the help that they have given her. Mrs. Maricela has worked for some years in agriculture and in the future she hopes to give her family a better quality of life and economic stability as well as growing in her personal and professional life.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Help in cultivating coffee crops.

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es:
Mayra P. M. es una  señora  de 45  años de edad quien vive con 2 de sus 3 hijos  en una comunidad llamada La fuente  de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Provincia de Cartago.  Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche y siembra de café. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. La comunidad tiene paisajes muy pintorescos que combinan el bosque tropical con dos lindas lagunas, plantaciones de café y lecherías.
Doña Mayra tiene 5 años de ganarse la vida rentando sus apartamentos a estudiantes de la zona de Turrialba. Esto le ha permitido tener una fuente de ingresos con la cual ha sacado adelante a sus hijos, y está muy orgullosa  que también gracias a eso hoy  dos de ellos están estudiando en la universidad.
Sin embargo uno de sus apartamentos se encuentra en muy mal estado, y necesita repararlo para seguir rentarlo y seguir obteniendo ganancias, es por eso que necesita un préstamo de ¢350.000 (Trescientos cincuenta    mil colones) para la reparar la instalación eléctrica de un apartamento y arreglar otros detalles que le hacen falta para ser utilizado.
Doña Mayra  es socia de la ECC La Fuente Agrícola Empresarial, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su Primer  préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico.
texts.en:
Mayra P. M. is a 45 year old woman who lives with two of her three children in a community called “La Fuente de Santa Teresita de Turrialba,” in the province of Cartago. The population there produces milk and grows coffee. The terrain is irregular and much of it is tropical forest. The community has very picturesque landscapes which combine the tropical forest with two beautiful lakes, coffee plantations, and dairy farms. For the past five years, Ms. Mayra has been making a living renting out her apartments to students within the Turrialba zone. This has provided her with a source of income that has helped her to move her children ahead and she is very proud that two of them study at university. Never the less, one of her apartments is in bad condition and she needs to repair it so that she can continue renting it and earning income. She needs a loan of 3,500,000 CRC ($700) in order to make repairs to the electrical wiring and to other areas, so that the apartment can be used. Ms. Mayra is part of the “La Fuente Agricola Empresarial” communal bank, one of the 100 organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan and she hopes that it will allow her to continue to improve her personal and economic level.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Appartment repairs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more fertilizers to protect her land.

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es: Eulogia, de 62 años es una mujer que siempre ha luchado por sobresalir en la vida, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila. Desde muy pequeña Eulogia ha trabajado junto a sus padres en el cultivo de la tierra, con los años ha logrado comprarse sus propias chacras y ahora es una de las principales productoras de plátano y café de la provincia de Chanchamayo, lugar hasta donde llegan sus compradores para obtener sus cultivos. Disfruta mucho la actividad que realiza y lo que más le gusta es cuidar sus cultivos y lo hace con mucho cariño, lleva 42 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado, ya que es muy difícil encontrar camiones que quieran llevar los pesados sacos de café. Su mayor anhelo es comprarse nuevas tierras, con las cuales pueda incrementar su producción. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, está muy segura de poder pagar puntualmente todas sus cuotas, ya que siempre ha sido muy puntual. En su grupo comunal es una social muy alegre y solidaria. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para mejorar la productividad de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Eulogia is 62 years old and is woman who has always worked hard to get ahead in life, she lives in her own home and what she wishes for most is to have a pleasant old age. Since she was very little she worked with her parents tending to the crops and throughout the years she has been able to buy her own small farms and she is now one of the main producers of bananas and coffee in the Chanchamayo province where buyers go to buy her crops. She enjoys her work very much and what she enjoys most is taking care of her crops and she does it with great care. Eulogia has worked on the land for 42 years, what she considers most difficult is transporting her crops to the market since it is hard to find trucks that are willing to take heavy sacks of coffee. Her biggest wish is to buy new lands to increase her production. This is her fourth loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner) and is very sure in being able to pay all of her quotas on time since she is very punctual. In her communal bank, Eulogia is a very happy and supportive member. With the three thousand nuevos soles, she will buy more manure and fertilizer to improve her crops productivity.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to improve her crops.

loans.name: Ada Violeta

texts.es:
Ada tiene 49 años de edad y vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Chepén, un distrito agrícola de regular movimiento comercial, se encuentra ubicado en la provincia del mismo nombre, en la región La Libertad, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella es una mujer que siempre trata de trabajar de la mejor manera para progresar y sacar adelante a los suyos, por las mañanas vende carne de pollo en su vivienda y por las tardes vende papas rellenas (plato típico del país consistente en una masa frita de papa sancochada que previamente ha sido 'rellena' con carne, verduras y algunas especias), Ada cuenta con un grupo de clientes fieles que siempre acuden a su vivienda para adquirir los productos que ofrece. Estos negocios le permiten agenciarse de ingresos estables con los cuales saca adelante a su familia.

Ada desea ampliar su negocio de venta de carne de pollo adquiriendo mas mercadería, de modo que pueda captar mas clientes y aumentar sus ventas por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para sacar adelante a su familia. En la zona donde vive ella es una mujer bastante conocida y respetada por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Ada is 49 years old and lives with her family in the Chepén district; an agricultural district where business is regularly conducted. It’s located in the province of the same name, within the La Libertad region, one hour from the city of Chiclayo. She is a woman who is always looking for ways to work better to progress and move her family ahead. She sells poultry in the morning out of her home, and in the evening she sells stuffed potatoes (a typical national dish consisting of fried stewed potato dough that has been previously stuffed with meat, vegetables and spices). Ada has regular customers who regularly visit her house to buy the products that she offers. These businesses allow her to earn stable incomes with which she moves her family ahead. Ada would like to expand her poultry business by acquiring additional merchandise in order to attract more customers. She is requesting her first loan of 1, 500 PEN ($550) through Edpyme Alternativa. Her greatest desire it to be able to continue working to move her family ahead. She is very well known and respected by her neighbors and acquaintances.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Poultry

loans.name: Arnoldo Antonio

texts.es:
Don Arnoldo es padre de familia de tres hijos, tiene la edad de 52 años, cuenta con su propio negocio con varios años de trabajar para lograr el equilibrio en su pulpería, que junto con su esposa  trabajan para lograr dar un buen servicio.
Como todo negocio hay días buenos en ventas, mas en fechas de pago de cada mes. Lo dificultoso es que a veces no se ha recogido todo el dinero para ir a comprar la mercadería que falta lo que sus ventas bajan por falta de productos.
Es por eso con este préstamo desea comprar variedad de productos de los cuales se consumen  diariamente y que es de necesidad. 
Comprara: quintal de frijoles, arroz, azúcar, maíz, harina, cajas de jabón ase, productos lácteos, leche, queso, huevo, golosinas, gaseosas, jugos entre otros. 
Entre sus planes es seguir mejorando el local, a si como introducir productos de consumo que genere el objetivo propuestos en ganancias.
texts.en:
Don Arnoldo is a father to three children; he is 52 years old and has his own business working on his general store with his wife, they provide good service to their customers.

As with any other business there are good days for sales, especially during pay season each month. The problem is that sometimes they have not collected all the money to buy the merchandize which means that sales go down by the lack of merchandize.

With this loan, Don Arnoldo wants to buy a greater variety of products which are consumed daily and are basic household goods.

He will buy: 100 lbs of beans, rice, sugar, maize, flour, boxes of ase soap, milk foodstuff, milk, cheese, eggs, candy, refreshments, juices among other things.

His future plans include to keep improving his store as well as include new products for his customers that will help his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of products such as: 100 lbs of rice, beans, maize, sugar, crates of oil, boxes of soap, candy, refreshments, milk foodstuff, among other products to have better sales.

loans.name: Franglen

texts.es: Franglen, de 31 años, es un hombre muy alegre y trabajador, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. El arduo trabajo que Franglen realiza en sus chacras, le ha traído como resultado una buena producción, ya que sus plantaciones de plátano y café, han sido cosechadas y recolectadas en abundancia y de muy buena calidad.  Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que siente que sus esfuerzos están dando frutos, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus sembríos de la plaga, ya que éstos pueden perjudicar en el desarrollo de su producción. Con el tiempo espera comprar más tierras para incrementar su cosecha. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que poner todo de su parte y trabajar muy duro para pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y esta dispuesto a hacerlo. En su grupo comunal es un socio muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetado. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará abono, para mejorar su producción.
texts.en:
Franglen is 31 years old, he is a very happy and hardworking man, he lives in his own home and what he wants most is to improve his quality of life. The hard work that Franglen does on his small farms have given him good results on his crop production, his crops are of bananas and coffee they have been harvested and collected in abundance and are of very good quality. What he enjoys most about his work is harvesting his land since he feels that his efforts provide results. Franglen has been working for 10 years and considers that the most difficult part is taking care of his crops from plagues since they can hurt the development of his production. In the future, he wants to buy more land to increase his harvest. This is his first loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner) and he knows that giving his all and working very hard to pay punctually his quotas is important and he will do it. In his communal group, he is a very responsible member which is why he is very respected. With the thousand nuevos soles that he is asking for he will buy fertilizer to improve his production.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to improve his production.

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.es:
José  tiene 48 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Lolotiquillo, departamento de Morazán, está acompañado, y se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijoles.
Hace 20 años aprendió a trabajar la tierra, lo padres le inculcaron el trabajo y actualmente esta cultivando maíz y frijoles, solicita un préstamo para compra de fertilizante y espera obtener un cultivo que le permita vender una parte y  otra para consumo de la familia, generar ingresos para solventar las necesidades básicas del familia.
Los sueños son mejorar la vivienda y además continuar con un negocio que le permita mejorar el sistema de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
José is 48 years old and lives in the town of Lolotiquillo, in the Morazán department. He is married and raises corn and beans. He learned how to work the land 20 years ago. His parents started him on this work an now he is raising corn and beans. He is asking for this loan in order to buy fertilizer. He hopes to be able to obtain a large enough harvest so that he can use part of it to feed his family and sell the rest to earn an income with which to provide for his family’s basic needs. He hopes to be able to make improvements to his home, continue with his business, and improve his family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bricks, cement, hired workers and zinc.

loans.name: Balbina

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Balbina A. la esta haciendo falta impermeabilizar el techo de su casa ya que este en muy malas condiciones.
Desea repararlo entes de que llegue la temporada de invierno, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la mejora. Es por eso que esta solicitando un préstamo y planea pagarlo con el ingreso que obtiene como limpiando casa. 
Ya que su hijo el joven  Federico Garcia A. le ayuda con los gastos familiares con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo como guardia de seguridad.
texts.en:
The roof over Ms. Balbina A.’s home needs to be waterproofed because it is in bad shape. She would like to repair it before winter, but she does not have the money. This is why she is requesting this loan, which she plans to repay out of the money she earns by cleaning houses. Her son, Federico Garcia A., helps her with the family expenses with the money he earns from his job as a security guard.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Roof repair

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Ena

texts.en:
Ena is a 56-year-old mother of five who lives in Puntarenas, located on the pacific coast of Costa Rica. Ena lives with her son, two granddaughters and a young woman who helps with domestic tasks. Ena has a business selling clothes. Her business is located in the center of Puntarenas; however, her business is not limited to this locale. Ena also has clients in Nicoya, Guanacaste, Playa Samara and Garza. She sells all types of clothes: for children, men, women, sports clothing, intimate clothing, casual and dress clothes. Ena knows her clients depend on her, which is why she has located her inventory and main selling point in a central location.

Ena plans to use this loan to finance the purchase of shirts both for men and children. She has a contact that has guaranteed her a good price. All she needs is an increase in working capital to take advantage of this favorable rate. At the moment, Ena has very low inventory levels, which is why this loan will help her to increase her supply.

Ena is a hardworking entrepreneur. She wakes up early at 4:30 AM to carry out the tasks of maintaining the household. At 7:00 AM she heads to Puntarenas, 10 Kilometers from her house, where she sets up her selling post in the center of the city. Ena works from 10 AM to 5 PM. After work, she heads to night classes where she is working towards the completion of primary school. 

Ena has the goal of purchasing a car by the end of the year. She hopes to earn enough money to be able to financially support the studies of her grandchildren, as well as make home improvements. A major obstacle for Ena has been going through the application process for the necessary legal permits she needs in order to sell from her location in Puntarenas. As a result of her perseverance, she has been able to secure the permits, increase her income and the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: To purchase men´s and children´s shirts.

loans.name: Jorge Dennis

texts.es:
Jorge es un padre de familia de 38 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en el distrito de San José de la provincia de Pacasmayo, una zona ubicada en la región La Libertad, a mas de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace tres años a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para utilizarla en labores de transporte), el brinda este servicio dentro de su localidad durante la mayor parte del día, en la zona la demanda está asegurada porque el servicio es bastante accesible.

Jorge se ha esforzado al máximo para sacar adelante a su actividad y con mucho esfuerzo ahora cuenta con dos unidades para brindar sus servicios, el alquila una y maneja otra. Su esposa trabaja lavando ropa y con lo que ambos ganan tratan de sacar adelante la economía familiar.

Jorge desea brindar mantenimiento a sus unidades móviles para que estas puedan seguir funcionando de modo correcto, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles. El ya ha tenido préstamos anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Jorge is 38 years old and a father who lives with his wife and two children in the San José district of the Pacasmayo province; an area located in the La Libertad region, more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. For the past three years he’s been providing freight and passenger transportation services with his “mototaxi” (a kind of three wheeled taxi that has a compartment in the back that is used for holding passengers or cargo). He provides this service within his neighborhood throughout most of the day. There is sure demand within the zone because his service is very accessible. Jorje has worked hard to move his business ahead. His hard work has paid off and now he has two units with which to provide service. He drives one himself and leases the other out. His wife works washing clothes and they try to move their family ahead economically by combining their incomes. Jose would like to perform maintenance on his mobile units, so that they will continue to work properly. He has requested a loan of 2,000 PEN ($725) through Edpyme Alternativa. He has had previous loans through our institution and has demonstrated his responsibility by making his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase various catalogue products.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Maria Isabel G. y su esposo el señor Clemente Delgado tienen dos hijas que actual mente están estudiando y desean que terminen estudios. 
En este momento tiene que pagar las inscripciones y útiles, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para cubrir esta necesidad.
Es por eso que están solicitando nuevamente su cooperación para este crédito ya que han tenido dos préstamos con KIVA.  
Planean pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene Doña Maria Isabel de su trabajo en una fábrica, ya que Don Clemente se encargara de los gastos familiares con el sueldo que recibe como albañil.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria Isabel G. and her husband, Mr. Clemente Delgado, have two daughters. Both attend school and [Maria and Clemente] would like them to complete their studies. At the moment then need to pay for tuition and school supplies, but they don’t have the money. They are asking for your cooperation once again. They have had two previous loans through Kiva. They plan to repay this loan with the income that Ms. Maria Isabel receives from her job in a factory. Mr. Clemente takes care of the family expenses with the income he receives while working as a mason.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tuition and school supplies

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris es una madre de familia de 42 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a un hijo en el sector Señor de Sipán, una zona urbano – marginal de la ciudad de Lambayeque, una zona de regular movimiento comercial ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en un puesto ubicado dentro del mercado central de la ciudad, actualmente lleva vendiendo mas de once años en ese lugar y cuenta con una clientela fidelizada que siempre se acerca a adquirir los productos que ofrece, para mantener a sus clientes trata de brindarles productos de buena calidad y un trato amable.

Doris desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas productos de modo que pueda ampliar su negocio y captar mas clientes asimismo poder aumentar sus ventas, para lograr este objetivo se ha propuesto solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Doris es una mujer honesta y que siempre da lo mejor de si para salir adelante y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Doris is a 42 year-old mother who lives with her husband and her son in the Señor de Sipán neighborhood, an urban area on the outskirts of the city of Lambayeque. This is an area where there is a lot of commercial activity, located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Doris sells groceries from a stall located inside the central market in the city. She has been selling from this spot for more than 11 years, and she has a loyal clientele that always comes to purchase the products that she offers. To keep her customers, she tries to provide them with good quality products and friendly service. Doris wants to expand her business by purchasing more products so that she can attract more customers and increase her sales. To achieve this objective, she has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 Peruvian soles. Doris is an honest woman who always gives her best in order to get ahead and improve the quality of life for her family. She has worked previously with our institution, and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy groceries to expand her business selling groceries from a stall in the market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and ingredients for the production of chili peppers.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma D. is from the village of Owaon. She is 54 years old and is married with two adult children. Elma owns and operates a general store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Elma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Elma is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to repair her house. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. She also plans to use any additional revenue generated from her business to make improvements to her house. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline I. is from the village of Upper Bandera. She is 51 years old and is married with four adult children. Evangeline owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Evangeline joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,500 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline B. is from the village of Sinaman, Dipolog City. She is 53 years old and is married with four adult children. Evangeline owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately PHP 3,000 a month. In 2007, Evangeline joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of PHP 5,000 from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of PHP 6,000 which will again be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her 8th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

location.town: Sinaman, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.use: For the purchase of seeds and nutrients necessary for the production of chili peppers

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en: Leonila A. is from the village of Nazareth, Osmeña, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 52 years old and is widowed with two adult children. Leonila owns and operates a a food stall, selling fruits and vegetables, herbs and spices in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately PHP 6,000 a month. In 2008, Leonila joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of PHP 6,000 from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Leonila is requesting a new loan of PHP 6,000 which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Crispina Japus Group

texts.en:
Crispina J. is from the village of Katipunan, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old and is the group leader of this two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both collectively responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if they are delinquent or default. The official name of this borrowing group is Crispina J. Group.

Crispina is married and has five school-aged children. She owns and operates a business planting and harvesting corn for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Crispina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

Crispina is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. 


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Mrs. Sameam Horm Village Bank Group

texts.en: Twenty-one people live in Pou Preah Sang village, Takeo province and they are made up a village bank president. Mrs. Sameam H. is a bank president who was born in 1962, selected by the other members who will use portion of their loan for varied ways to support her businesses. She is a farmer who owns one-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to support her family while her husband, Mr. Saren Laut, is a Khmer cake maker. Through this activity, both them support three children, one of who is a tailor, while the others are studying in local public school. Her problem is that her child’s sew is too old to use. So to solve this problem, Mrs. Sameam H. is applying for a loan to buy a new sewing machine to instead the old one and rest of the loan she buys some piglets for breeding to start a new business.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha M. is from the village of Rizalina, Rizal. She is 45 years old and is married with five school-aged children. Editha owns and operates a business planting assorted crops and selling her harvested crops in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-one years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Editha joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Editha is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to redeem her pawned land. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To redeem her pawned land

loans.name: Tita

texts.en: Tita G. is from the village of Minlasag, Sibutad. She is 48 years old and is married with three adult children. Tita owns and operates a business raising and selling pigs in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Tita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Tita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will again be used as additional working capital for her business. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Boek

texts.en: Mrs. Boek S. 45 years old and she is a villager who lives in Trapeang Snao village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 1.50-hectares of land to cultivate rice. For this farm, she decided to ask for a loan to add her saving to buy agri machine to support her farming crop. Aside from farmer she is also rice middleman who is able to earn a small income to support her three children. Her husband, Mr. Hen Un, is a laborer who is also able to receive a little salary to hold up his family living. This couple has three children, who all are students in the local school.

loans.use: To add her saving to buy agri machine

loans.name: Srei Mom

texts.en: Mrs. Srei Mom N. 31 years old and is a villager who lives in Angk Prasat village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Rorn Soun, are farmers who own 2-hectares of land to cultivate rice. In order to support this farm, Mrs. Srei Mom N. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay for hire laborer to plow her farm and the rest of the loan she wants use to buy six piglets for breeding. Aside from farmer, Mr. Rorn Soun is also laborer who is able to receive a little salary to hold up his family living. This couple has two children; one is attending in the local school while another one is 4 years old. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay for hire laborer to plow her farm

loans.name: Mrs. Saroeurn Tey Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Saroeurn T. is a village bank president who lives in Pou Preah Sang village, TaK. province in which it has seventeen people who are also made up a village bank loan. All the members will use portion of their loan for varied ways to support their businesses. Mrs. Saroeurn T. is a farmer who owns a half-hectare of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family and aside this she is a pig breeding. Since her breeding pig is going well she wants to expand. So to improve breeding pig, Mrs. Saroeurn T. is seeking for a loan to bU. more piglets to breeding. She is widow with a child who is a student.

loans.use: To buy more piglets to breeding

loans.name: Chroeun

texts.en: Mr. Chroeun U., 49 years old and he is a villager who lives in Bam village, Takeo province. He and his wife, Mrs. Pok Kaen, are farmers who own 3-hectares of land to cultivate rice and they are also farmers who very hard to support their four children. Aside from farmer, Mr. Chroeun U. is also rice wine maker and his wife is a pig breeder at home. With these occupations they are able to earn a small income to support their family. In order to support these occupations, Mr. Chroeun U. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to cultivate rice and to buy piglets and pig food for his wife breeding. This couple has four children; who all are students and also support their parent businesses. His wife in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to cultivate rice and to buy piglets and pig food for his wife breeding.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria C. is from the village of Kidahon, Malinao, Gingoog City. She is 36 years old, married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Gloria owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products and also planting and selling different kinds of vegetable in the local community. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2003, Gloria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 11th loan taken out by Gloria from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her shop. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.
